Reviews.Title: “Let's talk about Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Blazin65
Reviews.Content: There's lot's of reviews on this hotel that talk about the proximity to restaurants and bars and attractions so there's no need for me to comment about that. But I have to make some comment since I'm hooked on Trip Advisor. I'm one of those who can't believe hotel prices are sky high now compared to 15 years ago. It's a good thing I've got a job. My friend and I paid about $269 per night + taxes of course, so $300 per night. Room was two double beds harbor view. Was this hotel worth $300 per night for middle class folks like me, my answer would be yes. Clean, very updated furnishings, excellent staff throughout, and all the other things people speak of outside of the hotel itself. The only drawback to me was no hot tub. But that will not keep me from rating 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect outside, more iffy on the inside”
Reviews.Author: ubmagus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days for leisure and tourism. The location and views and convenience is unmistakably outstanding. Hard pressed to get a better location in the Inner Harbor than this Marriott. The rooms were quality but far from luxury. Perhaps if the beds were more comfortable, this would rank higher from a value perspective. Otherwise one of the better hotels in this area. Notes: 1. Daily internet charges are around $12 but allows connections to multiple devices (laptop, phone, tablet) 2. Valet is expensive $40 3. The self serve food is not good 4. Indoor pool is actually quite nice, heated, cleaned and lifeguard on duty 5. 50/50 mix of families and business guests

Reviews.Title: “prime location”
Reviews.Author: RV3_12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for leisure while venturing around Baltimore and the location is great! Taxi was easy to get and walking distance to shopping and many restaurants (very close to Little Italy) and try James Joyce Irish Pub and Mo's Crab and Pasta Factory. Also I didnt realize Pier Six Pavilion was right next to the hotel which I def plan on coming back for a concert and staying here again. The room was clean and the view was awesome; some water and some city...great sight at night too! The staff was friendly and helpful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbor Views”
Reviews.Author: MMU1999
Reviews.Content: Certainly will give you a top view of the Baltimore scenery, with the harbor view of course. A very nice, clean and well located. Good restaurant choices within walking distance for both business and family options. Concierge recommended Mo's Seafood and Pasta a few blocks away in Little Italy. It was what it looked like, a neighborhood pasta joint with good seafood. Self parking will save a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel serves it's purpose..”
Reviews.Author: NaliniU
Reviews.Content: I stayed here overnight during a recent weekend trip to Baltimore. Let's start with parking. Valet is $40 daily and self park is $26. We did the self park and it was pretty convenient. You can enter the hotel through the garage walkway. Check in was really fast. The room and the bathroom were average, nothing special to talk about. I had a double bed room bc king room upgrades were a $120 upgrade fee. The view was city view, not impressive (room 2160). Location was good, a 15 minute walk from power plant live. I have stayed at the renaissance in inner harbor and their location is better in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: toomanypets5
Reviews.Content: We were there at a volleyball tournament at the convention center. Walked there every day and everywhere else we went. Location is great for dining, nightlife, shopping and sightseeing. The service at the hotel was top notch, everyone was accommodating, friendly, efficient and intelligent. We had a great time, we will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Creeker2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights for a conference. The location is magnificent, the heart of the Inner Harbor, on the doorstep of Little Italy, with great views of the harbor and downtown Baltimore. This place is tuned for discriminating travelers who value a little extra luxury and don't mind paying for it (or get it covered on a business expense account). If you're generally satisfied with a Motel 6 or even Hampton Inn, you probably won't want to consider the Marriott Waterfront unless you can score a significant discount from the usual rates that start at about $250. Internet connection is an extra $12.95/day, parking is another $25-40/day - whew. However ... What a fine experience! Everyone on staff for the hotel and conference did a terrific job, friendly and helpful. The public spaces are spacious and grand, accommodations are plush, the overall ambiance is luxurious. I departed feeling pampered and satisfied. If I could find a good deal, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: Cara H
Reviews.Content: My almost week-long stay here for a conference was thoroughly enjoyable. Although I did not have a harbor view, the city view from the 20th floor was also impressive, especially at night. Because I was registered for the conference, my internet service was included. Had I been required to pay full price, plus parking, plus $12.95 per night for wireless, I'd probably be a bit miffed. (But then again, this isn't a place that fits our family budget.) I couldn't be pressed to find fault with the service of one single employee. Everyone had a genuine smile and the helpfulness was absolutely beyond reproach. Kudos to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hopping Place!”
Reviews.Author: JenTaylor31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. It was a busy place with two galas, a volleyball tournament, etc. There area has some great restaurants near by as well as shops and botiques. There is a Whole Foods and CVS within a couple of blocks walk. You are close to Baltimore's Little Italy and a good stroll to the Inner Harbor area. Although super busy the hotel itself wasn't noisy up on the floors. There were several school and volleyball groups there as well. A coffee shop in the lobby serves Starbucks and light snacks. I only had my morning coffee as we did not eat in the hotel. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful with our needs. I even saw one front desk staff member keep his cool with a difficult guest. I was very impressed with the way he handled a difficult situation that wasn't his fault......just a cranky guest! Our room was CLEAN and the beds were very comfortable. We had a handicap accessible room. My issues about to be stated are NOT with the hotel itself but with handicap design over all. IF you don't need or use a handicap room then the following won't apply to you. I wish there had been more handicap bars in the shower area. This roll in shower had a small flexible lip that helped contain water but design in all hotels we stay in water still gets everywhere. Why aren't the shower curtains to the floor?That 2-3 inch gap only allows water to get everywhere. The floors in handicap bathrooms are always slick and not good for somebody with mobility issues. I wish there were a fold down seat for the vanity area like there is in the shower. My husband needs to sit when brushing his teeth, etc. We always have to drag in the office chair from the desk for him to sit on. Luckily the beds in this room were the perfect height. The trend lately is for high profile beds which are hard for disabled people to get into. The beds were clean and comfortable. Again, we had a lovely stay at this hotel and would chose it again if in the Baltimore area!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BONEZS
Reviews.Content: Great service great food awesome view just great people full of service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: surlymermaid
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights for a conference held at the hotel. Upon arrival I was able to check-in early with no trouble. I had a room on the 14th floor with a beautiful view of the harbor. All the staff were very friendly and helpful; for example I asked if the cafe/gift shop area sold Tylenol and one of the staff walked me over and pointed out the options to me. Also I asked to switch rooms after the third night (my first room was one of those optional adjoining rooms and the guys in the next room had no concept of "indoor voice") so the woman at the front desk moved me to a room on the 32nd floor with no fuss. Apparently the rooms on the 32nd floor are slightly nicer and are given to Marriott members with certain point statuses. Here are the differences: the room size and furniture was the same but the bathroom had extra toiletries (body wash, cotton swabs), a bath mat, a bamboo cutting, and a terry cloth bathrobe. There was also an ipod clock radio. Both rooms had Keurig coffee makers and minifridges. The rooms themselves were pleasant and quiet with good lighting and a very comfortable bed. The location of the hotel is ideal for exploring Baltimore. It's right on the water and there are several attractions and restaurants located within an easy 5-15 minute walk. I enjoyed several walks around the harbor. Wireless internet is available free in the lobby but is 12.95 a day, standard for this class of hotel. The hotel pool looked very nice and the fitness room was clean and had plenty of cardio equipment and a few weight machines and dumbbells. I would definitely stay in this hotel again if I were in the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “I never give 5's”
Reviews.Author: harryjwild
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the exception. After 1.5 weeks on the road for business travel what a treat it was to fins this hotel. Right near Mo's too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Baltimore Waterfront Marriott. Would definitely stay again. Had a room on the 17th Floor with a harbor view that was stunning, day and night. The room was very comfortable with a nice large flat screen TV and a small refrigerator. The staff was very professional and friendly. There is a restaurant, bar, and coffee shop with sandwiches, pastries, etc open most of the time. The best of all was the location. Directly on the water. Within a 5 - 10 minute walk to everything such as good restaurants, Whole Foods, movie theater, shopping mall, National Aquarium which we also enjoyed thoroughly, the Science Center, the Visitors Center, and Little Italy and Fells Point. Only down side was extras cost alot such at the Internet in the Business Center was 8.00 for 15 minutes! Of course we didn't use it and parking was very expensive also. All and all, a great tourist hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too Pricey”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed @ this hotel 3 times while attending conferences....it's a beautiful facility with wonderful waterview rooms in the most expensive areas of the hotel.....but overall, it's just too pricey if you're footing the bill yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Valentines Day Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: mjharmon
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend at the Marriott Waterfront the weekend before Valentines Day and had a wonderful stay. The room was clean and spacious and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Annie from concierge was absolutely amazing and took our stay to the next level. She kept in contact with me and arranged for chocolate covered strawberries w/ champagne to be delivered to our room as well as rose petal turn down service. She was a true pleasure to work with and you can tell she cares about guests experiences and has amazing customer service. The hotel is in a pefect location and has great service. Highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “What's with the plumbing?”
Reviews.Author: hungrytraveler0
Reviews.Content: Turned on hot water for shower and the pipes started to vibrate inside the walls. Really weird and at 6am when neighbor in next room took hot shower it was very noisy. Great views. We attended a conference and their kitchen accommodated a wide range of dietary needs --- gluten free, lactose free, sugar free....vegetarian. It was great conference food! Yes, great conference food! Not sure why they had hot apple cider in the lobby. On a hot spring day... Pool was also warm, almost 88 degrees. With a lifeguard. Huh? It was typical indoor hotel pool...good enough but not necessary to have a lifeguard. Would I stay there if I was paying the bill myself? Maybe...it is in the middle of Little Italy, close to all the good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Waterfront Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: cw413
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention here. The convention facilities are lovely and able to accommodate a large event. The lobby is busy, but there is plenty of help available. This is also a great spot for tourists to stay because it is easy to be a pedestrian from this location. The hotel room was rather dated. The air conditioning did not work, and I asked for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week (business) and although the interior is a little dated the staff make up for it in bucket loads. For example, swam in the pool (or should I say slide when my feet hit the bottom) and then found one of the wall mounted under water lights was at the bottom of the pool with exposed wires. Climbed out and told the lifeguard who said it had been reported the day before. Decide not to swim. Went back 2 days later and the PH was spot on, the slippery bottom removed plus the light had been fixed. Meals, I just cant complain! The prices were great and the options in the restaurant and bar met my needs. The bar staff were EXCELLENT and really helped me make good choices for meals. Breakfast was awesome but the sizes were more than I needed. Parking was expensive but even when I had problems using the multi stay card the staff in the car park and the hotel were awesome. The rooms, large and met the needs of place to eat. A little dated now but hey I would rather have this than poor service. In room movies were nice but at $17 it was a bit pricey. For those of us that like to jog the options around the harbour are many and as you are running with a lot of other joggers it was a great time. This for me a plus and really made my stay a pleasure. Weekend option was a drove to Greenfield and caught the train to DC - what a great day that was. Very cold but with good light weight coat it was easy. Things you can do are walk (me), use the bicycle hire (London Boris bikes), Segway tour or public transport. Really enjoyed this. Will I be back, YES!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MountainGhost
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in a Harbor View Room. The stay was pleasant and the room was clean. Nice hotel and cordial staff. Location is excellent and everything was in walking distance. $26.00 to park overnight??

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: global2AlbanyNY
Reviews.Content: I spend 70 plus nights in hotels. This is a great one. Right on the water, close to great shopping and restaurants, great for walking around and the staff is attentive and professional. Beautifully decorated and uber-clean. Despite the fact there appeared to be many guests, the halls were quiet throughout the night, and my room was close to the elevator. Parking is pricey - $26 overnight in the city-owned lot adjacent to the hotel. I'll be back. Any place that can make me feel welcomed and relaxed while I'm working hard away from home is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice waterfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: jandrfas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week long business conference. Normally I stay in Hilton properties but this hotel was booked for me as part of the conference package. I must say though that this is a fine property and if it wasn't for my Hilton HHonors status I would pick this hotel in a heartbeat if I was traveling on my own. The hotel is situated right on the waterfront, so nice views of the inner harbor if you're lucky enough to have a room on that side of the building. Otherwise you look out over the city, which is not a bad view by any means but not terribly exciting either. The rooms were nice and well appointed and the bed was quite comfortable. I definitely got some quality sleep. There are also some nice restaurants within easy walking distance. I was there in December when it was quite cold, so I only left the building a couple times over a 4 day period. That was ok - the conference rooms were quite nice and the service from the hotel/conference facility staff was superb. The only one complaint I have is a minor one and may have had more to do with the way my group booked its conference...lunch was basically the exact same thing all four days I was there. It was good, no complaints about the food quality at all, but there literally was no difference in what was on the lunch table on any given day. A little variety would have been nice. I only ate in the hotel restaurant once, and it was for breakfast on the first day before my conference started. I found the restaurant to be fine but not spectacular, and a bit overpriced (although that is not at all unusual for a hotel of this type). All in all a very nice stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the service made the difference”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl99
Reviews.Content: I had read the good reviews and was expecting a nice stay. Not only did this hotel meet my expectations, it far exceeded them because the service just made the difference. Here's what I mean... When I checked in, the desk clerks were smiling and one was even singing. They seemed genuinely happy to be there and to assist. They offered information, recognized my gold status, and walked me over to the correct set of elevators. In addition, I visited the concierge lounge several times during my stay. The attendants were friendly, personable, helpful, and went out of their way to make sure you had all you needed. So, yes the room was clean. The location on the waterfront was pretty. The bed was comfortable. The food in the concierge lounge was good (dinner, snacks, and breakfast). But it was the people who made the difference. I would most definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to club floor”
Reviews.Author: McLeanGuy
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here as I was upgraded to the club floor upon arrival and also given the choice of a welcom gift for being gold. The club floor was very large with great views and an awesome staff some. Some nights there was an open bar other nights, heavy appitizers and one morning an omelette station. Great location right next/in inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Day with The Kids”
Reviews.Author: Franherdo
Reviews.Content: We went to inner harbor Baltimore Md. the hotel had a great view of the Harbor, Aquarium, Restaurants all within walking distance. It was a great couple of days with the kids. By the way the deal for Breakfast was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: dctrentster
Reviews.Content: The new Marriott is in a great location; on the point between the inner harbor and Fells Point and just a couple blocks from Little Italy. The area seems to be where the new money and energy are being invested and it’s easy to see why. Great views, calmer traffic, with all the best of Baltimore within walking distance. As for the hotel, it’s a great place with omnipresent staff there to help with whatever your needs. The lobby was expansive and rich. Perhaps one of the best hotel exercise rooms and indoor pools I’ve seen. The rooms were well appointed albeit a bit on the smaller scale. Oddly enough, we found the beds reminiscent of a lumpy hammock. All-in-all, this would be the hotel I’d choose to go back to for my next stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “A Baltimore Bedrock”
Reviews.Author: MSelmi
Reviews.Content: A distinctive Marriott, with a quiet sophistication and some of the better service you will experience at this chain. It's a centralized, convenient location on the water and the harbor views are memorable. The rooms are spotless and the decor is well-appointed. Like most Marriott's, the dining is forgettable at best, so a trip outside will be well rewarded. There are half a dozen decent restaurants across the street and all the best of Baltimore is but a short cab ride away. Like most people who have reviewed this property, I am a fan of this hotel. It has a casual, elegant vibe and they understand what their guests are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views, outstanding Concierge Lounge - but...”
Reviews.Author: 4959keeton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business along with a couple of other co-workers. As a Marriott elite, I was put on the Concierge floor in a room that overlooked the harbor. The view was great. The room itself was a good size and the bed was quite comfortable. The flat-screen TV had a good selection of cable channels and a few of them were in hi-def. There is wired and wireless internet for $12.95/day, unless your plan includes it. I used the wired and found the speed to be excellent, even in the evenings. If you are a Marriott elite, or if you book the Concierge floor, you will have access to the lounge. I found it to be one of the best lounges in the Marriott chain. The breakfast was hearty as were the evening selections. The attendants were always friendly and went out of their way to be accommodating. On Wednesdays, there is a managers reception with complimentary drinks. There was one rather major glitch in my stay in that there was no hot water one morning (my co-workers were affected several mornings). The front desk was very apologetic and explained the problem. Evidently there is a problem with the current system so they had brought in a temporary boiler which was parked on the side of the property. This boiler can't keep up with demand on some mornings. I am still giving the property a high rating because it is otherwise so nice and (I hope) it is just a temporary problem (although it had been going on for a couple of weeks, I found out). You may want to check to see if the hot water issue has been resolved before your stay, however.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, great views, terrible food”
Reviews.Author: DCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot on the east side of the Inner Harbor. An easy walk to the Aquarium makes it a good base if you're in town for that particular attraction. We booked a "Deluxe oversized" guest room with king bed. It's unclear on the website what that means, so here is what it is: a corner room. You get a little extra space, but much if it is unusable in the form of a very long entryway from the door to the bedroom area. I wouldn't get this room for the "extra" space, but the harbor views were certainly spectacular (though you can get a similar view from other harbor view rooms, it just won't be a corner room). The only real downside to this hotel is the 700 Grille, the main restaurant in the lobby. The food is not great and is very overpriced. There are many much better choices just steps away in the Inner Harbor or the adjacent Little Italy neighborhood. Staff is better than expected for a mega chain like Marriott. We arrived early in the day and called to see if we could check in early. The phone guy was unhelpful, but we checked again at the front desk just to be sure and got a room immediately from the very helpful and friendly clerk Grace. She even made sure the crib we requested was delivered immediately. Awesome service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but noisy pipes”
Reviews.Author: susan822
Reviews.Content: I loved the location and the view, but for the price I was disappointed. The room was no more than a standard hotel room, nothing special. The water pipes sounded like a jackhammer going off at 6am. The other issue is that one person has to take your luggage out of the car and into the lobby and another takes it to your room. This is not a resort, this extra handling is unnecessary .

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: TessM
Reviews.Content: I tend to believe that most chain hotels are fairly standard and interchangeable. But I found this Marriott much nicer than expected. My room was lovely but what impressed me was the shower. There was WATER PRESSURE. I was in heaven. Also, the people at the bar, restaurant, take-away restaurant, front desk - heck; everyone was super nice and accommodating. I was there for a conference and paid the conference rate for the room. I did notice that the regular price for the hotel is out of my normal price range - maybe that's why I think it's so nice; I'm not used to it :) But I would recommend it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “SWANKY AND EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: SurferRyan
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms with very elegant appointments. Wonderful view and on-site dining. Very accommodating and knowledgeable concierge. The rest of the staff is questionable. We asked for a razor (my wife forget hers and we were preparing to go to a wedding) and once a maid brought up a pillow and we had to call the desk three more times to get it. Not our usual place to stay. A bit out of our price range and we got the wedding deal... would have expected a little more for what we paid but we were in the same hotel as the reception, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dmcg9
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a great location on Baltimore's Inner Harbour. It's a close walk to restaurants such as Phillips Seafood and the Ruth Chris Steakhouse as well as near to a Charm City Circulator bus (free!) and the Metro line. It's easy to find and well situated in the centre of Baltimore so you can strike out in any direction to explore. The historic Fell's Point neighbourhood is about 2 miles east and worth a visit but don't walk there as you have to go through a dodgy area that is probably slated for gentrification. Back to the hotel... The rooms were nice, clean and well maintained. The bathroom has a curved shower rod and Bath & Body Works toiletries. The towels were nice and fluffy. We had a waterfront facing room (faced west towards Camden Yards) which was furnished with pillow top beds, a desk and desk chair, a chair by the window, flat screen HDTV on a dresser unit that housed a safe, and fridge. There was also a small wet bar near the door with a personal Keurig coffee/tea maker. Amenities were very nice but expensive. The on-site restaurants and cafes were great but if you have time you can easily strike out for a restaurant in the neighbourhood such as the ones mentioned above. In the immediate vicinity of the hotel are an Irish pub (the James Joyce), a movie theatre, a Starbucks and a couple blocks to the east, a Whole Foods grocery store and a Rite Aid pharmacy. Take a harbourfront walk (via the footbridges over the slips) to Phillips Seafood and the former power plant which contains the Hard Rock Cafe, Barnes and Noble, and other restaurants. Internet is free in the lobby but not in your room ($12.95/day for internet access via Ethernet AND Wi-fi) and parking is $26/day or $40/day with valet service. The parking garage is located across the street from the hotel and you take a somewhat serpentine journey through the connecting elevators and hallways into the hotel. I'd recommend staying here except that it's somewhat pricey (I stayed on a reduced conference rate) so if you see deals on Priceline or anywhere else, seize them. I'd say the cost reflects the location rather than anything else about the hotel which was nice but not really stellar. It may be worth noting that there was a mistake in my reservation (which was made more than 2 months in advance) but I did get comped with a waterfront view at no extra charge, so that somewhat made up for it and was a nice gesture. I found all the staff accomodating and pleasant and if I can afford to stay in this hotel again, I will.

Reviews.Title: “Great Job”
Reviews.Author: sgtrudz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times before, and the hotel continues to be one of my favorites. The area continues to experience growth and there are many things to do and investigate. When we arrived, I was surprised at how busy the hotel was. I was slightly disappointed that our room wasn't ready at 2:00 p.m., so we took our luggage back to the car and found a place to eat and drink. They called around 3:00 to tell use the room was ready. Getting to the hotel requires using two different elevators - not including the one to get to your room. The front desk staff was friendly and professional. The room was clean and comfortable, and the views are fabulous. At night, however, you could hear everything occurring in the hallway, and there seems to be sirens outside all night long. We had the breakfast buffet on Sunday morning and it was great. There were extras on the buffet we weren't expecting. My favorite was the crab and corn quiche! Overall, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Baltimore and will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: william k
Reviews.Content: This hotel, from the quality of the room to the very friendly staff, exceeded my expectations. There’s a nice lounge in the lobby, one beer and one glass of wine was around $20. The hotel is full service, so have plenty of “tip money” available for the guys that unload your luggage from your car and take you to your room. We asked for a late check out and they gave it to us with no problem. They have a nice indoor pool. The parking situation is typical for the city. They get you for $20-$25 per night. It would be cool if they could somehow include that in the room price. If you want to stay in this area, but don’t want to pay for the Marriott, try Homewood Suites across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Marriott property in the Baltimore area. I have stayed here more than once and always been happy. Regardless of whether I had a regular room or a suite, the rooms were always clean and service was efficient. The higher floors can have a nice harbor view, so try to request one that faces the water. There are also a few restaurants and a movie theater literally steps from the hotel, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great fitness center. He rooms are are note very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: EatWithRay
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location if you like to get out and walk around the city or run along the water. Very close to stores including Whole Foods. The bar staff is helpful and funny. The fitness center is amazing. It even has a nice pool and a nice patio area to hang out. However, if you are their on a weekend or during a convention be warned that the rooms are noisy. Not only can you hear your neighboors a little too well, but there was a inch or larger gap under the rooms door which made it sound like the drunk person walking down the hall calling for "Stacy" was staying in the room. You should not be able to hear people walk down the hall of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: ak2_travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for an event and the service was exceptional. We were upgraded to a large room with a great view of the harbor. The room was nice and clean and the front desk staff were extremely helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Statsi
Reviews.Content: We used up some Marriott Reward points to have a one night stay with our 3 boys (had 2 rooms). One word.........wow! This hotel is one of the best that I have stayed in and I travel a lot staying in many different Marriott and Hilton hotels worldwide. Service was very attentive, the rooms were great and the views of the harbor were awesome. If you have access to the concierge lounge, make sure to use it. The evening appetizers and the daily breakfast were exceptional. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Jcritch2
Reviews.Content: To make a long story short, after an incredibly long day this staff went above and beyond. The rooms and ammenities are certainly nice but the care and treatment by the Marriott team out this hotel a cut above

Reviews.Title: “Got a room on Priceline! Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: Jjoyce75
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing view of the inner harbor and the hotel was incredible. I only paid $89 on Priceline. I felt like I won the lottery.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrotte
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here in early December for a conference. The first thing to note is the extreme attentiveness of the staff. From the valet outside to the waitresses in the dining room, you could barely pause in your walk without someone asking if you needed anything. First class service. The room was fine and the view fantastic. The only downside I could find was that the shower was not great and the bed a little too soft for my taste. Besides that, everything was great. Nice location in relation to the inner harbor obviously.

Reviews.Title: “Picturesque location”
Reviews.Author: O0gierules
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at this property in October to attend a wedding of a childhood friend. The location is right on the Inner Harbor with access by foot to all the venues winding through the harbor. We found check-in to be friendly, fast and efficient. The room was functional and large enough for this short stay. We did have Harbor view so that adds a little wow factor, quite beautiful all lit up in the evening. Since we were there for a wedding we did not have a dinner there but did go to Kozmo's Lounge for a cocktail and there must have Lump crab and Corn chowder soup. Parking was easy enough as there is a bridge from the parking garage directly back to the hotel, keeping you out of the elements. We had a nice stay here. Would certainly enjoy going back in warmer weather to enjoy the full energy of the Harbor activities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but watch out”
Reviews.Author: MikeyXO
Reviews.Content: Good location and clean. Expensive and you have to be careful with reservations and what you end up with. So when we get there the clerk says we only have one night. We check on the computer and see that the person who took our reservation didn’t put the dates for a Friday and Saturday night. He put them in as the same date. Saturday night we had a discount because we were with a convention. They wouldn’t give us the Saturday night at that rate, the one that was on one of the one of the reservations, and insisted on charging us more. We argued, and he could see what happened, but he told us, that is the best I can do or you can find someplace else to stay. I would not stay here again, I felt like I was scammed. The pool was also under repair for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: GypsyAtLast
Reviews.Content: Just returning from 2 nights at this hotel. Rooms were comfortable, clean and what I would expect in this location. PROS: There was a business center; but hotel also had a dedicated computer with printer at the main check-in area for quick access to flight check-in & boarding passes. No waiting around for a free computer. Used restaurant only for breakfast; but food was good; service was fast including getting the credit card receipt. Large "great room" off restaurant with several seating areas (couches, love seats, chairs) for inpromptu business discussions. Lively bar; service was top notch. This is a waterfront property (Inner Harbor) -- so if view is important -- ask for an appropriate room. Concierge level was above average. Hotel is within easy walking distance of good restaurants (across the street from Flemings), pubs & shopping. Would have loved to have had time to tour the aquarium. Building was gorgeous. Meeting rooms were comfortable; lunches & breaks were very good! Not your regular "hotel" food. CONS: None This was a business trip but I plan to return at my next opportunity for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: StevenVA
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Beautiful property, well appointed rooms, excellent location on the Inner Harbor, and convenient to everything that downtown Baltimore has to offer. The staff at this hotel are excellent, very accommodating, and friendly. Everytime I come to Baltimore on business or pleasure, this is my first choice for lusury and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to celebrate wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: daplushman
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend celebrating our wedding anniversary. The room was great and so was the view from the 24th floor. We had room service and it was execellent!!! We didn't want to leave but our weekend came to an end. We plan to visit again next year for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great views from the harbor side”
Reviews.Author: plecostamus
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and experience. The lobby is beautiful, the rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable (keurig coffee machine) and the service was great. Went to a conference here, the conference venue is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SHELTIEMOM38
Reviews.Content: We attended a banquet/convention on 11/19/11. This hotel is extremely clean and the service is spectacular. We stayed in room 3028 (beautiful) on the 30th floor. It had a very comfortable king size bed and an amazing harbor view. We attended a banquet in the ballroom, which was very nice. The fitness area is nicely equipped. Also, they had a free shuttle service to and from the convention center. Overall, a little pricey, but well worth it!This hotel has a great harbor location. In addition, there are alot of restaurants and attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to visit the harbor”
Reviews.Author: Travelqueen8882
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new Marriot for a business conference in September. The hotel is located on the Fells Point Sid elf the harbor and in walking distance to everything. The rooms are a nice size and views from the outdoor rooftop and 35th floor business suites are fabulous. I highly recommend staying in this location. There are great restaurants and sightseeing. It would be a great spot for a family event or putting. Even though I live only an hour from here, I plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room overlooking Baltimore harbor”
Reviews.Author: Erkloy
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at this hotel for one night, but the service was lovely and the view was gorgeous. We got a room overlooking the Baltimore Harbor. The room was very clean, the sheets were soft, and all-in-all it was a luxurious, fun experience for us. I recommend self parking in the garage across from the hotel -- it's less than half the price of the valet and it's barely a 2-minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: gababygirl8
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Great resturants are in plain view and in walking distance. The rooms are also very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable. Everyone was friendly and I enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanie881
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay at a great Priceline rate last weekend. Good view from my room even tho I wasn't as high up as I could have been. Great bathroom products, clean room, sparkling lobby, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “You definitely should stay here!”
Reviews.Author: mermaidswan
Reviews.Content: We surprised our daughter for her 5th birthday and decided to stay at the Baltimore Marriott for a couple of days. Best decision we could have made. As soon we got there to check in, three people came up to sing happy birthday to her. Then they upgraded our room for free, and when we went out to dinner that night they must have tried to sing happy b-day again because we got back there was a beautiful, obviously handmade cake with fondant icing and Happy Birthday written in chocolate around the plate. They even did it for her again the next morning at breakfast! Food was incredible--get the breakfast package--it's worth it. Food is a little pricey without it. The only possible things I could ding them for is no free wireless Internet access in the room--it's $12.95 per 24 hours, and the taxes are outrageous (23% per night) but I would think that is the case anywhere you stay in the city. I would recommend the Marriott Waterfront without hesitation. Everyone we met was wonderful, kind and accommodating. They made us feel so special!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun58202
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August 2011 for a family getaway. We were put in a corner room with wrap around windows - it was fabulous. You could see all of the inner harbour. The location puts you right in the middle of everything - easy walk to the aquarium, restaurants, science center, etc. Great for a family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraveltogetherDallas
Reviews.Content: This is a very well-managed convention hotel right on Baltimore's Inner Harbor. The staff was most attentive, and the rooms were very nice. I was upgraded to a large one-room suite with a great view since I am Marriott Rewards Silver level. The food was very good for a convention. The only complaint is that the hotel has an odd plumbing issue which results in loudly shaking pipes whenever one turns the hot water on past a certain level. Just kind of an annoyance. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: BrendaBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Although we live in the Baltimore suburbs, every once in a while we will stay downtown for the weekend. We always stay at the Marriott Waterfront. It's a nice upscale hotel with friendly staff, a delicious Sunday brunch buffet and comfortable rooms. The property is within walking distance of the Inner Harbor attractions and within the new trendy East Harbor area with many restaurants and shops. It doesn't have a bar, which we thought was very unusual, but there are several lounges spaces. I really love their Sunday brunch. Lots of fresh fruit, omelet and waffle stations and a variety of lunch entrees (which were just average).

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line”
Reviews.Author: Motadean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top of the line. It was very nice. Everyone was friendly and everything was clean. I would stay here time and time again. Very convient to shopping and Fell's point.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: nmkrk90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our getaway. We were upgraded to a corner harbor view king room. It was beautiful. The view of the harbor was simply perfect. Everyone at the hotel was so nice and gracious... from checking in to checking out. Had fun at the bar (although the drinks were a little light on the spirits) and the folks at the 700 Grille were so nice (yummy food). Water Taxi stand right outside of the hotel was so convenient. Beautiful shops nearby. Super restaurants right near the hotel within walking distance. We felt very safe in the area too! Definite bonus. Its a short walk to the Power Plant, but that was OK for us. We didn't want to be right in the middle of the nightlife (however there was plenty close buy). It was perfect for a couple's getaway - but would have been fine with our teenagers too! I have already recommended it to a co-worker who is going in November. Would definitely return to the Marriott Waterfront on our next visit to Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: DonJennster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a true 4-star. From the moment I walked in to the lovely lobby until the next morning when I checked out, I felt pampered. The location is great! It seems to be in a newer area with lots of new restaurants and buildings and is also just a 5 minute walk to the harbor front. The view from the hotel of the city and harbor is breathtaking. The rooms are a good size for a city hotel and the beds were simply heavenly! Overall I would say this hotel is well worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: luilala
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our Balt. Trip. Hotel staff are very accommodating and helpful! Hotel has a small pool that was just perfect for me to do some early morning laps. Hotel is right in heart of downtown & harbor area. We easily walked around harbor and Little Italy. Would go here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, A Few Little Issues”
Reviews.Author: Andrea T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently for our anniversary. We purchased the aquarium package. Overall, the stay was very nice. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and in a great location, the staff overall was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was great. But we had a lot of little problems with our stay. We received expired tickets to the aquarium, so after walking over there and waiting in line we had to walk back to the hotel to request non-expired tickets and then wait in line a second time. Our package included parking, but when we went to validate our parking after arriving back at the hotel after dinner the front desk clerk refused to validate the parking. He actually argued with my husband about this. Then we discovered that our requested feather free room was not feather free (I am very allergic, but I guess this wasn't guaranteed, and we should have confirmed). All in all, one little annoyance after another. The package just didn't seem that well organized. To their credit, all of the problems were resolved quickly. It was just a bummer that they needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience For A Large Hotel-One Exception”
Reviews.Author: Snowman321
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for three nights last week as part of a large convention. Check-in at 9pm Tuesday evening was not the highlight of the week. Front desk reps were not knowledgeable about room locations and did not appear knowledgeable or proficient on the use of computers; the apparent desk manager was uninterested in assisting, even after a problem was apparent, and instead, opted for small talk. Throughout the week, there appeared also to be larger than normal lines at the front desk. Notwithstanding this complaint, I would definitely recommend the hotel, even for a large property. The hotel is located in a great area, with many restaurants and tourist sites close by. The employees of the hotel were all uninformly friendly, the rooms and the hotel itself were very clean and very well maintained, and for a convention style hotel, the food served at the hotel and in the conferences were surprisingly good. I would definitely stay here again, be it on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Large Hotels on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and public spaces. Courteous staff and walkable jaunts to Fells Point and Inner Harbor. Free Internet for Marriotts Frequent Guest program members. Recommend you self park to save some cash. Great restaurants nearby. Near a water taxi stop.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at its Finest”
Reviews.Author: pmv16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a weekend at the Baltimore Marriott. Since we have stayed there before, we were expecting excellent treatment. However, they far exceeded our expectations. A few days before arrival, the virtual concierge of the hotel emailed me asking for requests. I informed them that we were celebrating our 30th Wedding Anniversary and have been pleased with the hotel before. I then received a personalized email from Annie offering any help in planning our special day, ie; romantic places to eat, roses, champange and chocolate covered strawberries in room. Upon arrival, I spoke with Annie personally and she was more than accommodating in assisting us with dinner reservations and entertaining details. We were give a corner room suite. The desk clerk, Nicole, offered us a corner suite with a three-sided view of the inner harbour. Everything could not have been more perfect. From the room to the roses to the restaurants she suggested. Fabulous property with a over the top friendly staff. Clean and 4 star all the way. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent large rooms with great view”
Reviews.Author: wanderingmarine
Reviews.Content: Really impressed in this great location near the inner harbor or fells point. Panoramic views from the top floors, so be sure to ask for a room at the top. Buzzing new restaurants and bars within easy walk. We will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: Runwaychic
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay here for a long weekend. The hotel is in a perfect location - lots of restaurants, shops, and attractions within a short walk. No need to get your car once you park it. We paid extra for a harbor view room, and it was beautiful, especially at night. The room service was very pricey, but really no need to get it since there are so many places to eat nearby. We loved the restaurant downstairs -- went there around 7pm, and had almost the entire place to ourselves. The waiter was excellent, great menu, and the prices were reasonable. We did get room service for breakfast (much more reasonable prices) and it was good, although there is an excellent breakfast buffet downstairs in the morning that would have been less money (but, it was nice to relax in the room and pamper ourselves a bit with the room service). We spent some time in the pool, which was nice, not overcrowded. There was a lot of chlorine in the water, so bring goggles. Pool is right off of the elevators, so it was nice location not having to trudge through in your wet clothes. I would definitely stay here again -- it was definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Inner-Harbor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poncherello1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront for two nights over Columbus Day weekend and found the property to be well maintained, clean, comfortable, and meeting out usual Marriott expectations. We had two rooms on the 17th floor with a great view of the harbor. Occupancy was high so connecting rooms were not possible but they were close enough so it didn't matter. The rooms were clean and up to date but the bathrooms were very small. There were no stains on the carpet or bedding and all furniture was in very good condition. The halls were clean and free of room service carts/cleaning supplies etc. The concierge lounge on the 31st floor is absolutely beautiful with great views of the harbor. It is clean and well staffed. The only issue we found was the fact that if you are below the 24th floor you need to take an elevator down to the 5th floor and switch to another in order to get up to the 31st floor. One bank of elevators is for L-23 and the other is for 24-32. This was only a hassle once as a convention was letting out and several elevators were packed full as they arrived on the 5th floor heading up. The indoor pool was clean as was the deck surrounding it. Right outside the pool is an outdoor patio overlooking the harbor with pleny of tables chairs to sit and enjoy the weather. The Sunday Brunch at the hotel restaurant was well stocked and very good..... a good deal at $24.95. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel. Valet parking and self parking are available in the hotel's garage next door. Valet is $40 per day and self parking is $26 per day. The valet is hassle free and quick as we had virtually no wait for out car. Overall the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront is a great place for business or pleasure. It is located directly on the harbor and within easy walking distance to many downtown attractions. I recommend this hotel highly if traveling through the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman11122
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of days for a software user conference. Beautiful views of the Harbor, nice hotel, beautiful interior. Staff is friendly but the ambiance makes the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Rikk S
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights in Baltimore and had a fantastic time. We could not fault it. The room was fantastic and view was breathtaking. If i was to stay in Baltimore again i would definitely choose this hotel. My only niggle would be having to pay $12.99 for internet in our room when other "cheaper" hotels can offer it free. Having said that you can get free wifi in the lobby but who wants to sit in the lobby to use your computer

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Mragan22
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous Marriott. Great service across the board. A perfect location to tour the inner harbor area including Little Italy and Fells Point. The bar was awesome. Very nice rooms. Good breakfast buffet. Super nice people. I forgot something in my room safe, called the hotel and they retrieved it and shipped it to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kraftite
Reviews.Content: this Marriott is in a great location...located next to the Aquarium and 1/2 mile from Fells Point and 2 blocks from Little Italy. The convention center 1.24 miles requires a bit of a hike however very do able and if need by taxi's are always available. There is a Pub and Fleming's Steak house in the very NEXT building across the street and an ice cream shop 1 block away. The Inner Harbor area is very walkable from end to end. Fells Point is a great area with tons of restaurants and bars/nightlife/bands. we booked the hotel through Priceline.com and got a great rate. The rooms were VERY comfortable especially the beds. They have taken out the minibars so there is a 7-eleven near by(3 blocks) to get snacks and drinks if need be. we did not use the hotels restaurants or bars so can't comment on that but did notice that the bar was busy. The Marriott here at the Inner harbor is a great location for business and pleasure. Would definitely stay here again. No problems at all... check in and out was a breeze. We had a view of the harbor which was also very scenic.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rockriver2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the weekend at the Waterfront Marriott and loved every minute of it. It was easy to get to by car and the staff was wonderful. The Inner Harbor was a great place to walk around. We shopped and had drinks at several bars on the waterfront. There is a Water Taxi stop right outside the hotel. We had a fabulous view from our room. We felt very safe in the neighborhood. The only thing they don't provide is free Internet. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cat0407
Reviews.Content: Great room overlooking the neighbourhood as well as the water...Clean and very big hotel with a great bar and reasonable food prices...We were there for a convention and the walk to the convention center was a very easy one with beautiful scenery along the historic inner harbour district...The staff at the desk were fantastic but the buffet breakfast could do with some vegetarian options...Overall a fantastic experience...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT family get away or business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KellyAnder
Reviews.Content: I was here for a convention. The hotel is a bit away from the convention center, either a 20 minutes sweaty walk in the summer or a 6-11 dollar cab ride. That said, it is very new and quite nice. Right on the water, the views high up on the harbor side are stunning. Very easy access to walking the inner harbor, very close to Fells Point restaurants, and a Roy's and Oceanaire just outside the front door. Thick room walls and no neighbor noises, but a toilet that kicked in and ran whenever it wanted to. They have a Krups in the room and only two pods for coffee, so get extra before you go to bed. Rooms are quite large and sheets are lovely, Concierge lounge availabe, Starbucks in the lobby. Was quite busy due to convention I assume. Elevators were quite slow. Business center was temporarily closed. Staff was very kind. I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ktizme
Reviews.Content: Spent close to a week at this hotel in May of this year for a business conference. Had a very clean room with a terrific view of the inner harbor. I loved sitting at night in the dark looking at the lights and the water. I felt for a conference this was a very good location - good meeting rooms - decent restaurant and bar. Good access to local restaurants and things to do. The local free transportation was a great plus - took a very nice trip to the art museum which was wonderful with many impressionist paintings and a lovely little restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Regular Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Falkirkgirl
Reviews.Content: Standard Marriott, recent renovation of rooms mean they are clean and comfortable. Easy to locate and easy to get to locations from the hotel. Bar area nothing to speak of, however barman very friendly. Would use again. Valet parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: nhm14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel which I bid on at Priceline and was amazed with the quality of the room and the hotel for such a low price. I only spent one night but the room was beautiful with a lovely view of the water (which I didn't request, what a bonus!) on the 27th floor. Although it was by the elevator, I heard no noise. It is a long walk to Camden Yard, but you know, you're in the City, you walk! I will stay there again for sure. The bed was an excellent sleeping experience. The only negative is that the internet connection in the room was not free. In today's world, I am amazed by that.

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view”
Reviews.Author: ArtVandelay96
Reviews.Content: I loved it! The room was nice and clean with a beautiful waterfront view. The location was great which was walking distance to different attractions such as Little Italy, Fell's Point, etc. My only qualm was the shower with the slow drain but other than that, awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great view!”
Reviews.Author: gsoccer035
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding in June of 2011. We stayed in a room with windows on two sides. The view was amazing! The room was very nice too. The hotel is also in a good location. There are lots of restaurants, bars and shops near the hotel. The banquet facilities were great. The cost was pretty high but we were able to save some money using the friends and family rate. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Hurricane1972
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 3 nights with my mum and we both absolutely loved the hotel, location and service. We arrived late after a long journey and were pleased to find the check in process was quick and straight forward. The lady who checked us in was very friendly and professional. She managed to combine speed and politeness by chatting to us whilst arranging the check in. We were offered 2 doubles on the 25th floor which we were happy about especially once we saw the view from the room which was excellent. There are 2 sets of elevators, one set which are express from the 5th to the 23rd floor. The room was a good size with a huge TV, fridge and safe. The safe had been locked by the last occupants so we had to call the front desk but they sent someone up to sort it out within 5 minutes. The room was cleaned to a very high standard, my mum is very observant about such things and commented on how clean it was. Beds were extremely comfortable and we both slept very well. The location is ideal as it is close enough to walk to the nearby shops, restaurants and attractions but there is no noise from the busy inner harbor. There is also a water taxi stop immediately outside the hotel which is very convenient. On the 5th floor past the pool and gym was an outdoor terrace which offered fantastic views of the city and harbor at night. We ate one of the nights at Kozmo bar and had a very enjoyable meal. There was also a coffee shop called Rigano's which sold sandwiches and cakes which was very welcome especially on a morning. There was also a small shop which sold souvenirs, postcards and medicines. Only disappointment was when we had to check out of this great hotel. The friendly staff and excellent hotel and location made for a memorable trip to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Good performer, but generic in feel and operation”
Reviews.Author: chadchicago
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at old-world grand dame hotels, so this recent addition to the inner harbor was a departure for us. We stayed for a weekend during the Grand Prix event. Food is plain and unremarkable. Lobby and public areas are generic Marriott style. The same carpet and bland gift shop you see in all the others. The view is wonderful. This is probably the most expensive place in town, but is really a good, bland business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: tomytom
Reviews.Content: waiters delivering room service had serious attitudes and delivered breakfast on a plate so hot that it burned the skin off of my thumb. Additionally, when ordering breakfast I did not receive a few things that I requested. I've stayed here several times and normally receive good service but my last trip was absolutely horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service!”
Reviews.Author: SkiSandpoint
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront delivers again! This is my second stay at this property and once again, everything was perfect! I stayed at this property 3 years ago when in Baltimore for a conference and during that stay my wallet was stolen while out shopping in the Inner Harbor. An unfortunate incident, but the hotel staff went out of their way to make that experience as painless as possible. When I returned a few weeks ago, the service was top-notch again. I was given a beautiful room overlooking the Inner Harbor, the front desk staff, bell staff, conference staff, and concierge all were very attentive and helpful. Samir, our waiter on three separate occasions in the Grille was super friendly and accommodating, and the concierge lounge had excellent food with great views of the city. Well done Baltimore Marriott Waterfront - I will be back in 3 years when our conference returns - can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: pacmrhs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night over Labor day weekend. The hotel was packed because of the Baltimore Grand Prix. The hotel is beautiful, the staff top notch. The lounge was great and the bartender made excellent drinks. The hotel is located a block from Little Italy and their great restaurants, and Fells Point is just 3 or 4 blocks away with great seafood places. I can't stress how great the location of this hotel is. It's not in the middle of the more touristy Inner Harbor area, but away (behind the pier where the Hard Rock is located) from the crowds. A few things not so great - NO FREE Internet! In this day and age you shouldn't be charged 12.95 a day for internet. Also, their toilets are environmentally friendly and easily clog. Beware. We used our Marriott points for the one night stay but the hotel is pricey ($300 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Location But Hotel Was Just A Bit Off”
Reviews.Author: HurdyGurdyMan
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I would stay here again. The problems were minor and I would say that it falls just a bit short of being a "very good" hotel but it's definitely better than average. The location is what put it over the top for me. If you're trying to decide to stay in either downtown or in the harbor area you definitely want to stay in the harbor area. Downtown Baltimore can get very shady especially West of the harbor. And I was there during the day. I couldn't imagine being there at night. The Marriott is on the east side of the harbor while most of the action is on the west side of the harbor but that's absolutely fine with me. There are a bunch of restaurants in the neighborhoods just east and north of the hotel along with a movie theater, a big pharmacy, Starbucks etc. There's also a water taxi stop right near the hotel entrance that will take you all over the harbor for 10$ a day. In my opinion, the location of this hotel is ideal. What was wrong? Little things. The safe was broken, the minibar was empty, the water cooler in the lobby was kind of dirty looking, the bathroom door stuck. The big thing was the bed which was not very good. The mattress seemed very old and soft and the mattress topper was not of good quality. I was shocked at how poor it was given the Marriott brand. It didn't keep me from sleeping but usually you feel like "Wow" when you lay down on a brand name hotel bed. This bed was more of a "Huh?" If all fairness they did offer to fix the safe (which I usually use for a laptop) and the fridge was empty because they had eliminated the mini bar program. Check-in was quick and very friendly. Check-out was automated. There were some nice lobby perks such as scented moist towels to refresh yourself with and a couple of chef's with giving away little glasses of sorbet. Bottom line is I wouldn't pay full price ( $250 or so) for this hotel but I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly service”
Reviews.Author: sharklu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early August with my husband and two boys (12 and 8). We had requested a waterfront room which we were given, but because it was on a low floor (8th), there was a large flat roof immediately outside of our window that did not make for the view I was looking for. We called the front desk, and were immediately given a room on the 28th floor (corner room) with a spectacular view of Baltimore inner harbor and city. The rooms were clean and well kept. Nice little bar area immediately upon entering the room with cabinet space (my 8 year old son was able to fit into it and made it his little 'cave' while playing his Nintendo DS/iPad), and refrigerator just under the cabinet that held the TV. The boys really enjoyed going into the high speed elevator (there are two elevators - one for the lower floors, and one for the high floors) and my husband and I just loved the view! The hotel is within walking distance of all the sites (aquarium, mall, inner harbor area, Little Italy, etc.)...very convenient to stop back at the hotel to drop things off and head back out. The walk ways to get to the main inner harbor shopping area were really nice and made for some great photos. My sons also loved the paddleboats and snow cones located near the aquarium. The service at the Marriott was EXCELLENT, starting with the swift manner in which Marriott was able to accomodate our request for a room change. My youngest son has milk/peanut allergies, so I had contacted the concierge in advance of our trip to make them aware of this. I immediately received a note from the manager letting us know to contact them upon our arrival and they would accomodate any request from our son so that he could enjoy an allergen free meal. Were they true to their word! After spending most of the morning /afternoon sightseeing, we went to the hotel restaurant only to find they weren't open again till dinner, so went to the bar/lounge area. The boys loved sitting on couches around a coffee table to eat a late lunch in a large lounge area...and the server (a man with a beard who catered to our every need and was extremely friendly) made sure that the french fries my son had ordered did not contain any contact with milk products or peanut oil. Later that evening, we asked the concierge for some choices in Little Italy, and were given some names of restaurants that would cater to allergies. The restaurant recommended by the concierge (Sabatino's) was great for a family meal, and food was definitely true to Little Italy. After dinner, we decided to check out the deck on the 5th floor. I highly recommend if you stay to check it out in the evening for the incredible night time views of the Inner Harbor / city. Marriott did a great job of positioning lounge chairs and stools on the deck to create some nice ambience at night. It is located on the same level as the indoor pool, and of course my sons enjoyed taking advantage of the pool as well. The gym is also well equipped. Only negative thing I can say is that the hotel is pricey, but for most part typical for a hotel in a major city and with waterfront views. Very impressed with the excellent service and especially family friendly atmosphere of this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “KACP Conference 2010”
Reviews.Author: hicksw
Reviews.Content: This is my absolute favorite hotel. I've stayed here for wedding anniversaries, conferences, holiday parties, and I also bring my family here on Saturday mornings to enjoy the wonderful brunch that is served here. The rooms are wonderfully appointed and the views of Baltimore from the upper floors are of the best in the city. I live in Baltimore I stay at this hotel at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfection”
Reviews.Author: bedfordmom2
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront. The location was fantastic. It was walkable (brisk 15 minutes) to the Inner Harbor; right near Little Italy and Harbor East (new trendy area) as well as near Fells Point,. They had their own water taxi stop and well as near one of the free Orange Charm intercity buses The hotel was absolutely beautiful, very classy without being pretentious. The staff was very professional and friendly at the same time. We enjoyed the banquet and catering service courtesy of my convention and everything was very tasty. The rooms were large, very clean with Keurig coffee maker and refridgerator. I titled this review as near perfection because housekeeping was not up to par one of the days of our stay. My room had not been made up by 2pm so I called down. they told me that housekeeping was on until 3pm that day and they would get to my room soon. By 4pm, the room had not been made up when I checked again (granted we did have an earthquake and brief evacuation ) and housekeeping promised they would have someone make it up. Housekeeping eventually came and did a cursory bedmaking and towel change and that was it, no vacuuming or replenishing the shampoos soap etc (I was out). So a call to housekeeping promptly delivered the needed supplies. But other than that little blip, my stay was fantastic and I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cabocathie
Reviews.Content: Optimist International held our 2011 international convention at the Marriott Waterfront in Baltimore. We arrived a week early and stayed 11 days. The rooms are very spacious & the staff is all very friendly and helpful. The area is great for a family trip as the Aquarium, Baltimore World Trade Center, Hard Rock Cafe, many shops & restaurants, & the free city bus stops are very close by. The only thing we didn't like was the price of the wine by the glass outside our formal banquet was $12.00 a glass! We thought that was excessive but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JJD19
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel in a great location. It is a short walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: Mark M
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights with six in the family- two rooms. The staff was top notch and the concierge level was well worth it-- huge space, great food and nightly snacks and excellent breakfast. The location is great as well as the entire inner harbor is walkable. The hotel and rooms were perfectly clean. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: StevenVA
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful property, outstanding service - what more could you ask for? I truly love this place, and whenever I travel to Baltimore for business, it is my top choice. The hotel is not located in the middle of the chaos of the Inner Harbor, but in a more quiet area with very easy access to all of the tourist traps. However, just on the other side of the hotel is Baltimore's Little Italy, with lots of wonderful family owned Italian eateries. The rooms in this hotel are great - very up-to-date and not cramped - the concierge lounge is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location, Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: CBSprings
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family a couple weekends ago while my son was at Towson Honors College Orientation. Great location close to top notch restaurants, water taxi, Sea Dog boat ride and many major attractions within walking distance. Quiet location and safe area to walk around the neighborhood. Movie theater and Little Italy right around the corner. Will be back this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place to stay”
Reviews.Author: phillytravelfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch and well run. The employees ranging from Housekeeping, Front Desk, Restaurant, Doormen, etc. are highly customer service oriented. The room was impeccable and had beautiful views of Baltimore's inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kari1234
Reviews.Content: Great stay and quick retreat from the hustle. Clean rooms, and wonderful staff. The food is ok, local restaurants are within walking distance. Recommend the Sunday brunch buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great proximity to restaurants and the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: cincinnatiohio123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch. The rooms are clean and spacious with great views. We have had the waterfront view and the city view and although the waterfront is nicer, the city view is still something to see. This hotel is within walking distance to Little Italy where there are wonderful Italian restaurants. There is also a first class steak house across the street and an Irish Pub close by. You can take a water taxi (one cost for the day) from the hotel and go around the waterfront to shopping, Camden Yards, the aquarium or just view the area. We stay at this hotel while my husband goes to Johns Hopkins each year. It is just a short drive to the hospital. The only downside to the hotel is the cost to park there - $26 a day although the parking is right by the hotel. Of course parking anywhere around there is expensive which is why the water taxi can be a plus if you plan to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Marriott with great views”
Reviews.Author: Oski_Bear_DC
Reviews.Content: This is flat out the best Marriott property in the Inner Harbor area. I used to think it was the Renaissance Harborplace with the recent renovation and the adjoining mall and bridge to the Pratt St and Light St pavillions. The view west towards the Aquarium and Camden Yards is terrific both day and night. It is also a shorter walk to the Aquarium than the Renaissance. Rates were also higher than the Renaissance. The Harbor East area is about five years old with a few dozen high rises and upscale restaurants. Nearby Little Italy and Fells Point is sharply contrasted with old, smaller bulidings and a multitude of dining options at more affordable prices. Harbor East definitely seems like the more adult side of the Inner Harbor compared to the more family oriented west side of the Inner Harbor. Now that our youngest kids are teenagers, it's refreshing to not dodge strollers and ankle-biters. Harbor East is safe and walkable in the evening. The Marriott Waterfront's ground floor has at least 30 ft ceilings. I was surprised to see five business conferences and meetings on a hot summer Monday. The room was typical Marriott size at about 300 sq ft. The bed was somewhat on the soft side for me, but was fine for the wife. The reading lights on the headboard was a nice touch. Also a lamp on each night stand (with electrical receptacles) and floor lamp with the easy chair and ottoman. The bathroom was on the small side with less than five feet between the counter and the tub. Laptop-sized safe and spiffy small fridge was appreciated. The programming on the flat-panel TV had plenty of cable programming and included a waterfall scene with music. Some other hotel chains have begun to include a recycling bin in the room. This is one of the few Marriotts I have seen with a recycling bag to collect such items. When the Sixth St Pavillion has concerts, the cheap (free) seats on the promenade on the west of the hotel. You can hear the music fine, just can't see the performers. Self-parking is next door connected by a bridge. Valet parking is up to the 4th floor with self-parking beyond. $26 for 24 hours is not cheap, but better than the $40 valet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Conferences and Awards”
Reviews.Author: silvesy
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Although, it is quite pricey, the service and the staff were great. I would definitely stay there again. The rooms were clean and spacious. The food was also great during our stay. The only dissapointment was the weather, which I know Marriott has no control over :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: richardrobin
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel at inner harbor. Sort of on the "quiet side" of the inner harbor. Breakfast in the restaurant was good, the lobby and sitting areas are very upscale and inviting. You can catch a water taxi right by the hotel and the whole harbor area is great for walking. Little Italy is a short walk from the hotel with great restaurants. We also enjoyed eating at McCormicks Seafood which is also near the hotel. Staff was friendly and rooms clean. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shoregirl2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights last week as part of an 20th wedding anniversary cruise that we took on our boat. He is a platinum member so we were able to stay using points and a one night stay certificate he had earned. When we arrived we docked our boat at the Harbor East marina which is just a short distance to the Marriott. The deal at the marina is stay 2 nights get the 3rd for free. We left after 2 nights and continued on to Annapolis but wished we had just stayed in Baltimore another night. When we checked into the hotel, my husband mentioned to the desk clerk that we were staying as part of our anniversary cruise. The clerks name was Emily and she could not have been nicer. We were given a suite (very nice....) that overlooked the harbor. We could even see our boat from our window. When we returned from dinner that night, Emily had sent up a bottle of champagne, a plate of cheese and crackers and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries that were decorated so that they looked like they had tuxedos on them! There was even a handwritten card that she had done that congratulated us on our anniversary, etc. We were blown away by her outstanding service! We have stayed in this hotel before and have always enjoyed it. It is a close walk to anyplace in the inner harbor and, in the opposite direction, Fells Point.
