There has been alot of renovation in that area and it is just beautiful. We are already planning to go back and stay again. I had a coupon that I had purchased on Travelzoo for 4 drinks and 2 apps at the Kozmos bar in the Marriott. The food was delicious and so were the drinks! In Fells Point, we had fish tacos at Woodys and then had sushi during happy hour at Ra's. Like I said, we wished we had just stayed another night in Baltimore instead of going to Annapolis. We won't make that mistake again! The morning we left we discovered that there is also a Whole Foods grocery store just a couple of blocks away from the hotel. It's hard to believe how many great things are within walking distance of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “typical marriott - great service, beds, and linens, but small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: chopperace
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several other marriott's recently (Atlanta), the Baltimore Waterfront holds up. The attention and service from the staff was excellent. The rooms are great, the beds are super comfy with different types of pillows. I think the one thing Marriott should change is how small their bathrooms are. You can barely shut the door to get around the toilet - it is definetly a one person at a time bathroom. Also parking here is not fun, if you self park you have to drive up 5 floors to get past the valet floors and its $26/day to self park, $40.day valet.

Reviews.Title: “Went for a lacrosse tournament - turned into a nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: k2escott
Reviews.Content: Went on a group rate (quite good) with a lacrosse team and were very pleased with the property, the restaurant, and the walkability of the area. It was central to all the areas we wanted to visit for both shopping, activities and dining. Our bellman Frank was so nice and we asked for him all weekend and enjoyed talking to him. The breakfast in the main dining area was quite good (recommend the Crunchy French Toast).. We stepped right out the door to the right for the harbor and the left for Little Italy and Fell's Point. We did ask to have our room moved to another floor but it was our own group making the noise - they were very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: positanobabe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location to sight see--Little Italy and Fells Point within walking distance, Campden Yards was a bit of a walk but nice, could also take water taxi to Campden Yards or Federal Hill or Fort McHenry. Rooms were nice. Certainly would stay again. Unfortunately our room was near an elevator and a bit noisy on a Saturday night. Guests seem to want to continue their evening on the chairs near the elevator. We called the main desk and they quickly took care of the situation.

Reviews.Title: “we've stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: brinkone2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend and were given a nice room with a harbor view. We were on the pool floor (5th floor) and it was so convenient to the pool and the outside huge patio that also overlooked the harbor. When I stayed here with my husband in January 2009 and it happened to also be my birthday they upgraded us to the Presidential Suite. It made that day the best birthday of my life!! It's a convenient walk to Camden Yards, Little Italy, and two Irish Pubs!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: jerseymom1014
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to take my daughter to the Aquirium. It was a very clean room, very comfortable. My daughter loved the view of the harbor from the room. The restuants didnt seem to be to child friedly so we ate off property except for the brunch on our day of checkout. The food was amazing and a huge varity. Only stayed over one night but it seemed to be a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, location, and staff”
Reviews.Author: sablatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during a fairly long trip, and it was definitely our best stop. We had received an incredible rate thanks to the Priceline Negotiator, but we were treated just like any honored guest. When we checked in, we were offered a Harbor view room if we paid extra. We chose not to do that, but the staff member sweetly gave us a "partial harbor view" room on the 24th floor. We thought the view was wonderful both daytime and at night with the city lights. The room was large and the bed extremely comfortable with very nice sheets. Whenever we went out the staff were very helpful with suggestions. Finally, our checkout was very fast. I picked up pastries for breakfast at the Whole Foods around the corner, and we ate them on the open area outside the pool area. The view was wonderful, and we appreciated the free lemonade on tap we picked up in the lobby. I know the Marriott charges for WiFi, but they accepted faxes for me with no charge and delivered them promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the Inner Harbor with great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: soccrmom9
Reviews.Content: We arrived at a very popular and busy time of day, and the service was great! We got our room and our bags quickly to our room. Our bellman was awesome and made the girls feel very welcome. Our room was spacious, clean and had a great view of the patio on the 5th floor. The open patio is a must for any visitor to go to. It was not highly occupied, and it would have been a better idea to go grab dinner and eat it out there overlooking the harbor than to have spent over $100 on a meal at the restuarant... the indoor pool is very nice, and they have a lifeguard on duty, which is comforting! the only negative is the parking. it is across the street and a convoluted mess to go from the lobby to the parking garage if you forget anything in the car. The major positive is that they harbor shopping/eating area is a short walk from the hotel. the only scary part is that there had been some sort of "issue" the night before down at the harbor with a someone getting shot, and we had no idea as we walked around after dark! According to the news, most ciitzens don't feel safe down there at night any longer. But, I never felt threatened or scared with my 3 children in tow. overall, i would stay here again if ever in Baltimore again! It's a great hotel for the price we received!

Reviews.Title: “VERY INEFFICIENT AND INCOMPETENT, UNCARING FRONT DESK”
Reviews.Author: VAChuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked two nights online for a July 2011 stay at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront. We were celebrating over 40 years of marriage. In the online reservation we mentioned the special occasion, asked for King size bed guaranteed and a few other things to make the occasion a good one. It took us over 45 minutes to check in. First off, the front desk did not have us in their system. Fortunately, I had printed off the online reservation sheet in full. The clerk, who was nice enough but slow as molasses, left the room for about 10 minutes. She came back with the report that she had found a room for us on the 17th floor, which was nice since we had paid for a harbor view and higher up gives you a better view. I took the bags up to the room and opened the door to see two double beds. I turned right around and returned to the lobby. When I reminded the clerk that we were here for an anniversary she said (for the first time) oh, we only have double bed harbor view rooms left. At this point, I was pretty upset. I told the gal I had a guaranteed King bed reservation. I know that Marriotts have to honor this. She would not budge. No apologies were made. So I asked for the manager. After about 10 minutes, the manager came out and asked if our online reservation said King Bed Guaranteed. I showed him the online print out and he said well I guess we have no choice but to upgrade you to a corner king room on the 17th floor. This was at about the 45 minute point. The upgrade was at no cost but it got our stay at the Marriott off to a very bad start. The room was nice. Spectacular views. Small bathroom. Good bed. Refrigerator. Morning paper. There was no written apology made and no bubbly for the check-in pain caused. The toilet had to be fixed. At checkout, I was second in line in the lobby. There were two lines. It took at least 10 minutes to get the checkout accomplished. If you are going to stay at this Marriott ( we have always had good service at other Marriott’s we have stayed in), make sure you print out in full your reservation and have it handy. Also, be prepared to wait forever in the lobby. Do not expect any special touches. Now for the pleasant park of the trip. We had a great couple of great days sightseeing. It was in the mid-90s so we largely planned indoor activities. The Walters Art Gallery was a spectacular way to begin. It is located up near the Washington statue and tower. We spent 4 hours looking at Walter’s magnificent masterpieces, including wonderful Impressionists. Also have a wonderful Asian Ceramics section. The museum is free and you can park at a reduced cost at the close by lot recommended on the website. The next day we went to the Baltimore Museum of Art and enjoyed another 4-5 hours there. Parking in their lot, which was $6 all day, was convenient and the museum is free. This museum has a wonderful sculpture garden adjacent to a very good restaurant. The sculpture garden has Rodins and other famous sculptures. The museum is broad based in its collection. It has one of the world’s largest Matisse painting collections (Cone Sisters collection) and many beautiful impressionists and paintings from the Renaissance period. On the last day, we spent a couple of hours at the National Aquarium. We had enjoyed a couple of times years ago. It has become a little passe. It does not compare favorably against aquariums we have seen such as Seaworld in Orlando, Sharks Reef at Mandalan Bay Hotel in Vegas, Scripps in San Diego area, and Barcelona (really spectacular and the largest in Europe). The aquarium is still nice just not spectacular. The ray tank is large and a treat to see. The shark tanks are mediocre. The reef exhibits are well organized and informative. There is a lot of space devoted to posters of marine life that could have actually had some marine life, however. The dolphin tank is large but it is situated in a large separate building with not much else going on. Baltimore is a nice city and I am sure we could have spent several other days there, particularly if the weather had been cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Waterfront location is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: maryChico
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Loyola's parent orientation. $22 taxi ride each way! Inconvenient location for orientation, but beautiful waterfront setting for all other purposes. Surounded by great restaurants. Hotel very clean, front door staff is great; friendly and helpful without fail! Front desk staff helpful as well, while they lacked the enthusiasm of door staff, they were friendly and accomodating while at the desk. Room was large and very clean. Safe did not work, which was a problem. Apparently it was a new safe and it wasn't hooked up yet, which seemed a bit strange. It took many calls to finally get security up to room to let me know that, apparently call staff was understaffed and couldn't answer all incoming calls when guests called down. In addition, clock beside bed was broken and not repaired during our three day stay. We had our cell alarms, so it didn't pose a big problem. View was excellent out of window, down onto waterfront. Lobby has beautiful pastry counter with oatmeal and coffee's available, which was very nice. Flower arrangements were spectacular. Take Supershuttle from airport to hotel (and back); MUCH cheaper than taxi, and hope you get Ed as your driver. Supershuttle is at hotel twice an hour so timing is always convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great position”
Reviews.Author: gianlucaNY
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice for a business travel. The Hotel is really nice, clean an well update. The service is outstanding for each of the offered services. The only concern is about the small pool on the 5th floor. It's lake to take a bath in the Clorox!! They can also improve the quality of service offering a free wi-fi connection on the rooms, please! The Hotel is well located in a nice part of Baltimore from where you can easily walk around the Harbor or toward Fells Point. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown”
Reviews.Author: zan500
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a conference in late May for 5 days. The hotel location was fantastic with a range of great restaurants within walking distance and the hotel itself was a great business destination. The conference facilities are very good and the rooms are comfortable and clean. The gym is decent but still a little small and gets crowded in the afternoons and early evening. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone staying in Baltimore and looking to spend sometime around the waterfront and neighbouring areas.

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: strizek88
Reviews.Content: If I had spent my own money and paid the non-conference price, I would've been disappointed. You think the hotel is going to be really great - it's got a nice location, pretty lobby, expensive feel - but, the rooms leave something to be desired. The bed is awful - "squeeky" sheets, flat uncozy duvet and terrible pillows. The bathroom feels no better than what you would find at a nice Hampton Inn - you've got a very basic tub/shower combo, thinning towels and pipes that make loud, growling noises when you're in the shower. I will say, however, that the hotel does a nice job with conferences. The staff was very helpful and friendly, breakfast was good, snack break goodies were really great (which I'm sure cost a pretty penny, but good nonetheless). Lastly, the crab cake. Let me say first that I'm kind of a foodie - not totally obnoxious about it, but do appreciate trying some new places while traveling. One night, I was not in the mood to leave the property and decided to take my chances at "the hotel bar" (yikes, right?). But damn! The caesar salad with crab cake was fantastic. Cake was almost entirely jumbo lump crab, the salad was nicely chopped and lightly dressed. Seriously so good - and a bargain at $16.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: md19600
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for business travelers, lots of ammenties all on site and a great breakfast buffet! We had a conference here and everything from the rooms, restaurants and meeting rooms were perfect. Also had a lot of great bars & seafood restaurants within easy walking distant.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, very nice.”
Reviews.Author: DeltaSkyKing
Reviews.Content: Marriott seems to get it right for me. For some reason they just nearly always seem to meet my needs and expectations. This hotel is no different. - Quick and friendly front desk staff - Rooms are very clean and comfortable - Excellent food option both in and out of the hotel. - Fantastic location. Can't wait to go back and go to an Orioles game. - I slept like a baby. - Nothing negative to report - really.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Rickeybob22
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Baltimore and could not have been happier with our stay. Great service, great location, and great overall experience. People in Baltimore were so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: char0
Reviews.Content: In town for a cheerleading competition with the family, this hotel was a natural choice as it was just across the bridge to the venue. We have stayed here before and enjoyed it--the hotel is beautiful and has a great location for sightseeing in Baltimore. We did not upgrade to a harbor view this time but still had a nice city view from the 17th floor. Room was clean and spacious enough. The kids always love the pool and the adults love the outdoor terrace--great views of the harbor! Got a good group rate through our organization so can't complain about the price. Sunday Brunch was excellent--so many choices! A little pricey for the adults especially if you don;t intend to take advantage of the mimosas but again, lots to choose from and all delicious. We love to stay here when we are in town--it's not cheap but this is Baltimore after all and nothing is cheap in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “impressive staff”
Reviews.Author: KaelinCB
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great part of town, within walking distance to so many neighborhoods and attractions. However, the best feature of this hotel is its staff. Every staff member I encountered during my 4-day stay was very personable, engaging, attentive, and eager to help me if they could. I was on the elevator and a young man got on a few floors after me, looked me right in the eye, smiled, and asked me how my stay was going. When I accidentally exited the elevator onto the wrong floor, he came after me and managed to hold the elevator door! I was impressed. I don't think I've encountered that level of customer care at a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “"Ultimately Gracious"”
Reviews.Author: EarthRider
Reviews.Content: When you use reward points, you don't necessary get the best rooms in the hotel. That wasn't true of my stay at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront Hotel. I'm a silver elite member with Marriott. Not only did they give me a great room with a great view and early check-in, but they also offered me a platinum elite "Welcome Gift." Mine was a half bottle of wine, wonderful fruit plate, and pretzels. It was delivered within 1/2 hour of check in. The hotel itself is beautifully and beautifully located on the Inner Harbor. It's right by Little Italy and a host of fine restaurants, including Italian, seafood, local haunts, and plenty of up-scale chain restaurants. I had the buffet breakfast at the hotel, which was excellent. The variety and quality of the fresh fruit, for example, was above and beyond what you see at most restaurants. The decor of the public areas, including the lobby and bar are comfortable and eleagant. The rooms are the "new Marriott" style and are great. All the staff were friendly, attentive, and helpful. Nothing "snooty" about this beautiful hotel or its employees, it's just ultimately gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: RICHTC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Waterfront for a weekend. Kids are 9 & 11. I thought the property and location were both fantastic. There is a pool on the 5th floor with a large observation deck. The kids swam while we watched the boats come and go. The rooms are very nice as is the concierge lounge. We walked to the harbor area and Camden Yards. For dinner, we walked to Little Italy. We almost didn't want to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not great”
Reviews.Author: MrMrsBear
Reviews.Content: Because of its location and its ability to accommodate business conferences, this Marriott can command high rates. Many attractions of the Inner Harbor are within easy walking distance. On the positive side: our room was very nice, and the bed was comfortable. Staff members (front desk, concierge, bell station, housekeeping, bar, food service) were without exception pleasant, knowledgeable, and professional. A few disappointments: most notably, the swimming pool is very small and unappealing. Minor disappointments: lumpy pillows, and no video checkout. One peeve: Wifi is available, but at a charge of $12.95 a day -- and the day runs from noon to noon. Nowadays, when free wifi is the norm at moderate and even low-cost hotel chains, charging for wifi is a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great part of Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: luisa1071
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Marriott Waterfront. The location was perfect, the high-end neighborhood it is in has lots of great boutiques and restaurants to enjoy, not to mention the opportunity to walk along the water and view the beautiful boats in the marina. This hotel is also in close walking distance to Fells Point and Little Italy. Both of these neighborhoods have plenty to see and do. The front desk staff were well trained and exceptionally friendly. My only issue with the hotel were interior decor inconsistencies that I didn't feel went with the overall design motif (i.e. the folk art grandfather clocks in both of the elevator vestibules). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, lovely room, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmwillia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott while on a business trip for 3 days. I was constantly impressed with this hotel, in so many ways. The front desk agent, Sarah, was friendly and sweet- and took the time to walk me to the elevator area when I was all set. I also saw another agent doing this. It's the little things that count, sometimes. Upon arrival, I asked if I could be placed in a waterfront room, but unfortunately there was a charge for the upgrade. I am a government employee, and had to "pass" on the upgrade, since it would have come out of my own pocket. Much to my pleasure- I checked in to my room and found that I had a "water side" view, which was incredible. I don't think this hotel has any bad views. My friend met me at the hotel, and we checked out the pool and fitness area right before it closed. I brought my camera as the city view was one to remember. Regretfully I did not catch his name, but the young man who works in that area from Thailand was very nice to us and insisted he take our picture on the balcony, even though he was needing to leave to catch the last train home. The bellstaff, valet, and greeters in the entrance of this hotel are another thing to write home about. All of the gentlemen are helpful, event when swamped with people and guests. You can't stand in the lobby with out someone asking you if you needed something or if a taxi can be called for you. They provided umbrellas when it was raining, and maps for walking (along with detailed instructions), and happily/safely store your luggage for you once you've checked out but have time before your departure. The qualifications for being hired at this Marriott must be very high. We did have one issue- the person in the room next to us was smoking both nights, and the smell would instantly seep through the adjoining doors. The first night we did not report this to the hotel staff, but the second night we alerted the night auditor at about 2am. Everyone took this very seriously (as it was a non-smoking hotel) and both security and the auditor were very concerned about our comfort and health. We were offered to be placed in a different room, but didn't want the trouble of moving and weren't extremely upset about the whole thing. Darin from security extended a free breakfast for the both of us, which Nicole kindly helped us with at the front desk in the morning. The cleaning staff leaves their name on a card, and a packet of mini-chocolate bars for you after they have finished tidying up your room. Bath products are from Bath and Body works, and are good quality. Our final morning we had breakfast downstairs, at a table right in front of the water. Samir was very attentive and inquisitive about our stay in Baltimore. He also topped our delicious buffet breakfast with a to-go brownie for each my friend and myself. The details exist in this hotel and are largely shown through the quality of the staff here. Next time I visit Baltimore this will certainly be my hotel of choice, and I would definitely recommend this to those looking for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: zennifer
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this place on Priceline and we were able to get a harbor view room at check in. Our view was spectacular! The pool was small and only had a 4' and 5' section so it's not great for kids who can't swim but it did have a lifeguard which I've never seen at a hotel pool. The location is great, very close to the aquarium, and there's a water taxi stop right outside the hotel so it's easily accessible to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: VacationJen
Reviews.Content: I thought the Marriott was very nice. We got a great rate through Priceline. If not for that I would not have been happy to spend $250 a night. While yes it's beautiful, clean and great location - the rooms are nothing special. Big TV is nice but not worth their normal rate. We got a free upgrade to a Harbor View - now that was fantastic! If money is not an issue stay here. If it is - try Priceline first- I saved a bundle.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome views!! But beware wedding season and drunken guests.”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover767
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and the view from our Inner Harbor view room on the 26th floor was awesome! Within walking distance to Little Italy for dinner and Fells Point for cocktails. Extra towels and pillows provided as requested. There were many weddings at the hotel that day, which later became our only disappointing experience...when the guests became our drunken neighbors. The yelling and banging until 2am reminded us more of a frat house than the beautiful hotel we had checked into only 12hrs earlier. However, hotel security did handle the situation promptly after we called the front desk, and the neighbors left their room to party elsewhere. In the moring we received a letter of apology and complimentary room service....nice touch and great customer service!! Otherwise, the accomodations and stay were wonderful, and we would go back again (maybe NOT during wedding season though).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location, GREAT views!”
Reviews.Author: loveshotels21
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. It is in a great location on the harbor and the views are fantastic! The service is great. Nice brunch. I loved being right there at the convention center for our conference.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: Natsfan24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful- all the staff I interacted with were terrific. The location is perfect- near the Inner Harbor but just far enough away from the crowds to enjoy it. Amazing views of the harbor and nice places to eat and shop nearby. The elevators are quick and the room was very clean. I would stay there again. The one small concern was the breakfast buffet- service was a little spooty and it all seemed a bit disorganized but they had a great selection of fresh fruit and a nice assortment of other food. Parking is a little pricey at 26 a night for self serve but it is right next to the hotel so that is good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the $$”
Reviews.Author: TheGrovesinPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel April 25-26, 2011. My wife was there for business. We often stay at Marriotts and are usually very pleased. We also tend to stay in very nice, 4 or 5 star hotels. We have no problem spending the $$, but we do expect the quality and treatment to back up the cost. Regrettably we didn't have that experience here. Great location and nice hotel. However, it's starting to show it's age some and the rooms and policies left us pretty disappointed. Cold shower one day, scalded my self next day. Weak no no wireless connectivity. Charge was $12.95 per day for internet. Connected the laptop and then tried to connect Iphone. I wanted me to agree to another $12.95 plan. Called front desk and was told that only one device could be connected at a time. Still didn't work. Next day was told by front desk that the $12.95 charge is per device, not per room. At checkout was told that really wasn't correct. This sort of misfire tended to be pretty typical for our stay. Room cleaniness was just so-so. Valet parking was $40 per day. Also had a concert right by the hotel and they were doing sound checks throughout the day that were so loud that the Gartner instructors couldn't be heard in the conference rooms. Overall the atmosphere seemed like one of empty your wallet, but expect nothing more than 2 star service or quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot on Baltimor's inner harbor!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannequi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Baltimore while looking at colleges and also hit Washington DC. Nice spot right on the harbor. New rooms were very comfortable. Bellman Kenneth was most helpful! Very friendly staff. Pool area was big with outdoor deck for nice weather. Washing machines and dryers were available. Very comfortable lobby. We sat there abit to take advantage of free WiFi. You can easily walk the inner harbor and the neighborhood just outside hotel is developing and all new. Little Italy is just a block away. Amicci's is a great family restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Situated”
Reviews.Author: restlessinrichmond
Reviews.Content: We came in for Cirque du Soleil's new show Totem, staged a short drive away, and we walked from the hotel to the aquarium the next day. Management went to lengths to make us feel welcome and accommodated (we are Silver Elite Marriott Rewards members). Our room was clean and comfortable and offered a wonderful harbor view. We ate breakfast at the hotel - the buffet was incredible. We enjoyed our stay in every respect!

Reviews.Title: “HarborView worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: marlegalBCO
Reviews.Content: Right on the harbor, at a Water Taxi stop. Top notch room and service, gorgeous lobby. Nothing I didn't like.

Reviews.Title: “Top to Bottom: A top notch " they thought of everything" hotel !”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler506078
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Marriott. From check-in through check-out we experienced smiling, welcoming faces. Any questions or concerns that we had were cheerfully and competently answered by the front desk staff, bellmen, valets and concierges. The rooms are modern, spacious, clean, well lit and insulated from noise. The beds were comfortable, clean and had plenty of pillows. You may request feather or foam pillows. The room had a refridgerator, safe, ironing board and Keurig coffee maker. The best room feature had to be the "At Your Service" button on the telephone. Questions ranging from dining to attraction transportation can be answered by these fine folks. We had a harbor view. Beautiful, especially at night. The hotel is close to just about everything: a few short minutes to the aquarium, civil war museum, movie theatre, Little Italy, Barnes and Noble, Whole Foods, CVS, the James Joyce Restaurant, the tall ships, water taxis, art museums and more. Fells Point is right up the street and is probably a 10-15 minute walk. We did not eat dinner at the hotel but did have the breakfast buffet. It is pricey at $16.50 plus tax and tip but the food is very good. All non-alcholic breakfast drinks are included. Criticisms are small and as follows: The iron in the room leaked water on our clothes; no damage, just water. A strip of wood fell off of a drawer when opened. There are additional outlets near the tv for computers, cell phones, etc. When we removed the plug the entire faceplate pulled away from the cabinet. It took two hands to unplug our items. The feature that I disliked the most in the room was the cable tv system. The channel selection is limited. The menus were inconvenient to use and blocked out the show being watched when in use. Almost nothing in the "On Demand" section was free. The fees were 3.99 and 4.99 for 22 minute tv shows that had aired less than a month ago on ABC, NBC, Fox and CBS. There are examples of digital systems from major cable tv providers that "cable company X" would do well to emulate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Mediocre Room”
Reviews.Author: SOCIAWG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott with my wife for three nights while attending a conference. The conference facilites are very nice, but they keep the conference rooms rather cold. The location is great -- near Little Italy with wonderful restaurants and, of course, the inner harbor and Fells Point just down the road. The room was not great. We were on the 8th floor with a view of the parking garage. Request a harbor view and higher floor if possible. The shower head had one setting although it was supposed to be an adjustable shower head -- obviously broken but not replaced. The bathroom did not have an exhaust fan or heat lamp. There is a coffee maker in the room and there is a cabinet for a small refrigerator; however, there was no refrigerator in the cabinet. Had drinks in the bar one evening -- very expensive. My pet peeve is no free internet except in the lobby; $12.95 per day in the room. Ate breakfast in the hotel one morning -- expect to pay at least $15.00 per person for two eggs, bacon and juice. Although the property is only a few years old (5 or 6) it is not very well maintained and the lack of maintenance is showing. The staff was attentive for the most part. Lobby areas are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: bedavies
Reviews.Content: Awoke with bites all over my legs! Didn't actually see any bugs, but then again, you usuallyt don't see them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationer28216
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. Beautiful views of the water, beautiful rooms, and friendly staff. The only downside is that the restaurant at the hotel was very slow and much too expensive for the quality of the food that they serve (over 30 minuted for 3 burgers, and more than $50 for 3 people with burgers, fries, and sodas). A 5 minute walk to RA, however, is well worth the trip for some GREAT sushi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harrisburg
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and thought the hotel was very nice. The concierge level is fantastic if you have access to it. Rooms were tidy, location was great. Parking was easy. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best concierge lounges I have been to”
Reviews.Author: GlenElgin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Marriott Baltimore Waterfront hotel with family over on vacation. I have stayed here before over a weekend but this was the first time during the Club lounge opening hours. What can I say the staff were very helpful, I am a Marriott rewards member and they upgraded both my rooms to harbor views one of which was a suite. The highlight of this hotel has to be the Club/Concierge lounge it has the most amazing views 31st floor and snacks all day long. We had clam chowder mid afternoon as we gathered to head out. The breakfast however surpasses all other lounges it had a member of staff making omelets and a great buffet selection that some hotels only dream of as their main breakfast. If you’re a Marriott Elite member and can use the lounge this is a huge plus, if not I would recommend upgrading to a club level. This is a great hotel the car parking is a little on the expensive side but most city centre hotels tend to be this way.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing in B Town”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_O_Really
Reviews.Content: Hotel was big, I had a room on the 22nd with a great harbor view. Room was nice, clean, bed comfy, and pretty quiet overall. Great location. Ate in the restaurant downstairs for breakfast a couple of times and the food was pretty good and the staff very friendly. Looks like the hotel hosts conventions as a lot of badges walking around doing their thing. Blast of cold air coming in off the water front to look forward to for any outside treks or wandering near the front entrance. Valet was pretty quick and efficient. Nothing remarkable happened during my stay. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a conference”
Reviews.Author: EJW8191
Reviews.Content: The Winter Simulation Conference was here. Pluses: quiet, large comfortable room, well-furnished, good mattress. Attractive pictures in sleeping rooms and meeting rooms. Convenient location for waterfront sights (e.g., historic ships). So-so: reception service. Minuses: Avoid the hotel restaurant: so-so food and poor service (so bad I left zero tip). The three servers who handed off my dinner service let me wait 20 minutes before coming to the table (the restaurant was not crowded), brought a rare hamburger (I had asked for well-done), and seemed peeved that I ordered no alcoholic beverage (that must be where the profit is). One meeting room on the fourth floor so noisy (sounded like runaway motor next door) that we could not hear the speaker. Internet service in business center grotesquely over-expensive and computers malfunctioned more often than not.

Reviews.Title: “Clean yet Corporate”
Reviews.Author: PricelineGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and purchased via Priceline. The hotel is nicely situated on the waterfront and provides good views. It was clean but rather corporate-feeling, more so than other major chain hotels I've stayed in. It felt a little like a slightly upscale 2.5 star Holiday Inn as opposed to having the quality and character of a 4 star. Nevertheless, it was clean. Apart from one minor misunderstanding staff was helpful. PARKING: As of 12/10 it is $40 for valet and $26 for self-parking in a lot next to the hotel, both with in/out privileges. The hotel valet has reserved all parking spaces on the first 4 floors of the parking structure so be prepared to drive up a long way in order to self-park. NOTE: A high rise is going up about 100 feet away. We there on the weekend when there was no construction but during the week I would assume ample construction noise on that side of the hotel. WIFI: Unfortunately some hotels still charge for in-room Wifi and this hotel is one of them. I think it was $14/day or thereabouts.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixtraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is truly beautiful and delivers great service. I attended a meeting at the hote with colleagues. The lobby and amenities are great. Staff were very helpful and professional. The room was comfortable and well appointed. My only complaint was that I could hear people talking iont he next room. The lobby bar was fun and and had good happy hour pricing. I has a great view front he 23rd floor

Reviews.Title: “Valet Lost my car and then lost my car keys”
Reviews.Author: DRoman
Reviews.Content: What started as a good morning on my way to an event in Baltimore, turned out to more than an hour in the lobby while the valet searched for my car. First they brought me the wrong car and then they actually couldn't find my car. I had to walk with the valet attendant four levels searching for my rental. Thankfully I had a box in the back and could identify my car. After I found my car, they then they couldn't find my car keys. We had to go back down to the valet room and my colleague and I had to go through every key to try to identify our keys. Not a easy feat when you're driving a rental. We finally found our keys (my colleague and I) -- maybe we should be running the valet department at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “More comfortable than home”
Reviews.Author: BoatGrl
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, spacious, comfortable rooms. I liked that the rooms had nautical pictures, a higher quality than most hotels. The beds and the armchair were very comfortable. As a business traveller, the one downside was that the in-room network connection is very expensive. Luckily, there's free wireless in the lobby. The workout center was better than average, with multiple ellipticals, stairmasters and treadmills. The pool was great - perfect warm temperature and long enough for laps. A few nice touches - apples in the workout center and apple cider in the lobby. The staff was very helpful with recommendations, although not particularly knowledgable about how to get around the city to see sites.

Reviews.Title: “poor service and uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotell
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night and found that the hotel is not worth the price paid. The bathroom was very small and I found some dirty spots on the toilet seat and the sink. I called the front desk and the lady rudely said that she will send housekeeping. No one arrived for hours, so I finally decided to let it go and go to bed. In addition, I found that the bed was very uncomfortable. The mattress needs to be upgraded in that hotel and customer service needs to reflect the Marriott standard at that location. I have stayed there in the past and have had good experience. Maybe this was a single employee and not reflective of the entire staff. But nevertheless, the mattress was very old and needed to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale room, very nice, staff very helpful”
Reviews.Author: RanMan1
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night for a business meeting. Arrived very late and was quickly registered. Elevators are very fast - important for a tall hotel. Very clean room. Also a great location. I visited the business office - which needed to be maintained better as several machines were not functioning properly - and accidentally left my usb drive behind. I later called the hotel and they FedEx'd my drive back to me. What a relief as that USB had critical information on it. Great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Entlebuch
Reviews.Content: OK... Unless you get a really good rate with Priceline or other online site you should always expect to pay a high price at a Marriott hotel located in a city center. However, the high prices would be more tolerable if they did not then proceed to hit you with additional charges for in room internet ($12/day) and just about every other service. The business center charges outrageously high fees for the use of computers and printers but the advantage I suppose is that it was almost always empty. At well over 200 dollars a night you would think that Marriott would be able to include free internet. After all, most budget hotels are able to do that. Parking fees are also high (up to $40/day). The gym is decent and amazingly does not cost extra! Great location though, and Baltimore has free buses (Charm City Circulator) that will take you near just about every interesting site in the city. These buses come very near the hotel every ten minutes or so.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with superior service”
Reviews.Author: WHW
Reviews.Content: We were told ours was to be a standard room with a city view with our conference rate. We were escorted to a wonderfully large room with a harbor view. We didn't ask for an upgrade, but think being a Marriott Rewards Member, they must have just done that. This is a beautiful building and location. The staff was incredible. The food was outstanding. There was some work being done near by, but for the most part, was very quiet. Our room was very clean. We'd stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Tired!”
Reviews.Author: PaCardFan
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay here, and the 1st since July of 2007. The rooms need redone badly! Our room had complete Inner Harbor view, but that is the only positive. The room reeked of cigarette smoke. There were vacant holes where the refrigerator and mini-bar once were. The bathroom door was so warped that it would not close properly. All in all, a very disappointing stay. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “overall nice, thin walls, a little too plain”
Reviews.Author: pere-la
Reviews.Content: It's nice overall, pretty standard 4-star room, nothing fancy, actually a bit too plain in comparison with other 4 star hotels i stayed at. thin walls, can hear noises from neighbors and upstairs, and outside room. internet is 13 dollars a day. no free breakfast. my room didn't have a view, so cannot comment on the view. anyway, overall, it's a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: nic977
Reviews.Content: I guess the hotel is not bad, the only thing is that when we went there in late July, they have water damage in some area and outside of the hotel always have these big truck there to fix the water damage and was really noisy. Kind of pricey and we didn't get any waterview in our room either..... only oversees the parking garage....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but close to noisy concerts”
Reviews.Author: freenokia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel is really nice. Location is nice; close to Wholefoods and a bunch of nice restaurants. Has two towers whose rooms either have a great view facing the city or the harbor. However, it's right next to an open air venue that have concerts on both nights. Unfortunately the hotel was supposedly full and I couldn't switch rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in walking distance of all sites”
Reviews.Author: MGA64
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the executive suite that was clean, decorated very modern, with a wet bar, and 55" flatscreen that swiveled to watch in living room or bedroom. The staff was very attentive especially since we were there with about 125 people for a wedding that needed guidance for shuttles. Everything is in walking distance: restaurants, harbor, and shopping. They recommended Shirleys for breakfast, one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS and HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: anonymous827
Reviews.Content: To sum it up I was a guest at the Marriott on a business trip, attending a conference held within the hotel. To make a long story short. I checked in late in the evening on a Monday, went to sleep, woke up and attended the conference. Throughout the day I began itching only to discover later that evening I had large red bumps on my back and shoulders. I then went to John Hopkins Hospital for medical treatment only to be told what I had was bed bug bites! I quickly returned to the hotel and alerted staff. They moved me to another room and locked off the room I was in and said they would have it inspected. It was not until late the next afternoon that they had an inspector who was the hotel's routine, regular "hotel inspector" come in to investigate. My first concern is the hotel did not contact the health dept to report this incident. Additionally they called in some "routine" guy to inspect the room. So, naturally the hotel manager, "Nick" (who has also been mentioned in a previous review) contacted me and said they have no evidence of bed bugs in their room. I was in perfect health with not a bite on my body between checking in and discovering the to be determined bed bugs and I had not left the hotel. Without carrying on any longer I will just say that the manager Nick and all other staff that I dealt with were very very rude and unsympathetic to the situation and in no way, shape or form accepting any bit of responsibility of the matter. In addition to being in great physical discomfort, I was mistreated by staff and also at the advice of the hospital's doctor discarded all my belongings. I did not receive any bit of an apology or compassion from any staff member of the hotel nor did I receive a penny in reimbursement for the bug infected room or any of my personal belongings that I had to discard. This is only the beginning of me spreading the word about my experience in hopes that hopefully no one will go through the same thing as me and maybe if staff of the hotel reads this it will prompt some changes. After this trip I will NEVER stay at a Marriott hotel again. To say I left disappointed is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: nychic2020
Reviews.Content: Super friendly staff, clean, clean,clean!! Perfect location in the Inner Harbor area, walking distance to Little Italy, the Aquarium, shopping and great restaurants. Nice outdoor area by the pool. We were on the 25th floor so view was spectacular, definately worth paying for the upgrade for the view!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, near Inner Harbour and Little Italy”
Reviews.Author: DEBarbie
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed hotel with fantastic views of the Inner Harbour. Next to the concert pavillion and near all IH attractions. Bedding, furniture and fixtures were top notch. 5th floor has an indoor pool (open 6am-11pm) and a fitness center. Nice towels, apples in the workout area and a lovely outdoor sundeck were by the indoor pool. No problem bringing your own drinks in to the deck area. Hotel seems very posh! This hotel is totally full service, and for the $80 I paid through Priceline I would stay again in a heartbeat. Go ahead and have breakfast at the hotel, we chose not to and at 9am there was nothing within walking distance besides Johnny Rockets in the mall. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: jennywelch
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 weeks, with spouse and joined by kids. Rooms are very nice, housekeeping staff do a good job, restaurant nothing special except for breakfast. Location is fantastic and perfect for the outdoor concerts! Valet staff very good and give excellent directions. Overall, a nice hotel, helpful staff but the costs add up in this location. Don't send your whites to the hotel laundry, returned gray!

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel with pretty views of the Harbor, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jaysonsmith
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront is a centrally located hotel, with fantastic dining and shopping options within footsteps from the main lobby. The rooms are of very good quality, and the higher floors provide fantastic views of the surrounding area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Baltimore area, and would rate it near the top of the major chain hotels within the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: theTraveLees
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for a last-minute weekend in Baltimore. Location is great and the walk outside the hotel along the waterfront is just gorgeous. 5-10 minute walk from Whole Food and Miss Shirley's, 20-25 minute walk to the ballpark. Movie theater right across the street. The hotel overlooks the waterfront but our room overlooked the top of a parking garage. Parking was expensive ($26 as of August 2010), but we found a garage on Eden and Fleet Streets, about 4-5 blocks from the hotel. Weekend parking was $3/day, so we ended up paying $6 for parking instead of $26. The room was adequate. No kings were available so we got two queens, which looked decidedly too small to be queen beds. The beds were extremely comfortable, though, and the room and bathroom were clean. Bonus points for having a Keurig coffeemaker in the room, negative points for charging for internet. If we were staying for more than one night, we would probably not choose this hotel again, as the walls were SUPER thin - we could hear everything going on in the hallways, rooms, and bathrooms around us. But for one night for $145 (priceline), it suited us fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CrazyFoodieGuy
Reviews.Content: Overall we were quite impressed with this hotel. The rooms were extremely clean for my fiance (who is ultra picky about cleanliness) & the bed was ultra soft (even better than Westin's Heavenly beds). We liked the colour & styling both of the rooms & of the entire hotel. We had a 29th floor harbour view which I could have sat staring outside for hours. The location was perfect for walking to the harbour & for driving to "Captain James Landing" which is a must-go for any crab lovers! Only issue we had was that the price was quite steep as we paid almost $400 (after tax & parking) for one night. I wouldn't quite put this hotel as a 5 star...like Ritz Carltons & Four Seasons so charging that much is a little crazy for me. However, if you are able to find a promo code for this place & to stay here for under $250, defnly book it immediately!

Reviews.Title: “If you're not a millionaire you don't deserve great service on vacation.”
Reviews.Author: cahiami
Reviews.Content: I just had the worst experience I have ever had at a hotel. I have stayed at roach motels that were more inviting and accommodating than this location. I've also stayed at lovely marriott hotels before that provided a wonderful stay. Upon arriving to this location we were greeted by the noisy roar of some type of water removal/water damage control machine out side of the building sitting in the middle of the driveway and entrance to the building. When I went inside to check in I soon became aware what was going on, with all the tubes pumping air through the rooms and the slight smell of moisture that had been sitting on the walls. This however did not bother me too much, I understand that stuff happens. I began the check-in process. This is when I quickly realized that the quote I had been given on the internet was no where near my true price. Fee after fee was added on to my original quote, including a 15% tax, nightly "incidentials", and of course parking... which was way more expensive than I could have found elsewhere but hey, convenience is expensive. But having no other choice I took the new price and continued my reservation. Soon I found out that #1 internet was not free, #2 there was no such thing as a continental breakfast, and #3 on my second day, No one came in to my room to provide me new towels or make the beds. I never put up a do not disturb sign. No one offered to help us with our bags as we made our way into the hotel even though we had a few. The staff were distant and unconcerned that we even existed. Unless of course they were trying to get money from us. The whole stay was absolutely uncomfortable. I felt like the hotel was simply trying to squeeze every last penny out of me (maybe to pay for their water damages) and send me on my way while providing the least service and hospitality possible. Then upon checking out I was informed that I would be charged for internet. This I fought because of the fact that we were told that we could have one day of free internet if we came all the way downstairs and sat in the lobby. So at midnight on the first day after a long day of excitement in lovely baltimore we had to leave the comfort and privacy of our rooms to go downstairs into the public lobby in order to get access to the internet. We did this on the first night only. The second night we were too exhausted from a day on the town to even bother staying awake. I was very upset to find out that they were attempting to charge us this fee after we inconvenienced ourselves on our vacation in order to NOT get charged for something that even the crappiest, cheapest 1-2 star hotels provide for FREE. Upon asking the receptionist why the hotel did not provide us any of these conveniences such as breakfast, morning coffee, or free internet. Her response was, "Ma'am, This is a 5 star hotel." In a very condescending and greater-than-thou tone. This was outrageous. Apparently with this statement she implied that the more stars a hotel has the less service and hospitality it has to provide. The more stars a hotel has the less the employees have to be concerned about the experience and comfort of the guests. AND the hum-dinger of all, that because this was a 5 star hotel, people like me were the only ones who had a problem with paying for all the modern conveniences that cheaper hotels provide for free at a marginally lower price. Apparently, I don't possess enough money to have a good experience at your hotel. Apparently, your hotel is too "rich" for me. And apparently, your hotel doesn't mind imposing a criminal 15% tax and other miscellaneous charges on some innocent vacationers and STILL making them feel like worthless scum while they stay. Apparently 5 star really means 1 star, and believe me I would much rather stay at a days inn next time i visit baltimore (which I do once a year) Or even the Tremont plaza which has always provided excellent service and amenities. The only good thing about my stay at this hotel was my view from the 24th floor of the entire city of baltimore, which was breathtaking. But I could get that at the Tremont too. I will make sure that no one I care about has to deal with the stress and anxiety this hotel provided me on my vacation this year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location, beware if there is a concert adjacent”
Reviews.Author: cruisermeg
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here a few weeks ago using Marriott Rewards points. The hotel was VERY busy with a conference, but I was able to check in fairly early. I was upgraded to a Corner King room overlooking the Inner Harbor. Very nice room, clean, lots of big windows and an excellent view. My only issue, and it is a big one, was that there was a rock concert (Counting Crows) at the amphitheater adjacent to the hotel and the noise went on until 11 PM. I later found out that they hotel, as a rule, hands out letters to arriving guests on/around days that concerts take place, but nothing was given to me, nor did some staffers know this was going on. I suggested that they get some updated info from the venue as fully half of the rooms would be affected by the noise. The property itself is lovely. Very friendly staff, and they pay attention to details. A large piece of tarp from a nearby construction site blew into the entry driveway and a bellman promptly removed it. I did not drive so I can't comment on the parking. However, the hotel is very well located for seeing the area, including the harbor, Little Italy, Fells Point etc. There is a water taxi stop just outside the hotel. I didn't eat in the restaurant but there is a combination Starbucks/deli/gift shop that looked popular, in addition to the restaurant. There are so many good restaurants in town, there was no reason to eat in the hotel. If you are an elite member of the Marriott Rewards program you will have access to one of the best Concierge Lounges in the company. It was open all day with a wide array of beverages (including 2 flavors of fresh brewed iced tea), omeletes and pancakes cooked to order, along with the usual array of Concierge breakfast offerings. Around lunchtime, they had crab/corn chowder as well. The evening offerings included a few kinds of hot appetizers as well as cheese displays, crudite and more. Dessert was the only thing lacking. Nice variety but some of the things tasted like they'd been in the fridge too long. This hotel would be a great choice for a pre or post cruise stay as well. Rates are not cheap, but if you look, you might be able to find a deal (or at least a reasonable price.) I will go back in the future. My one night stay was just too short...though I will make sure there aren't any concerts. (They did offer to move my room, but frankly I didn't stay in Baltimore near the Harbor to NOT see water.....and the noise did stop, as I was informed, just before 11 PM.)

Reviews.Title: “What Can I Say? Loved this Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CityGirl610
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. I think it should be a JW - much, much nicer than your typical Marriott hotel. The location is great, right on the Inner Harbor. The lobby is really stunning. When you walk in, there is a large "living room" area to your right. You can lounge here and take advantage of the free WiFi. I was upgraded to a Harbor View Room. I think the majority of the rooms have at least a partial view of the Inner Harbor. Very comfortable bed and nice amenities. My only complaint was the room temperature - I think the large windows absorb a lot of heat, making it hard to cool the room. That said, it was 100 plus degrees during my stay, so I really can't complain. I did not have much interaction with staff, but everyone I encountered was very, very pleasant. I would definitely return to this hotel if I wasn't moving to Baltimore very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service, Superb Location, Superb Inner Harbor Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jakeocallahan
Reviews.Content: Back in March, I attended the American Health Lawyer's Association Conference and stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront for three nights. The hotel is about a 7 minute cab ride from Penn Station. The hotel lobby is striking and immaculate. The front desk is well staffed and the staff was very friendly. Because I am a Marriott Rewards member, I received a complimentary room upgrade (partial water view). I didn't have to ask. I also received a complimentary half of bottle of wine; which after a 6 hour train ride, was a nice touch. The room was spacious, ultra clean, and smelled fresh. Service people were always prompt and courteous. I paid around $200/night which I thought was a good value. I highly recommend this hotel. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: justlucy123
Reviews.Content: This is our first time at Baltimore Marriott Waterfront. Had been to Baltimore about half a dozen times or so and have stayed at different hotels around the Inner Harbor. Read the different reviews about the place and decided to try it out this summer. We made reservations online about 2 weeks prior to our stay. We were able to have the two twin beds (have a tween) guaranteed but the early check in and high floor were not guaranteed. We did not ask for a particular room (could not afford the suites or the harbor view). We had trouble getting to the hotel (street signs were confusing) especially since we were going to self-park. Had to go around the round-about and into Pier V area to turn around a couple of times. Once inside the hotel itself, it was a wonderful experience. The lobby is beautiful. It does not have loud music blaring the whole time. Fresh lemonade was available in the lobby. On the other end of the table was a hand sanitizer. Very convenient. Hand sanitizers were also available by the elevators. There were two sets of three of elevators - one for Lobby, 2, 3, 4, 5 and rooms up to 23. The other set of elevators were for Lobby, 2, 3, 4, 5 and rooms 24 to 32. We ended up on the 29th floor with amazing views of the inner harbor. The room was beautifully furnished (usual Marriott style) with nice desk, HD TV, reading lights (in addition to desk lamps by the bedside). There was a little nook for the coffee maker and ice bucket. Coffee maker and ice bucket doesn't have to take up space on the desk. I thought that was a great touch. There was a safe in the room (inside top desk drawer) - we did not use it. Indoor pool, dry sauna and fitness center on 5th floor. No hot tub. Walls are okay - could not hear noise from hallway or next door. The service staff are friendly and polite and efficient. After we got in our room, we noticed that the refrigerator was not working. We did not call the front desk right away (not really an emergency). My husband and daughter went out to check the pool, restaurant, etc. After they got back in the room, my husband said he stopped by the front desk and told them about the refrigerator and he was told that they will send somebody right away. And they did. About 10-15 minutes later, somebody came in to check our refrigerator, and deemed it not working. He said he will be back with a replacement. And he did, about 15 minutes later. And no, they did not charge us for using the refrigerator. Had a great experience with the hotel and will definitely use it next time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TheRunningMan09
Reviews.Content: Great location . Great view of the harbor from our room. Easy walk to National Aquarium. Little Italy is also within walking distance. The staff was helpful. Brunch was good . I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Great Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ewcooke
Reviews.Content: The room offered a great view and was absolutely amazing. Hotel service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Views, Attractions, Convenience”
Reviews.Author: GArmada02
Reviews.Content: Short walk to all Inner Harbor attractions, spectacular views, all around well appointed hotel. Those are the reasons I selected the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront as my hotel of choice for my partner and I. Located in Harbor East an upcoming upscale neighborhood this hotel surely stands out from most. At 34 stories high most rooms have amazing views. Convenient walking distance to all of Inner Harbor and a water taxi landing is just outside the front door. Though no hotel is flawless. The parking is $25/night. However if you do your research and ask a front desk associate there is alternate garage parking a short walk away (about 8min) and a lot cheaper. The restaurant is on the pricey side and the room rate is average for a hotel like this. There are plenty of food and entertainment choices all around the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a room with a waterfront view”
Reviews.Author: jw07747
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a long weekend in June and had a great stay! The biggest disappointment was the promise of a waterfront view and actually receiving a room with a view of the parking garage and several large buildings blocking the view of the water!!!! We did see in between two of the buildings in the far distance was the tiniest bit of water but that was it! I had read some reviews before booking and saw that some people had mentioned this happening to them..but when I called to book I asked specifically for a waterfront view and I was told "ALL rooms have a view of the water". I did notice on my confirmation that it said partial waterfront view, which is I guess how they get away with making these promises! Besides that, we truly enjoyed our stay..staff was extremely nice, breakfast stay package was definitely worth it for the awesome buffet, and it is a prime location!! We were able to sit on the steps of the hotel on a beautiful night and listen to Earth, Wind and Fire perform across the water at the concert pavilion..definitely a highlight of our trip! Fells Point was great for some drinks and live music, the Museum of Visionary arts in Federal Hill was really interesting, and another favorite was Dangerously Delicious Pies in Federal Hill...AMAZING PIES!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: patetherington
Reviews.Content: Awesome is the only word to describe it. Very beautiful and clean. Went there for work on a business trip. Had a very good experience there. Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bigBer
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a good experience at the Marriott and would happily stay there again. Unlike other reviewers, we found the staff to be extremely friendly, from the first doorman to the concierge the final day. Parking is valet (to be expected with a downtown hotel) or self-park around the corner: still $25/day. The neighborhood is definitely “up and coming” with high-end restaurants and new construction. For those who need a coffee or ice cream fix, there is a full Starbucks and Haagen-Dazs right around the corner. While the hotel is “just off” the main inner harbor area, our toddler had no problem managing the short walk to the aquarium, shops, or even a bit longer hike across the harbor to the merry-go-round. The room was clean, well outfitted (although it could have used a mini-fridge), and large enough to fit all of the stuff required for travel with two kids. The main knock on the room that I can report is that the ice buckets hold at best a cup and a half of ice. And if you’re traveling with little ones, be warned that there are few children’s channels available and additional children’s programming is available only at a cost – a relatively minor details since we were rarely in the room. Cold water and lemonade were available in the lobby which was refreshing after the long, hot days wandering around the waterfront. Overall, a good experience especially for the Priceline deal that we received.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST 4 star hotel, EVER”
Reviews.Author: infoseeker111
Reviews.Content: There are so many I would like to complain about this hotel, but I can sum up by saying this; THE EMPLOYEES ARE RUDE. No professionalism at all. I actually called the customer service before I checked out, but don't bother, it took 25 minutes until I finally got to talk to a human being, and this "Dave" guy treated me like I am a free loader. Well, maybe that was only because I got reservation thru Priceline. Anyway, if you want to stay at a 4 star hotel in Inner Harbor, book Hyatt or Renaissance or any other hotel but this one. Next time I use Priceline to stay in Inner Harbor, which is unlikely, I will choose 3 and a half star. I just do not want to end up staying at Marriott Waterfront. By the way, the location isn't that great either. It was 10-15 minutes walk to ESPN, which will be closed next week or the Gallery. And overall, this hotel was a bit too touristy. The Internet was over 12 dollars a day with free local and long distance calls. I didn't use the business center, but I know they charge you for printing and copying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Comfy room, Amazing Buffet but no free Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Th3HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront for 4 nights in late May. We got a great nightly rate on a 3rd party site so I would encourage you to check those out--the regular rate is very expensive. Check-in was a breeze & Ashley (desk clerk) was a delight--always smiling & willing to answer all of our questions which was great because the concierge was always busy or didn't answer their line. Our room was large, clean and featured the Keurig machines with plentiful asst of coffees & teas. We already knew about the $25 per night parking & $12.99 daily Wi-Fi fee so we weren't caught off guard. We found free access in lobby which worked for us but this probably wouldn't be practical for a business traveler. Sunday Champagne Buffet is $24.50 but was out-of-this world--I would highly recommend it. We didn't use the pool or exercise room but others mention on here mention the small size/outdated equipment. Overall, if you can get a great nightly rate, this hotel is in a great location. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dnrest
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, perfect place to stay. We enjoyed our stay too bad we had to move to another hotel the next night because we did book the other hotel first and didn't want to cancel. We would have stayed here both nights if we had to do it all over again. It was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing for price”
Reviews.Author: johndo1
Reviews.Content: planned an overnite relaxation evening and requested a king,private,quiet with a harborview. instead, received a noisy room with a garage view with an odor. staff was unfriendly with poor service attitude. the public spaces are nice but the rooms are very basic. fitness center was minimal. way too pricey for $380! maybe the four seasons will be good when it opens!

Reviews.Title: “Noise Reduction”
Reviews.Author: planourtrip
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, wonderful views, but it badly needs some type of trim/foam around the doors to reduce noise from the hallway, other rooms, etc. Also, the fitness equipment left much to be desired (some pieces didn't work, some were squeeky - maybe my hearing was oddly sensitive on this trip?!), good thing a run along the Inner Harbor is at the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vtbrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and haven't had a bad experience yet. The views are amazing, the rooms are spacious and very clean and personnel have been friendly. I had my own car, so I didn't have to worry about using the hotel shuttle. I chose to self park which is somewhat expensvie at $25/night. The internet, as someone else mentioned, is also expensive, but it is free in the concierge lounge if you are a gold or platinum Marriott member. Speaking of the lounge - great snacks at night and breakfast in the mroning. The honor bar is somewhat pricey so I would suggest checking out one of the nearby restaurants. I found the gym to be well equipped with treadmills, elliptical runners and weight machines. Compared to other hotel gyms, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - not worth the price...”
Reviews.Author: BoulderTraveler666
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a conference and wish I had stayed somewhere else. High cost / low value. Terrible room service menu and they don't allow deliveries! I ordered a pizza and they wouldn't allow the pizza guy upstairs to deliver. The "fitness center" equipment is poorly maintained and in a state of disrepair. The business center charges for printing even a 1 page document. As a consultant, I wouldn't recommend staying there, as they charge $13 per day for internet access which is a very difficult cost to get clients to agree to pay. If you were to stay a month the cost would exceed $500. I moved hotels to a Holiday Inn and received top-of-the-line fitness gear (brand new), free internet service and fantastic room service for less than half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service, especially from manager Nick”
Reviews.Author: dmkmovies
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a convenient location, new and clean, but if you want service, go elsewhere. We were short on time so we decided to grab a quick bite at the restaurant. We waited for at least 10 minutes before a sever finally approached us (he had passed by us at least 8 times) so thankfully our invisibility wore off. We ordered and the food, which came out quickly, sat under the heat lamps for several minutes. The airport shuttle, which the hotel's concierge explained to me a day earlier, would be at the hotel, did not show. I went to the lobby early and waited for over 30 minutes (after asking about it to a bellman) and when I inquired a second time, was told that "oh, they aren't reliable" so I had to get a cab. Both bellmen told me that the shuttle was unreliable after I had waited for a long time, needing to get to the airport. It would have been nice to know that before depending on it to get to the airport. When my girlfriend, who was still at the hotel explained this to manager Nick, he blew her off, insisted that the shuttle was reliable, and said he would credit the room. He did not give her the credit so when she checked out the next day, the front desk person asked Nick about it and he came out and authorized it but did not acknowledge my girlfriend who was standing in front of him. Instead of apologizing for his staff giving out improper information, Nick made it very clear that he did not believe us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a perfect location - you cannot go wrong with Marriott”
Reviews.Author: BVThomps
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay here for 2 nights with my husband for his birthday and we were both extremely pleased with the property. The hotel's location is ideal. We drove to Baltimore and parked the car at the adjacent parking lot. Parking is $25 per day, and there are additional charges if you stay longer, but it is worth it. You won't need to pay for the water taxi to visit local attractions they are all within walking distance except perhaps Camden Yards and Fort McHenry. Everything else you would need or want is right there. We were lucky to have a Harbor View room from the 25th floor - fantastic to wake up to and stunning when lit up at night. The hotel restaurant Grille 700 offers delicious buffets and friendly service staff. No complaints there. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for families, couples, singles and those looking for an excellent location. Clearly the business community has discovered this gem and several convention folks were staying there during our visit. The weather this past week was a bit disappointing, but the hotel was the clear bright spot to our romantic birthday getaway. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Baltimore so far!!”
Reviews.Author: aban
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was wonderful, thank-you Kody! Room and location were great. After five overnight trips to Baltimore, this was the nicest hotel yet. We had business at the Convention Center, and did not mind the walk. First time booking through priceline, Thanks to Tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: picruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late April. The hotel is beautiful and conveniently located. The parking is steep at $25 a day, but connected right to the hotel. The staff is very friendly. The buffet breakfast is wonderful! And when I thought it couldn't get any better, the Sunday brunch was even better!! We were given dinner vouchers by our business partners for the hotel restaurant. The special was the delmonico steak...out of this world!! With a great crab sauce...very affordable. Only negative is the noise in the hallways. Even the slightest knock on someone else's door could be heard. The late night revelers were a bit bothersome. While walking about the Inner Harbor, the guides were very friendly and helpful, as were the local police force. We visited the aquarium, which was top notch...The Science Center had alot of hands on experiments for children. We were able to see the I-max show, which was great. Philip's Restaurant was great, as was lunch at the Irish Pub. A great weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: HotelProNJ
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our recent stay at the Marriott Waterfront Hotel. I am a Hotel professional and my expectations probably exceed that of the typical guest. I can't help but critque service and cleanliness and it sometimes can make an okay hotel a bad one in my eyes. Since I know the ins and outs of the Opaque channels I was able to get a fair price for this hotel although I was wasn't pleased a first with the location. The area the hotel is in is beautiful and definately an area I would never have aprehensions on staying in again. The hotel was well staffed with friendly individuals who definately got what providing service is and means. The only reason I did not give a 5 to sevice was the wait for a rollaway bed. I requested one about 11:30 am and returned to the room at 8:30pm and it was still not there. I had to place 2 more calls and it showed up around 10:30pm. Outlets in the hotel were nice and well run and self parking was very easy and safe. Starbucks is right around the corner as well as many upscale chain restaurants, shops and a theater.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LOCATION, GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ciaoaria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect wonderful location!!! Once you park your car, you won't need it until you leave!! It is absolutely at walking distance to Inner harbor and great restaurants. We loved the beds (even if they are a little bit small), rooms are clean and quiet. For the very first time ever in a hotel I slept all night without waking up at any noise around me!! If we need to go back to Baltimore, we would for sure consider this hotel. We saw other parts of the city that very very very scary!!! even in the middle of the afternoon. The pool is pretty small :( for the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel....but not nice enough, that we would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: mallen2980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel March 26-28, 2010. The hotel itself was very pleasing to the eye, except for seeing most of the workers on their cell phones (from the vallet, to the cook making your omelet at the breakfast buffet). When we arrived in our room, we were very shocked to see that there was not a microwave, nor a refrigerator in the room, (I guess they want you to patronize their expensive services).
