So, we decided to head out to eat at one of the nearby restaurants (which mostly are ala carte). We went to the front desk to have our parking ticket validated, however we were told that the Marriott does not validate parking. We had to pay $25.00 per day for parking. We were very upset about this as we were not told about the parking fees while booking our reservation. When we got back to the hotel we were very shocked to hear how thin the walls were. We were able to hear EVERYTHING going on in the room next to us and above us (including the plumbing). All in all, it was a nice hotel, but we would only stay there again, if we were getting the room for dirt cheap (especially since you have to pay $25.00 for parking per day).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staycation at the Marriott Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: drkarb
Reviews.Content: We stay annually at the Marriott Waterfront in Baltimore during the 4th of July holiday. The location of the hotel is ideal and one can see fireworks from the room. We were upgraded, by virtue of being Marriott rewards members, to a harbor view room. At the start of the fireworks, we just went down to the driveway to get the full effect. The location is in Harbor East, near shops, restaurants, a cinema, and a market. We walked to the Inner Harbor, as well. Our children enjoyed the pool during the afternoon. We also loved the extravagent breakfast. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: msurgery
Reviews.Content: Stayed on March 11, 2010 to March 15, total of 5 days after spending one night at Renessance hotel about 0.2 miles from this hotel. I loved this one compared to Renessance. I went with my wife and 20 months old twin boys. The room had spectacular view of ocean. The hotel is located right on the waterfront as the name. Staff were helpful but we didn't required them much. We didn't rent a car, so traveled by taxi a few times and mostly stayed in downtown. Not much things to do in downtown for 6 days, especially when it was raining. That was unfortunate (nothing of hotel's fault). If I have to go back to Baltimore downtown, I would definately choose this hotel again. Yes, this hotel and ammenities are expensive BUT surrounding restaurants are all way too over priced that hotel room service seemed so cheap. Really~ after spending 5 days, we realized eating via room service was the cheapest. Room service in Marriott as cheap?? that's how expensive it is around the harbor. So, if I visit Baltimore again, I probably would sleep outside of the downtown and sleep in motel with free parking and free internet but have rental car to go around. Parking in this hotel is way too expensive to stay for 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: whytegroup
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took my daughter and several of her girl friends for a weekend escape to the Inner Harbor in Baltimore. We selected the Marriott Waterfront Hotel as our base of operations since it is right on the Inner Harbor. From the time of check in until our departure around 12 noon the next day we had a wonderful stay. We were given connecting rooms overlooking the Harbor with a great view especially at night. In the morning we decided to order breakfast in bed and it arrived right on time at 9:00 am. The staff had such a nice attitude about them. I can only say this is a great place to escape.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Location. Expesnive for Non-Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: GrlTrvlr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! the staff was excellent especially with shipping and receiving packages. I had a corner king room over looking the harbor and "Wow!" describes it perfectly. Hallway entry way and 2 walls of all windows. I had the perfect view in 3 directions. Definitely recommend the corner rooms. If you do not have a company paying for your stay and you are on a budget... This is not the place for you. $25 per night for parking; $12.95 per night for internet; $4 hot chocolate and $18 for buffet breakfast. Things add up quickly! Also, city and state tax for the room cost. Otherwise, free apple cider and internet in the lobby... warm lavender scented towels and great location make this a perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Except One Mishap”
Reviews.Author: cc131
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night with my points, so I cannot comment on the value of the hotel, but we agree with many of the previous reviews that the hotel is very nice and exceeded our expectations for a Marriott. Positives: Beautiful lobby. Large rooms (I did pay to upgrade to a Deluxe Harbor View - gorgeous and worth it). Bed is comfortable. Rooms are clean with fridge. Nice TV. As previous reviewers mentioned - Valet Staff and the Door Man were SUPER Friendly and helpful. We were greeted everytime we came and went from the hotel. Nice pool with warm water and we appreciated the lifeguard on duty. FYI - there is a locker room/bathroom by the pool where you can change into your dry clothes. I wish we had known that so we didn't have to walk all the way back to our room in wet bathing suits (it was very cold that day)! Negatives: There was a mistaken charge to our room from the bar at check-out. According to the front desk person (who was actually the only rude person we encountered), their system of room-charging is flawed. She said that they often has hotel guests get too drunk at the bar and forget or write down the wrong room number. And since they don't require the guest to print their name on the receipt, they often get just an illegible signature. Basically, anyone can charge anything to any room. The hotel DID remove the mistaken charge, but only after the front desk person was very rude and accusatory to both me and my husband. I'm sure that she is frustrated with the system, but I didn't appreciate that she took it out on us. I was a Marriott Gold Elite and now a Silver Elite and that was by far, the rudest front desk person I've encountered at a Marriott property. Other than the unfortunately check-out experience, the rest of our stay was wonderful. I would have given this hotel a 5 star if it weren't for the rude front desk person.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Adjoining Doors!”
Reviews.Author: WERTTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in January. I really like this hotel. The lobby, restaurant and bar are just beautiful and the staff are excellent. I stay here about four times a year on business and with my wife to take in Orioles games. When I arrived in my room I saw that there was an adjoining doors. This is just me, but I do not like adjoining doors. They give me the creeps. However, I was tired from my trip so I just said to myself that this was nothing. It did unnerve me, though, to see bright light coming under the door at night. Then on my last night I woke up at 2.10 am to the sound of a man talking on the phone. At first it sounded as if he were in the room. I heard everything he said as if he were next to me. I could not really get mad at him since he was speaking in a normal tone of voice. The noise proofing on the adjoining door was such that I heard everything that he said. Needless to say, I could not get back to sleep. I will stay here again, but I will never stay in a room with an adjoining door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: lunarluau
Reviews.Content: As a Washingtonian it is my duty to hate everything Baltimore. With that said evrything at this hotel was exceptional. We stayed here New Year's Eve. Everyone we dealt with was super top notch. A great experience indeed. Keep up the great work. We've stayed in Baltimore a bunch but this was our best experience by far.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expected more”
Reviews.Author: JoeMary01
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel over Thanksgiving weekend on friend's recommendation. Generally was very good. The room was very nice with a good view. Felt very comfortable in the hotel. Parking was expensive but expensive; also seemed very isolated where guests park. The hotel is in the midst of the harbor area; very good for walking around. You don't need a car for most of the downtown sites so perhaps that car would not be needed if you came in via train/plane. The area around the hotel has many restaurants and attractions. Did not like the panhandlers we saw in the area; some were on the aggressive side. There were dark areas that could be on the scary side late at night. There is a Whole Foods and CVS drugstore very close. At the Whole Foods shopper before us put her money in her stocking; not a good sign for the neighborhood. For the price we paid could have had some coffee (free) in the lobby in the morning. Restaurant and bar in the hotel were OK. Though friendly enough staff did not appear to know of anything in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Top-flight Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelerKC
Reviews.Content: If a business hotel in Baltimore is what you want, consider this one. I stayed here as part of a convention and was really impressed. Staff was friendly. Check-in was smooth, with all that entails during a convention turnover. All functions ran well, smoothly and comfortably. Even the catered food at the events was done well! The rooms were comfortable, spacious, and well-appointed--much nicer and more inviting than your sometimes-standard Marriott hotel rooms. Mine had plenty of working space and room to roam. I did not feel cramped. The hotel location was good for a visitor spending a few days: Overlooking the harbor, near a number of popular restaurants and nightspots, and near the Italian/warehouse dining district. If you like to walk the neighborhoods, jog, or see some sights, this hotel is a good starting point. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nbswissdude
Reviews.Content: Fronte desk was very acoomodateing and room was beautiful with an incredible view.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: VLBerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in early November for a conference I was attending. The room was very modern, nice and clean. The beds were excellent and we had a great view of the water from our room. The room was large and had a flat screen TV. You are about a 5 minute walk to the shops and main harbor area. The shopping and restaurants in the area are good and plentiful. Parking is $25 which is high. That is my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: angietraveller
Reviews.Content: great view. beautiful decor. comfortable spacious room. paid in-room internet speed acceptable. restaurant was generally good as well as room-service, but tended to be a bit salty--this was th general trend elsewhere in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kiko_8
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and comfortable. You have to love the comfortable beds. I slept great. The bathroom had full size Andis hairdryers which is so much nicer than those small wall unit ones. Our room overlooked the harbor and the street performers. You could see and hear the band at night if you opened the windows. (You could not hear them with it closed.) A small "mall" like shopping center was attached to the hotel which was convenient. You had to pay for Internet access. Parking was convenient under the building. It was a short walk to the aquarium and not a problem for my 4 & 5 year olds. We also did a lot of walking around the inner harbor. It was nice how everything seemed to be connected by bridges and walkways. The staff at the hotel was very friendly. The pool was crowded and cloudy and had entirely too many people in it. We decided to pass on taking a dip. This did not go over well with the children. The fitness facility was well equipped so I took advantage of this. Overall, a very nice hotel with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Marriott?”
Reviews.Author: COM4
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, ornate lobby, bellhops with hot towels, cool music, lots of seating, cool sports bar. My room was huge and had a panoramic view of the harbor. The bellman who brought me up to my room remembered me and greeted me by name several times over my stay. The conference/banquet area is reached through a corner of the enormous restaurant. This is very odd and poorly designed. The banquet food is as good as you can expect from a conference center. The conference service managers were terrific. The fitness center is big and clean, but they bought cheap machines that are not easy to use or modern. Step up and get some Precor gear, folks. They also have a Sauna located in the men's lockers (and I assume one in the women's) but it wasn't hot enough to be useful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed”
Reviews.Author: TwinComanche
Reviews.Content: Classy place, particularly for a Marriott, which in my mind is usually a mid-range hotel that I lump in with Hyatt, Hilton, and Sheraton. On entering, a heated lavender scented towel is presented for your refreshment. The entire facility has contemporary furnishings and the lobby music is a match (Luscious Jackson playing Naked Eye when I walked in). Service at the front desk was a bit slow but friendly and I was offered a room with a view of the harbor. The windows are large and the view quite appealing. The halls and rooms all smell clean and fresh. I noticed staff setting up breakfast for our conference starting the next morning. They were clearly attentive to detail, with jams and tea service all laid out just so. The room is on the large side for an inner city hotel. A work desk, comfy chair, and two beds, with plenty of room to move about. A nicely detailed bath adjoins. The TV has inputs for PC video and digital video and there are plenty of easily accessed AC outlets around the room for your various electronics. Those on the club level or with access will enjoy service at the club; food is excellent and there's plenty of room with a full bar, TV, computer, copy machine, and so forth. It's one of the larger clubs I've seen on the East coast, similar in size to some of the old InterContinental clubs in Europe. Plenty of dining choices are nearby and Whole Foods is a quick walk so you can easily avoid the cost of dining out while still getting great take-out. You're not far from Penn Station, so a very easy day trip to DC is possible for about $40 roundtrip and just a little more than 30 minutes each way. That said, there's plenty here to keep you busy

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: feliciah7
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business conference, so I didn't get a chance to experience the hotel to the fullest extent. However, this hotel proved to be a wonderful respite after each long day at the conference. The staff was extrememly accomodating, and it was very convenient that there were 3 eating establishments within the hotel. There was a day or two where I didn't feel like having a night on the town, so I grabbed some delicious food at the hotel's cafe, and took it to my room. The hotel was a little ways from the habor, but very close to Little Italy. I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic views, yummy restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: skillz377
Reviews.Content: All within walking distance: aquarium, camden yards, little italy, water taxis, great restaurants, paddle boats. Great staff at hotel. Enjoyed pool and patio, ordered room service (best!!) and the blue crab corn chowder is a MUST for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “close to conv center but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: paularossi
Reviews.Content: if the conv center is your main interest, this local is great. there are about 6 restaurants near by and the subway can be accessed. for most of our dinners and sight seeing, we had to take a cab, $10-20 one way for each trip. was a nice hotel with a great view though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, best view of the harbor and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SammysMomPa
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the harbor and we enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Inner Harbor. From the time we checked in until the minute we left staff was friendly and very helpful with recommendations and directions. Our room had a great view, was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We enjoyed their Sunday Brunch, the staff was friendly, and the presentation and quality of food was well worth the price. We did experience 3 occasions where the concierge wasn't available, however a bell person saw us waiting and immediately came over to offer assistance. Hotel price is on the high end, however we loved our stay and would most likely stay there again, fabulous location, clean, comfortable beds, good food and friendly staff, all that is worth the extra costs to us!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but great location”
Reviews.Author: Rachface24
Reviews.Content: I have a bit of a mixed review for the Baltimore Waterfront. I guess I’ll go with negatives first: The bad: Upon first arriving we were quite a bit early for check in as our flight got in around 9:30am. We went to the hotel hoping a room might be ready. However, only rooms with 2 beds instead of 1 king were available. Understandable, we thought this might happen. We were told we could check out bags in the mean time at the bell desk. We waited at the bell desk for approximately 15-20 minutes before anyone helped us. At first I was trying to be conciliatory because it was a very busy morning in the hotel as many wedding guests appeared to be arriving along with the couple getting married. I noticed a women in a hotel uniform in her upper forties early fifties about 10 yards away in the center of the lobby ignoring us as we waited and waited. Again I thought perhaps she was the wedding planner and waiting for the bride or something along those lines and that is why she wasn’t helping us. Every time I looked around and met her glance she turned away, which I thought was odd. Then she started speaking to some of the guests who were waiting to check in, and waiting for the elevators and cabs. A few minutes later she went to the concierge desk and started aimlessly shuffling papers around. As she walked past I tried to get her attention to ask how long the bell deskman would be and she ignored me. At around the 15 minute mark my fiancé became very annoyed and started to walk towards the front desk to ask if we could just leave the bags behind the desk as they were only 2 small overnights and a lap top case when he was intercepted by the same woman who was ignoring us. She checked our bags for us after all. I hate to think it but we both got the impression that she was ignoring us because of the way we were dressed and our ages based upon the way that she was looking at us, and her interaction with us when she finally took the bags. We are both in our mid-20s and were wearing jeans (granted with a nice top and blazer for him as well) while the rest of the guests she was chit chatting with were in the 50s and wearing pant suits and suits. The rooms were about average. Considering what the normal nightly rates are at this hotel I expected the rooms to be much larger. As a hotel that is branding itself as a 5 star location, I must say the off-strip Hilton in Vegas was MUCH nicer than this hotel, both in size of rooms, size of bathrooms and the bedding (I’m a sucker for a great hotel bed) and the amenities. If we had standard sized suitcases we would have been hard pressed to find room to get ready and move about comfortably. I was also surprised how thin the walls seemed to be. I was able to hear everyone up and down the hall almost as if my door was open. I was also able to actually distinguish what the people in the next room did and did not crave for breakfast the first morning. I was also surprised to find that the refrigerator in the room was locked! Something that I have never seen before in a hotel with a note saying refrigerators were available to rent upon request. Very odd and annoying seeing as we were on vacation to celebrate our anniversary and wanted to chill some champagne. On the second night we were there we called down to get two champagne glasses for said bubbly and waited almost an hour to no avail. A second call finally brought someone up about 5 minutes later. The morning we left we must have somehow shut off our alarm in our sleep because when I woke we had about 10 minutes to leave and catch our flight. I realized at the airport that my fiancé thought I left a tip for the housekeeping staff and I thought he left a tip and felt absolutely terrible! Seeing as we were so rushed, our room was even more of a disaster than it might have normally been. I called the hotel the next day when we arrived back home to ask if they might be able to put a tip on the credit card I used that they had yet to charge and they said they could. However, I didn’t see it as a charge when they finally processed incidentals. The good: The views are great from the rooms and the location is fantastic for doing all sorts of great inner harbor things. Cabs readily available on premises at almost all times and the one time there wasn’t a cab and we had reservations to dinner, the valet immediately got on his cell phone and had one rushed over. A young woman at the front desk in her 20s with dark hair named, I believe Kayla, or something along those lines. She was the one there when we first arrived and offered to call me when a room was available. She left a message that we found on the voicemail of the room when we returned asking if everything was to our liking in the room and we received our bags from the bell desk ok. She is also the girl we reached when I called down to the front desk a second time about the glassware. She was incredibly apologetic and quick to remedy the situation. We purchased internet access for 2 days which was supposed to start at noon and go to the following noon, however because only used it once during the second portion of time, they only charged us for one day of usage which was nice of them. I would stay here again mainly for the location, but only if I was able to get a great deal on Priceline again. I certainly wouldn’t pay half of what they charge normally.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: law_talkin_guy
Reviews.Content: This is what business travelers dream about: new, clean, walking distance to whole foods, and a coffee shop in the lobby. I've stayed here on multiple occasions and it has always been reasonably priced, nowere near $385 or whatever TA lists the average price as..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: JuneauVirginia
Reviews.Content: I would encourange everyone to stay at this hotel. Everything you need is right here. The rooms were very clean and big. Its at an excellant location right next to the Inner Harbor as well as you can take the Water Taxi to any in the harbor such as the Inner Harbor, and Fort McHenry. The bed was very comfortable, internet access, pool, and resturant. My family and I will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong if you like the location...”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: There is a water taxi next to the hotel which can bring you to other locations on the inner harbor if you don't feel like walking to some attractions slightly further away. Whole foods a block away. Parking garage next to the hotel with in/out privileges though you need to bring the ticket to the hotel front desk after you park the first time to get it validated for in/out privileges. Indoor pool was heated, though somewhat smaller than expected. No real complaints as the rooms, etc were all as would be expected of your average hotel of this quality and brand.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachPug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best of the best in Baltimore. From service to guest rooms. Don't think twice when making your reservation. The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront has it all! Close to Fells Point and walking distance to the Harbour. Stay here! We had an amazing view of the harbour. I called the hotel to tell them it was my husbands birthday and we were upgraded to an amazing view! The people go out of their way to make you feel welcome. MUST STAY in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable Bed ever, like sleeping on a cloud”
Reviews.Author: HappySurfer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront while attending a conference. The first room had a heavy smoke odor, and the Front Desk Clerk moved us to a higher floor. We enjoyed the view of the Harbor and City. The room was very nicely furnished and super clean. I have to say that the bed was absolutely the most comfortable ever. I even pulled the bedding away so that I could know the brand of Mattress. No trouble sleeping in this Hotel. Everything was great except on the way to the Airport, one of the Bellmen short changed me. Watch out for those Bellmen in nice Hotels everywhere, they are characters.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here”
Reviews.Author: 3hundrd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 nights at this hotel. Was able to get it for $97 per night through Priceline. For an addtl. $20 I upgraded to harborview - 30th floor. So worth it. The location is ideal. The harbor east has so much to offer - incredible restaurants and shops plus it's such an easy walk to Fells Points, Little Italy and the inner harbor itself. The water taxi has a pick-up right outside the hotel although you really can get around most places on foot. Despite the crowds in the lobby when we arrived on Friday afternoon our check-in only took a couple minutes. The staff was all very friendly. The room was beautiful and quite roomy. Enjoyed the bar too, although the women working there should try smiling once in awhile. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location for a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront from Friday July 31st until Monday August 3rd. I loved this hotel. It offers a great location in the downtown/inner harbor part of the city. You are perfectly placed to walk to almost all the popular tourist attractions. Upon arrival, I requested a room with harbor view, extra towels, and pillows and all requests were met. The rooms are nice, there not to roomy, neither are the bathrooms. But we had a nice LCD TV, comfy beds, and a beautiful view. There are some restaurants and bars right next to the hotel. You are also right next to the water taxs, and if you need a taxi to get somewhere they always have them waiting. We chose to walk around the city, and we found it very easy to get around. We didnt use any public transportation, we walked to anything. The lobby was also very nice, had tvs to watch the game, restuarant, and bar. I didnt park at the hotel, because it was like 30 a night. You can find nearby parking for half the price each night. The only other negative is if you want to use your internet its like $12-13 per 24 hours. The pool is also nice and clean. In the end, I loved this hotel and when I come back next year to see Red Sox/Orioles with my brother I will definately stay at the Marriott Waterfront in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful July 4th Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sthomas0616
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to Baltimore, MD and our first at this hotel and, from our experience, we will definitely be back! From start to finish, this was a first class vacation - our room was on the 30th floor overlooking the Inner Harbor - need I say more! The views were breathtaking, room was wonderful, fireworks were great (although they are building another structure right next to the Marriott which might detract from the fireworks in years to come), close to everything (Little Italy is literally one block away) including the water taxi - I cannot say enough about this place. One word of warning - Sunday's brunch was mobbed - get there early or try room service.

Reviews.Title: “A short walk to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller100
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Baltimore Marriott Waterfront during a conference held in the Baltimore Convention Center. I did not use any of the conference-recommended hotels, and instead, bit on priceline.com and got this hotel. Overall, I am very satisfied with my stay there. As the name suggests, it is right on the waterfront of Baltimore inner harbour. It takes about 20 minutes of brisk walk to get to the convention center, but the walk is pleasant, as you can take the path along the inner harbour and avoid walking along busy streets. One can also take the water taxi, but the first ride starts at 10am, too late for my conference. The hotel food is nothing to write home about, and other amenities are pretty standard for Marriott. The Internet charge was $12.95/day. The only complain I have is that the charge is a 24-hour rate, but rather, is the noon-to-noon rate, which means, if you start the service in the evening (which was my case), your service would only last until noon the next day. The parking is expensive, so I parked a few blocks away on S. Caroline Street for $13/day (covered parking).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...great location”
Reviews.Author: UofIx3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a conference. The food was very good and the staff seemed to have their act together. Positives: * Plentiful staff were very friendly. I'm extremely claustrophic and like to avoid elevators as much as possible. They gave me a room on the lowest available floor as requested when I made the hotel reservations. * Room was very clean and was in very good condition. I wondered if it had been recently built/renovated. * Beds were comfy with plenty of pillows. * Environmentally-friendly policies - in addition to the option of re-using your bath towels and bed sheets, they also had a bag where on could place recyclable items. * Had a very nice HDTV. * The gym was very nice and was co-located with the pool on the fifth floor. * Location is great - right off the water and only a fifteen minute walk from the U.S.S. Constellation; twenty minutes from the Convention Center; and 25 minutes from Camden Yards and a light rail stop that takes you to BWI in about 35 minutes for less than $2. * Boarding passes can be printed at a station at the main desk. Negatives * Alternative entrances/exits were often locked. That makes sense to me, in terms of security, but they didn't offer key card entry, but rather directed you to the main entrance. * I could hear my neighbors in the room next to me. * I can understand a conference hotel charging for wireless Internet, but to also ask guests to also pay for use of the computers in the business center is ridiculous. * The gym was extremely warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: drjeff1968
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a room here using Priceline for a mere $112/night. Our room was fantastic- a very spacious room with king bed, big HDTV, and great view of Baltimore from the 26th floor. The room was spotless. The only negatives were the complete lack of towel bars in the bathroom and the bathroom's fairly small size. Also, wireless internet is not included in the bill, which always irritates me in high-end hotels. The hotel is on the east side of Baltimore's inner harbor, within easy walking distance of the stadiums, Little Italy, Fell's Point, and downtown. I would definitely stay here again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A great home base for exploring Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: pterbd
Reviews.Content: We were able to walk almost everywhere. The water taxi stops right outside the front door! We were shocked when we got to our room. My wife mentioned, of-handedly, to the staff at the desk that we had recently gotten married. when we got to the room there was chocolate dipped strawberries and chanpagne as well as a card signed by the staff. I was floored. Our stay was great and we have stayed there once again since that stay. So much is close and great italian restaurants are very close. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mani-travel
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a week at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront. The hotel is magnificent and I have experienced incredible. One of the best 5 Star Hotels in my experience. Beautiful hotel, great location! Overall, this hotel is fantastic: very friendly and efficient, clean, extremely well located and near to famous Aquarium..

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel that's also in a good tourist location.”
Reviews.Author: crackcorn
Reviews.Content: Service everywhere was very professional as could be expected from a large chain hotel that caters to business travel as well as high-ish end vacationers. The waterfront location is perfect for walking aroung to see sights, go to the many restaurants in the vacinity, or take a water taxi to see further sights in the bay. The lobby level restaurant, bar, and lounge area are all great. The business meeting rooms are all excellent. The staff working serving the business meeting rooms are all very attentive. Of course the rooms aren't cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location in Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: cmak12
Reviews.Content: This is the second year we've been to Baltimore for our daughter's cheer competition. Last year we stayed at the Marriott Camden Yards. We decided to give the Waterfront a try. This hotel was comparable to the Camden Yards Marriott, but it has a much better location if you are going to be around the Inner Harbor a lot. An easy walk across a bridge and you are pretty much at the Inner Harbor. You can also take a water taxi which can be picked up practically outside the front door. I wouldn't advise this however unless you have somebody in your party that has difficulty walking longer distances. The fare would run $22 one way for 2 adults and one child. As Silver Elite members, we were able to get upgraded to a 25th floor room with a view of the Inner Harbor (2509). The room was on par with other Marriott properties, but the bathroom was on the small side. This is because it is a remodeled hotel. Other than that, you could not tell it has been remodeled. The rooms have a new flat screen TV and contemporary furniture and fixtures. Beds are comfortable, as always with the pillow top. The service has been consistent, no matter which Marriott we stay at and this was no different. Check-in was quick, but when we got to the room, the safe was locked by the previous occupant. A call down to the front desk and 5 minutes later and somebody was at our door to fix the problem. Our room rate was to include breakfast. When we received our bill, the room service folks had added the breakfasts to our bill. This was immediately removed by the front desk upon checkout with no questions asked. Room service by the way, was on time (actually a little early one day) and curteous. Parking was easy in the adjacent parking lot, but it was expensive at $25 a day. Valet I believe was $38 a day. Unlike other resort properties, their parking lot was run by a separate company, so I understand the parking fee. On a resort property with timeshare ownership, I just don't understand Marriott's need to charge guests for parking, but that's a whole separate issue. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but the room service food was good and plentiful for the price. My wife had pancakes that were as big as a 10" dinner plate and there were 3 of them. The food arrived hot on both days. The bar area in the lobby was a nice place to grab a drink. They have some nice beers on tap. All in all, I would stay here again if we return to Baltimore. If not for any other reason than the location alone. The room rates are expensive, but the quality of the rooms, level of service and location justify it.

Reviews.Title: “We remember this Hotel with gratitude”
Reviews.Author: Crystal004
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Baltimore Marriot Waterfront was excellent. My husband had a surgery at JHH. Thanks to the Hotel staff who were very helpful, the thinks were easier. I recommend the Hotel to everybody who needs special attention.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galilayo79
Reviews.Content: I just finished up a conference at the Waterfront, and was pleased with my stay. Aside from the hotel's strange and confusing layout, the rooms were clean (great view of the harbor), beds were comfortable, and the service was just fine. The room service breakfast arrived on time each morning and was fresh and hot. My only complaint is that there aren't any fans in the bathrooms. Weird. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “$$$ Rate for a $ Room”
Reviews.Author: ciaotime
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights here for a conference. Clearly they invested all their money in the lobby area, because my room was on a par with Hampton Inn, i.e., nothing wrong with it just not worth what Marriott is charging. I suggest you ask to see your room before commiting to staying here; WAY overpriced. If you're considering holding a conference or business here, they were not particularly helpful or cooperative, despite our organization spending $70,000 there. Location was good, food was good, staff other than the convention staff were friendly & helpful. The convention staff just didn't seem to much care; in today's economy, one would expect they would be overjoyed to have any business at all, certainly $70,000 worth...unfortunately, not so.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled an already great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tommytourz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once a year and was surprised to learn that they just remodeled their hotel which is amazing since the hotel was in really good condition. Outstanding Location for restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. Concierge Lounge is the best the Marriott Chain has to offer. Beds were comfortable, Flat screen, Coffee Maker, good size bathroom and good lighting. Nice views of the harbor. Everything clean and fresh. Things to note: The Homewood Suites and Hilton Garden Inn across the street are new and have lower room rates. Parking is expensive I would stay here for personal travel. ttz

Reviews.Title: “what a charm!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mandy8810
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel got a good price, loved the pool our room's view was absolutely gorgeous 26th floor overseeing the harbor, buffet breakfast was expensive but very good and filling. overall good experience and would go back and stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service!”
Reviews.Author: JulieSandpoint_Idaho
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront is a great hotel!  I don't know what the other reviewers are complaining about.  My experience was exceptional from start to finish.  Upon check-in I asked for  a room upgrade sine I'm a Silver Elite rewards member.  I was given a beautiful corner room on a higher floor and the view of the harbor was magnificent!  The room was large, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom well equipped and large. I was here on business and on the 2nd day of my trip my wallet was stolen (with all my credit cards, cash, and identification inside) while shopping at a nearby store.  I immediately ran back to the Marriott and explained the situation.  The management was more helpful than I could have imagined, told me to charge whatever I needed to my room, and assured me I could settle my bill when I got my new credit card.   The security officer and hotel manager on duty could not have been more helpful, compassionate, and patient.  I was very stressed and they went out  of their way to help me call the police to report the theft.  They made sure I was notified and received my emergency cash and new credit card as soon as it arrived.  They checked in with me several times to make sure I was taken care of.  The only complaint that I had was that the internet service in my room never worked right despite a visit from the IT department.  The hotel rectified this though by giving me 500 Marriott reward points as compensation.  I have nothing but good things to say about my stay.  The Patty LaBelle concert  next to the hotel one evening was a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better, great views”
Reviews.Author: CreoleBarbie
Reviews.Content: Once I found the entrance for parking I found this was an average Marriott; (as others have mentioned) parking is horrible. Check-in was fine, nothing special - no instructions. Room was standard, bathroom was a little small; food was ok, staff could be friendlier, the conference rooms were cold, very cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Marriott Waterfront!”
Reviews.Author: RLLYoungDoc
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront through Priceline for a quick getaway for my husband's birthday (we got a GREAT price!). We stayed for one night (1/3/09 to 1/4/09). Overall, I was very pleased with the quality of the room and the quality of service. Valet service was prompt and effortless. The staff was welcoming, polite and very professional. I called ahead of time to reserve a platter of chocolate-covered strawberries to be delivered to the room at a certain time, and it was there when we returned from dinner as asked! I asked for a room with a nice view, and we stayed in room 2443 - a corner room with an absolutely AWESOME view of the Inner Harbor. The room was very nice; very clean with contemporary decor. Room service came with breakfast within 15 minutes the next day. Checkout was quick and the bill was accurate. Overall, lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Valet Parking needs help”
Reviews.Author: Donna81Us
Reviews.Content: Terrible location when the hotel books two weddings at a time and wedding guests as well as the hotel guests need their cars valet parked. Driveway becomes backed up to the adjoining roads - especially on a Saturday night when all the restaurants in the area are also busy valet parking their cars. Never again! Manager agreed to a complimentary breakfast the following morning (as it took 90 minutes to get our car parked). When we checked out, however, we found we were charged for the breakfast. Rooms are pretty and clean, but our stay was way too aggravating for me ever to return. from Long Island (Sept. 08)

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaL81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a wedding. The location is beautiful. The room was well decorated, large, clean, and comfortable. The shared hotel areas were beautiful. The view is great. It is a short walk to the aquarium and many restaurants. We had a fair rate because the wedding had negotiated with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High standard accomodation”
Reviews.Author: piplet
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. The accommodation & service was much better than I would normally expect from a Marriott. The location right on the harbour was perfect for exploring the city. The restaurant food was tasty & I liked the coffee shop within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: avillebud
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The staff could use some tips in being friendly to its paying customers... but beyond the unfriendly staff the hotel is nice. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The location is perfect. Its not amid all the buzz of the tourists, but you can walk to the area in five minutes. I loved the hotel and would consider staying here again. The gym at the hotel is nice. The cardio machines could use some updating, but its a decent gym.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: travelforfun056
Reviews.Content: I was attending a business meeting near the Inner Harbor and decided to take a short getaway and stay at the lovely Marriott Waterfront. The only thing that is somewhat confusing is the parking garage. I had stayed at this property several years ago so I knew it was a small challenge regarding the parking. I arrived at the property after doing self parking and was immediately waited on at the front desk. I was greeted by a very friendly staff member and within five minutes, I was on my way to my room on the 30th floor. Wow, what a fantastic room. The view from my room was awesome. I actually did not want to leave my room for my event however, upon my return in the evening, I kept the drapery open to take in the harbor at night view. It was breathtaking! The next morning I took advantage of their Sunday Brunch and I must say it was well worth it. Everything from delicious omelets made right in front of you to the great waffles, fruit and cereal selections, lunch selections and finally dessert. The staff was extremely friendly throughout the hotel and the property was very clean, both in room and public areas. So, if you are looking for a nice getaway, the Baltimore Waterfront would be an excellent choice. There is so much to do in this area, including shopping, sightseeing and great Museums. The Walters Art Gallery is not to be missed along with other attractions nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad and The UGLY!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuyNY64
Reviews.Content: The Good: Just what you would expect from a Marriott. Clean and Fresh! The Bad: Only one restaurant. It serves breakfast, lunch and dinner, but no burgers. If you want a burger you have to go eat in the bar. Not ideal if you have kids with you or want to sit a normal dining table which is the standard table height. However, there are plenty of restaurants in the neighborhood to go eat at (weather permitting). The UGLY! Parking. I saw the review above mine before I left for this trip. I laughed it off as a one time thing. Oh no, it is not. On a Tuesday night, this hotel was awash in people and automobiles with numerous functions going on. The hotel parking garage is the only one close to the hotel (the next closest parking lot is about three blcoks away). You have two choices. Self Parking at $21 or Valet at $36. I choose "Self Parking" for $21 (it's a major city, $21 a day is not bad). But surprise, surprise, as you drive up level after level in the garage, you see plenty of empty spaces but on the walls are "Valet Parking only" signs. You see this on the third floor, on the forth floor, the fifth floor, and only after you pass those signs can you self park and guess what, all of the spots on the sixth floor are full, the seventh floor are full, the eighth, the ninth and even the roof deck so it leaves you with no choice but to bring your car back to the front door and let them valet park your car for an additional $15 a night. If the cost of parking is not an issue to you, stay here, it's a very nice hotel. If this will bother you, don't, there are plenty of other hotels in this area. One more word of caution. Regardless of when you enter the garage, if you are there after 4pm the next day, they charge you for an additional day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was just OK.”
Reviews.Author: chgocutie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a three night stay at this hotel in October of 2008. For starters, the appearance of the hotel was very nice. Everything looked fabulous. However, that's where the beauty ends (at least for us). For starters, we paid for parking, which pretty much guaranteed us a place to park - or so we thought. When we returned to the hotel on Saturday evening, there was absolutely nowhere to park in the garage. All of the spaces were taken for some sort of gala, and even the valet parkers couldn't park any more cars. It would have been nice to receive an advisory when checking in and paying for parking of such gala and the potential for the lack of parking. The valet drivers were scary, to put it mildly. When they were moving vehicles, they were acting as if the garage was the Indianapolis 500. Needless to say, I wouldn't let one of them drive my car, which is what the front desk supervisor offered when we complained about the lack of parking. Obviously we turned it down. The parking garage is a bit cumbersome to get to. To get to the parking garage you have to go down to the main lobby, around the corner, UP an elevator to the third floor and then across a skybridge. Then, on to the staff. Most of the individuals were very nice and always had a smile and a kind word. However there were a few that left much to be desired. Our room was a spacious room on the 16th floor with a partial view of the harbor (a new high-rise is being built blocking views of the water). Housekeeping was pretty good and kept our room tidy and clean. For the price that was paid for the hotel (an associate rate), it was just....OK. But as a person that expected a lot more, I'll stay at a Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property”
Reviews.Author: cdilljr
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute. Priceline actually picked it out for me and what a great result. The Marriott Waterfront on Baltimore's Inner Harbor was very very nice. It seemed brand new although I suspect it's been there a while. Throughout the hotel, everything was in great condition. Rooms clean, bright and well appointed including a big LCD tv. The carpeting in the rooms, hallways and public areas seemed brand new. The pool and healthclub were both modern and clean. The location is also a winner. Very close walk to all the Inner Harbor attractions. On top of all this, I found the staff very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. My future stays in Baltimore will always be at this hotel and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happytravels1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night on a day trip to celebrate our anniversary. We both really liked the hotel, but I was expecting more. I booked on Priceline, and therefore got a really great rate, but had I payed full price, I would've been disappointed. Nothing was wrong in particular, but I just didn't really feel lived up to the rack rates that I've seen for it. Try to get a better rate and enjoy yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Navy_Lady
Reviews.Content: I'm getting more and more pleased with Marriott's facilities, and this one is a shining example of great service, good location, and all-around pleasurable stay. Pros: Convenient location to attractions in Inner Harbor, such as the National Aquarium, CONSTELLATION, Power Plant, Convention Center and a ton of shopping. Nicely situated among a variety of restaurants from low end to high end. Walking distance to Little Italy. Access to water taxi. Great service and amenities, including Bath & Body Works orange ginger products. Great harbor and city views. Just off the beaten path in the Inner Harbor, but close enough to walk around and not need a vehicle. Next to Pier Six, with its live concert venue. While I was there, Billy Idol performed at Pier Six and the concert could be easily heard and seen by sitting just outside the Marriott (free, without the hassle of parking). I suppose that this could also fall into the "con" arena if there was a particularly loud performance and your room happened to be on a lower floor facing the harbor and pier six. Cons: Lots of construction just next door, including another high rise hotel (Omni, perhaps?) and condos with associated noise and construction traffic jams. Helpful hints: pastries are sold in the small store alongside the hotel's restaurant at half price late afternoon/evening (buy one, get one free). Pick up a few for the next day's breakfast for a couple of bucks. Watch the schedule for Camden Yards baseball games (heavy traffic) and for Pier Six concerts (both traffic and noise, if the venue bothers you, or for a free concert if the venue is to your liking).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamm-64
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and views. We stayed there for 3 nights to see the Red Sox and Orioles. The hotel was very nice, the view from our room on the 31st floor was amazing. Too bad of the new hotel being built in front. They will loose some of the harbor view. It is a bit of a walk from Camden Yards, we took the water taxi one night, which stops right in front. Even from the Inner Harbor it is like a maze to find the hotel. Wear your walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: CanuckAndie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront from July 13 to 18, while attending a conference that was also at the hotel. It was a good stay overall, but I was expecting more from a place this expensive. The location is great, right at the Inner Harbour. Most things are within walking distance, even Oriole Park is just a 20 minute walk. The hotel itself is beautiful and the views are amazing from every window, on every floor. The staff was very friendly, there was always someone around to say hello and make us feel welcome. The room was nice, very spacious, clean, and modern. It was cleaned every day and the view was great. My only complaint here was the lack of in-room internet access. You can have high-speed internet in your room, for $9.95/day. Given that we were already paying $200/night to stay there (and that was the conference rate), that seemed ridiculous, especially considering the number of business people staying there during the same week (there were at least two other conferences going on at the same time as ours). Other hotels I've stayed at that charge such rates have included internet access. There were three of us sharing the room and we were told that if we wanted to use our own separate laptops, we'd each have to pay the $9.95. There's a business centre with internet access, and the lobby has wifi, but all options will cost you. They also seem to nickel-and-dime for a lot of other little things. We didn't have too many problems with noise, as has been described in previous reviews. We heard some banging in the hallway on our first night, but that was it. There was some construction noise early in the morning from the Four Seasons being built next door but we had to be up by 7 anyway, so it didn't bother us. As I said, this is a really nice, well-located hotel. That said, if I were to return to Baltimore, I doubt I would stay here again because it just doesn't feel like we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your charges!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelerFromPA
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was clean and in a great location. But when a hotel messes with charges, the rating is going to take a serious hit. I reserved three rooms for two nights to keep three families close together. When we got there each family provided a credit card for their room for incidentals. Later that day I checked my credit card charges online because the staff was acting strange putting my card through. There were numerous "temporary " charges adding up to over double the cost of the rooms. I went to the front desk to see what was going on and spent over an hour there. First with the front staff, and then the hotel manager. After several excuses about multiple computer systems and claiming there was nothing they could do about credit card charges I was finally given some printouts assuring me that everything would be charged correctly. Then on the print outs there were minibar charges and we never even touched the minibar (we just got there a few hours ago!) After the trip I had the other families check their cards and sure enough, they were charged for rooms they shouldn't have been and some of the charges didn't add up. What a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dsaienni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baltimore Marriott the night of 7/19 for my husband's birthday. I booked the room through a Marriott email I received several months ago. They were running a special of $149 for the night. We typically stay on the other side of Inner Harbor, but wanted to give the east side a try. We are so glad that we did. We loved the area and the fact that it was removed from the hustle and bustle of the main Inner Harbor area. we did walk over to the main Harbor area and it was mobbed! I requested an upgrade to a deluxe room the week before we arrived and received an email stating they upgraded us for free. Normally a $30 charge. We arrived around 3 PM and our room was ready. We had a beautiful king corner room on the 18th floor (Room 1837) with awesome views of the harbor. We enjoyed a delicious dinner at Oceanaire Restaurant which was just a 3 minute walk from the hotel. All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great time, great location”
Reviews.Author: kathen302
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in an excellent location. Right on the water by Little Italy and within 5-10 minute walk to Fells Point. We arrived at 3pm, received immediate service and was advised that our room wasn't ready but would be called (via cell) when it was. All of 5 minutes went by before we got the call. Now, I'm a silver elite member and used points for my room but really wasn't expecting what we got. I got a beautiful, corner king suite on the 17th floor. We had windows on both sides w great views of the harbor. Bedding was very comfortable, flat wide screen tv, chaise lounge, minibar. Later that night there was a concert below that we were able to listen to from our room. The pool is a little small but has a great outside deck for sunning. I would stay here without hesitation again.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always”
Reviews.Author: Oscar02
Reviews.Content: Check-In and Out - Outstanding, very professional Cleanliness - Outstanding Service - Good Restaurant/Bar - Good Restaurant Age - Up to date Service and quality as great always on several stays here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room”
Reviews.Author: Grizburgh
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here in Baltimore. We were in town for the weekend to see the Pirates take on the Orioles. We had a very clean and comfortable room on the 24th floor with a fantastic view of the Harbor. The location of the hotel is perfect and an easy walk to Little Italy, the harbor resturants and Fells Point. I would have to recommend Fells Point if you are looking for some different kind of shops and resturant/bars. The staff was very welcoming and helpful with any questions we had. We did not have any noice issues at all. Our one strong complaint would be that you have to pay for internet access. This is a pretty high class business type of hotel and they make you pay for internet access? We were very shocked at that. We paid for the vallet parking service which was 39 dollars you may want to look into parking the car yourself in the garage that is next door if you drive. Great weekend though and we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite in Baltimore!!”
Reviews.Author: Escaper77
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in most of the 4 stars in the Inner Harbor in the past 2 years. I enjoyed my stay in pretty much everyone of them. BUT, the Waterfront is my favorite for a lot of reasons. The East side of the harbor is expanding everyday. Besides Little Italy which is a short walk, there is a great, diverse selection of restaurants within walking distance. You can find some great coffee shops between the hotel and Fell's point also, which to us was a great walk but you can take the water taxi (right outside the door) to Fell's Point if you want to relax. The Whole Foods Market, 604 wine shop, Saturday Farmers Market (right down the street), etc.. etc.. all close by. If you are a Marriott Club member you can get a room on the top floors with spectaular views of the harbor. I never have had a problem with service and I have stayed there 6 times in the past year and a half.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: danmegan
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here on our wedding night and I was highly disappointed by the room and the service. First off, we did not check into the hotel until 11pm on May31st after our wedding and at 2am we received a bill under our door for using the minibar however I did not even know we had a minibar until after I called the front desk and questioned this. When I spoke with the front desk and told them it was locked, they confirmed the key was at the front desk. She stated that it may have been from a previous guest and they would take it off the bill. Unfortunately, the next morning when we went to check out of the hotel, it was on the bill again! So we told our front desk person about the conversation I had earlier that morning and she stated she would waive the $6.30. We thought everything was resolved until we received our credit card bill and the $6.30 charge was on there. How very sneaky. I was also sad to hear that this happened to my wedding guests who stayed at the hotel because I recommended it. I am also disappointed at the fact my brother in law paid extra for a suite that was so loud! The walls are so thin and all I heard was traffic. I was also shocked that the hotel did not give a gift of a bottle of champagne and when we called room service they stated the only bottle they had was over $200! Overall we spent way too much money for a hotel room that came with a big headache and lack of sleep because it felt like we were by a train station!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: taniaclasen
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I've stayed at this hotel for business. The room had a great view of the bay, was very clean and was within walking distance of the aquarium, science museum, shops, etc. The beds were extremely comfortable and the food in the hotel was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: LVFoodie
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby. Loved the modern room decor. Good location within walking distance of the aquarium, science museum, and about 75 restaurants. The hotel is oddly situated with its entrance and lobby on the harbor side. If you park in their garage, or return to the hotel on foot, in effect you are approaching from the rear end of the building... not very welcoming, or bad feng shui, or both. Pleasant indoor pool with lifeguard.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location w/Water Taxi landing”
Reviews.Author: Keithcu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Waterfront Marriot as part of a conference, and we got the all important conference rate. We also got a harbor view, which is highly recommended. I recommend you park your car and use your feet or the water taxi to get around. There is a water taxi landing 50 feet from the hotel's entrance, and all of the inner harbor and Little Italy are just half a mile away (though in different directions). Harbor East (where the hotel is located) has also been growing fast. It seemed very happening. One criticism: the concerge didn't know anything about the surrounding area -- particularly Little Italy. So, come armed with your own information.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Comfy Bed, Beaugtiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim2458
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four-day stay in Baltimore. An annual conference I attend is held in another hotel that does not get good reviews from attendees, so I always stay somewhere else. This was my first visit to this Marriott and I have to say I had one of the best rooms in the chain, anfd I've stayed in many Marriotts. It was a ninth floor corner room, with two walls of windows offering incredible views of the Inner Harbor and city. Walking into the room there is a foyer with a table on which the coffeemaker sat (Paul Newman single-serving "pods"). There was a rather narrow closet, but it was fine since I was by myself. The bathroom was standard Marriott and clean. The bedroom was huge with a king bed, day bed, workstation, dresser and a 37-inch flat screen TV -- and the sleep timer on this one actually works! The bed was ultra comfortable, loaded with pillows and immaculately clean. The fitness center is well-equipped, with towels and water at each piece of cardio equipment. There is a small indoor pool and you can go outside to the nice sundeck. The fitness center is accessible 24-hours a day. The pool closes at 11 p.m. A couple of issues keep me from giving a fifth star. While the staff were warm and friendly and check-in and check-out were a breeze, I had to call twice, both times with ten rings, before someone finally answered the phone so I could request a wake-up call. When I returned late each evening, every light in the room was on, which I thought was a waste of energy. Since there was no turn down service, I guess the lights are left on from the time the room is cleaned. Yet, the hotel touts its green credentials. I like a cool room at night, but I don't think the thermostat worked properly because even turned to the high-70s, the blower was shooting out very cold air. I object again to the $9.95 a day Marriott charges for in-room Internet access, which they sweetened in recent years by throwing in "no extra charge" local and long distance phone calls, which I don't need since I have my cell phone. This hotel is in a great location, which others have already mentioned. Still, at night, about a block from the hotel, I was approached by someone asking for money. Sad to say, Baltimore has its issues. I recommend an Orioles game at Camden Yards. What a great field! You really feel close to the action. There are plenty of tickets, since it's a .500 team. There is also a "no scalping" area where you can try to bargain with guys who are trying to sell you tickets. Police are nearby watching everything and it's legit, I'm told you can sometimes get really good bargains, especially if the game has already started, All in all, if I'm back at the conference in Baltimore again next year, I will definitely stay here. This is a AAA Four Diamond property and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: ErinFRMS
Reviews.Content: I am staying here while at a conference. The conference facilities are fantastic, but the rooms are not at all what I expected. The walls are quite thin so I can hear every conversation in the hallway, every neighbor's entrance or exit from their room, etc. Luckily I have two beds in my room, since I found the sheets either dirty or stained in the first one. After a close inspection the second bed seemed clean, so I crawled into there. All in all, it is a very pretty hotel in an amazing location. Still, for this amount of money there are so many better places I'd rather stay. This is the first time I've ever checked out early of a hotel to switch mid-way through a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location--okay service and facility”
Reviews.Author: sleepladypalmdesert
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore during a conference and this property was one of the selected hotels. First of all, the location is perfect. It is a very easy walk to Little Italy, Fells Point, Inner Harbor locations and lots of restaurants. The beds were comfy but the sheets are worn and have holes in them. There is a large flat screen TV which was not hooked up properly and I had to fool around with the cables to get a good picture. The mini bar was not plugged in, so it was hot. Probably would not have used it anyway. One day, I ordered coffee to be brought to my room at 6am, but it never came. Finally at 6:30 I cancelled my order and walked over to Starbucks, which is right around the corner. When I cancelled they never apologized...just said...Okay, it's cancelled. The worst part for me were the door slammers. Starting at about 3am, doors start to slam. I looked out one morning to see what it was and an employee was shoving bills under the doors. I guess they take the stairs and then let the doors slam. Then at 5am, they slam again....I looked out and they were delivering the newspapers outside everyone's rooms. Then between 5 and 7, doors slam continually. There is a lot of construction going on and you can hear drilling and workers. I had classes to be at by 8am, so it only bothered me a little, but on several occasions I heard complaints from other guests about not being able to sleep in due to the noise. I was on the 21st floor, so the high floor did not help. I think that the doors must be set to close automatically and if one does not take care to hold the door while closing, it slams with such force that the entire floor shakes. Impossible to sleep. I would probably not stay here again. There are a lot of choices in the area. In fact, I would have probably stayed at Henderson's Wharf had I know how easy of a walk it would have been for me. Plus with the Water Taxi...it would have been a breeze. Go to Baltimore....just stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeingtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice for business, once in April 2008 and again in May 2008. The hotel is located in Harbor East, which is the new, up and coming area of Baltimore's Inner Harbor. Location-wise, it's great. There are many excellent, high-end chain restaurants, like Roy's, Oceanaire Seafood Room, Flemings, Lebanese Taverna, as well as local restaurants, such as Pazo and Charleston, all within walking distance of the hotel. Whole Foods is nearby and there are some cheaper restaurants, too, like Chiu's sushi and a Mexican place. There are also little boutiques to go shopping. Just a few blocks away, is the Inner Harbor itself, which has many great restaurants. The hotel itself is lovely. Its location on the water allows great views of the harbor. At night, it is lively, and if there's a concert, it is a bit loud until the concert is over, usually 11pm. Rooms are spacious, and the bathroom is standard. There aren't that many towel hooks, so towels are folded and stacked on shelves. Bath and Body Works products are great. Hotel staff is friendly and willing to help out. The concierge is great! The hotel breakfast is standard hotel fare, but good. There is also a Starbucks located within the hotel. Parking is expensive, $21 per day, but you're in a city. This is also a good business hotel, but you do have to pay for an internet connection. Overall, you will be paying for the great view.

Reviews.Title: “Very High-End Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Cortesefam
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Marriott Waterfront for a James Taylor concert at the Pier 6 Pavillion. The hotel is perfectly situated adjacent to the Pier 6 facility, which is a great venue for concerts. The public areas of the hotel reflect recent upgrade and care--all was very clean and plush. Rooms were a little above average in size, with a LCD HDTV and comfortable bedding. There are several restaurant choices within 1 block of the hotel, and the hotel offers a Starbucks/deli for light breakfast and snacks. Only negative was the high cost for valet parking--$36 per night. Overall, the hotel was more a J.W. Marriott/near Ritz Carlton than a standard Marriott--definitely the top choice among Inner Harbor hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mavenair
Reviews.Content: Great Location right on the Inner Harbor. A 5 minute walk to the Aquarium, a 10 minute walk to Fell's Point. Terrific view of the Inner Harbor. Staff helpful and attentive. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: BorisWestCountryUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a newly renovated room on the 30th floor in May 2008. The beds were comfortable, and the room very pleasant, clean and nice. There was a large flat screen TV in the room. Internet access was $9.95 per night from this TV (keyboard supplied) but I found this system very primitive and was unable to access my e-mail through it, and apparently you cannot download attachments (even if you can get the system working).There is a network point if you bring your own computer though. Friends said this worked very well. The fitness room is good for a hotel, and has a greater range of equipment than in some other similar places I have stayed in. The swimming pool looked really good fun for kids under the age of about 10, but is too small to do much more than splash around in. The hotel has a good location, and is close to most things you might want to see in Baltimore-e.g. the harbour area and Fells Point are within easy walking distance. The hotel restaurant was surprisingly good value, especially at lunchtime with simple but well prepared food at extremely reasonable prices for a place of this kind. If you get bored with eating in the thousands of restaurants in Baltimore (!) there is also Whole Foods just 5 minutes walk away-this is an organic type store where you can buy stuff and eat it there if you want to...this concept is unfamiliar to Europeans but a great idea. My one BIG reservation about this hotel is that the walls of the rooms are paper thin-they are just temporary style partition walls. It is easy to follow a telephone conversation held at normal levels in the next room if you want to (no I didn't want to!!) and there is a gap under the door to the room (with no draught excluder) which means that you are continually disturbed by people in the corridor outside aswell. It is a shame that a nice hotel with brilliant hard working staff (they really were good) is spoilt by such poor design. There are also sometimes open-air concerts in the squares near the hotel which you can hear even 30 floors up through the non-opening double glazed windows, although these do seem to finish before about 11 p.m. The hotel is nice, but I would not stay here if you are a light sleeper or are irritated by noise.

Reviews.Title: “a great place whether you're there to relax or explore”
Reviews.Author: singinintherain38
Reviews.Content: It's an elegant hotel on the Inner Harbor with a stunning view if you're lucky enough to get a harborview room. Aside from the creature comforts that the Marriott Hotels offer--those cushy beds and avalanche of pillows--the location is terrific: walk to Little Italy and Fells Point for fine restaurants and interesting shops, or stroll the harbor and take in museums, aquarium, ships, and restaurants--mostly franchised restaurants on the harbor itself. We stayed here for two nights when my husband had a biopsy scheduled at Johns Hopkins. Using Priceline, we were able to enjoy a level of comfort that wouldn't have been available to us otherwise. We checked in on a Sunday night and were upgraded to a harborview room without even asking. At no time were we made to feel inferior because we had booked through Priceline. The only complaint we had was the price of a wireless internet connection--$10 a day in your room, somewhat cheaper in the lobby, but that seemed ridiculous for a 4 star hotel. The $22 daily parking fee was high, but it is the city and you are in a premier location so it's really not outrageous. Since we generally do not eat in hotel restaurants, we can't comment on the restaurant--there are many dining options nearby. All in all, it was a wonderful place to stay during a stressful time, and it would make a wonderful base for a weekend at the Inner Harbor--a lively, stimulating place. We would later stay a few blocks away at the Reniassance on the Inner Harbor; both are comparable & each has its own set of advantages.

Reviews.Title: “HIgh quality, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJFrequentTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waterfron Marriott for 5 nights for a confernece. I had been there in the past, prior to the renovations, and the hotel was good before, but more sleek and modern now. The room (on the concierge floor) was spacious and modern. The concierge lounge was comfortable and never busy, with a nice breakfast buffet and evening snacks and bar. In general, the service was excellent and the food and drinks of a high quality. The inner harbor area also offers plenty of evening dining options within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Marriott Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: travelinslacks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront 3 nights for a conference that was being held there. It is a very clean, bright, beautiful hotel. Every employee I spoke with was very kind and helpful. The hotel has recently been remodeled and updated and it shows! The rooms are large and gorgeous. The beds are very comfortable with plenty of pillows. The bathroom had plenty of towels, a makeup mirror, a good hair dryer, and toiletries from Bath & Body Works. There is a snack bar/fridge in the TV stand. As is usual, a Snickers bar costs $3.25, but if you are hard up for a snack or drink, it's there. The TV is a big flat screen, not a lot of channels to pick from though. Most notably no WGN which meant no Cubs games! There is a lounge/bar, a restaurant, and a snack/gift shop in the lobby. The breakfast buffett is very good, but a little pricey at around $14. There are several great restaurants within a block or two. Little Italy is right next door. The ballrooms and meeting rooms were all very nice and bright. There were stations with water and coffee outside nearly every area of rooms. Restrooms are easily found everywhere. The Water Taxi runs April through September in good weather and it stops right at the hotel. This makes getting to all the inner harbor attractions a snap. If nothing else, at $9 for a whole day pass, it is a great way to relax and sightsee. I highly recommend this hotel to a business traveler with an extra day or so take in some of the charm of Charm City. A family would enjoy this too, but the cost for dinners and transportation other than the water taxi may break the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Marriott Property”
Reviews.Author: Pir8guy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property a couple of times. My most recent visit was my best one yet. I was in town for a conference, and recieved an upgrade to a corner room. It was an extremely nice room, large and modern. It had wrap around windows, with a great view of the waterfront. It also had a great view of the new hotel construction going up right next door. For now, nothing blocks your view, and it can be entertaining to look down on all the activity. However, that hotel is going to block up 1/3 of the view, so Marriott can't be too pleased about that. The room had a flat screen HD, and had HD channels as well, which was cool. It also had an array of hook ups, and if you were well prepared, it would be easy enough to hook in your laptop and run a DVD on to the flatscreen. One tiny gripe: aside from the desk chair, the only seating was a chaise. What the heck am I going to do with a chaise? It was uncomfortable, and really a waste. Put in a comfortable recliner, and you get 5 stars. This property is close to many excellent restaurants, bars and sights. If I returned to Baltimore, this would be one of the first properties I'd check.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: TheForce04
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Baltimore, and we were pleasantly surprised. Much of the city felt new, exciting (i.e. ballparks), great restaurants (all over the place), and lots of things to do and see (i.e. shopping!!). Stayed that the Waterfront Marriott - very nice. Great view of the inner harbor. The bed was very comfortable. There seemed to be some residuals left overs (i.e. balloon strings) taped to the ceiling, but could see how it would be overlooked by the cleaning staff. Very friendly Irishman at the front desk. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NPotomac4
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the 30th floor overlooking the Inner Harbor and the sports stadia. Stayed with 2 kids. Good indoor pool. Very nice lobby. Rooms were spacious and more than adequedate. Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel with Service to match”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper516
