Reviews.Content: I did not initially plan on staying in Baltimore on business and booked the best price I could find in downtown. The six year old Baltimore Marriott Waterfront has had some recent room renovations, since the Four Seasons and Hilton are building new hotels next door. Service is usually the thing that makes or breaks most of my hotel and dining experiences. The front desk, concierge, bellman and room service were superior. The hotel public areas were beautifully appointed, clean and fully staffed. During the business day, the hotel staff treated my wife with professional and friendly service. The concierge offered excellent assistance. The hotel swimming pool, fitness center and free use of the nearby MAC fitness club was wonderful. The 28th - 32th floor rooms (seperate elevator) are the most newly renovated. Our 29th floor king bed room had marble topped sinks, a bed so comfortable that you did not want to get up, 32" flat screen TV, the most complete business center desk that I have ever used, and a sitting area with view of the East Inner Harbor. Fantastic first class experience. This is the only place I will stay in Baltimore. Goodbye to the worn Inner Harbor hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: 3amigosmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for a conference and got the conference rate of $209/night. From the BWI airport, it was a quick 25 minute drive via taxi. I was surprised at the lack of traffic at 5:30 pm. The check-in process was very smooth and I received a room on the 27th floor that has a great view. Of course, i checked out the bathroom first - they have Bath and Body Works amenities. I was disappointed that the maid service was stingy with refilling my bathroom amenities. (I save the toiletries for donations to a Juvenile Detention Center that my children's school sponsors). The bed was very comfortable and there were 3 big pillows and 3 small pillows. I felt like a pampered queen in the king sized bed. Even though construction was taking place, I hardly noticed it. The staff was very nice. The hotel's location is fantastic and they are really close to a lot of restaurants and stores (Filene's basement, Little Italy, ESPN Zone, PF Chang's, seafood restaurant, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiteObelisk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick overnight. Beautiful hotel with nice size room and incredible view. Parking was a bit over the top at $21 on a weekend. This is Baltimore, not Manhattan, folks. Overall, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: popeye2625
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Waterfront from February 29 through March 2. I felt as though the staff had just completed super service training or something -- every single person we encountered greeted us and asked what he/she could do for us. It was so completely consistent across every employee we encountered. The location can't be beat, which is especially super if you have kids. Our toddlers were treated like celebrities and loved it. The only complaints we had -- the pool water seemed a bit dirty/slimy to us ... valet parking was a fortune at $36 ... pricey in-room movies for children ($13.99 a pop) .... no "fun" for kids on the room service menu (no sundaes, no popcorn, etc.) We could get over all of these for what we payed via Priceline, however, if I paid more for my room, I would have been miffed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: MarcoMom17
Reviews.Content: We had an early morning appointment at Johns Hopkins and, because of the impending bad weather, decided to spend the night in Baltimore. The hospital recommended the hotel since they have an agreement for reduced room rate with the Marriott. Not only did we get a sizeable reduction in rate, but we also received vouchers for roundtrip taxi fare from the hotel to the hospital As a result of this we were not expecting a whole lot but, to our immense surprise, we have rarely enjoyed a hotel stay as much. From the time the valet tok our car and warmly welcomed us to Baltimore and the Marriott, until we checked out (late) the next day, we could not come up with a single complaint. After the bellman ushered us to our room he spent twenty minutes giving us a visual tour of the highlights of the city from our very large picture window. When he learned that our visit to Hopkins brought us to Baltimore he entertained us with stories of the times he had been put back toegether by the medical staff, there, and wished us good luck for our visit the next day. The room was very large, with a nice ceramic tile entrance foyer, large bathroom, and beautifully decorated with all the latest in plumped up beds, European duvets, and oodles of pillows, as well as a 42" flat screen TV. We requested a refrigerator to chill some medication and one was promptly delivered and set up in the foyer. Arriving late, we decided to eat dinner in the Grill off of the Lobby and had a top-notch steak dinner with Ceasar salads. When the waiter had a question about the rareness of my steak order, he hand delivered the Chef to the table to make certain that the meat was cooked to my satisfaction. The special effort paid off because the meal was perfect in every respect. After dinner, we checked in with the Concierge to alert them that we were expecting a delivery of some medication and they promised that, if the delivery was late, they would take care of refrigerating it until morning, rather than bother us. The attention to detail by every single hotel employee was stunning. The room service attendant who delivered our breakfast was delightful and efficient and the hotel pastries were divine. All in all, from the quality of the luxuriously fluffy towels to the elegant bed linens this hotel lived up to anyone's five star rating. In addition, it couldn't be in a better location overlooing the harbor, the shops and restaurants, sport stadiums, and the twinkling lights of the city. And, oh yes, there's a Starbucks right across the street! The only negative that I could possibly find is the $36. charge for valet parking. And, iunfortunately, this is the price we pay for a stay downtown in any vibrant U.S. city.! We certainly can't wait to go back for a fun weekend in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Staff Doesn't Relax Guests”
Reviews.Author: Bagan
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room on the 30th floor overlooking the harbor and expected a lot from this pricey Marriott -- but it didn't deliver. The housekeeping staff were in the halls by 9 AM noisily moving cleaning equipment and chatting loudly. Security people and other staff wandered halls with loud walky-talkies. Was this to wake people up so rooms could be serviced? On the plus side, the gym was spacious with a harbor view but the TV audio was set to LOUD and there was a personal trainer there yelling over the TV noise to instruct a client. All in all, we found the human noise level not conducive to a relaxing stay and so unnecessary. We were glad to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, nothing much to add”
Reviews.Author: metalhead
Reviews.Content: After reading many prior reviews, I really have nothing to add. We were here for a conference, the facility and staff are excellent. I had breakfast room service and it was on time and there was good portions. The shower water is very hot (nice!), but the indoor pool was chilly. They said they just replaced the heater so it had not heated yet. They have a nice fitness center too, with water bottles and towels provided. For many people, this place is too expensive, but you are on the waterfront in a top notch motel, within walking distance (safe) to many things.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: pugsnbugs
Reviews.Content: I got a room here on priceline for only $100 but would be willing to pay very close to rack rate in the future. The staff is amazing and made me feel at home. the rooms are well appointed, and the view was breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaxTerra
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip, and I believe this hotel is great for conferences. They have a large lounge/room with ample seating for small group discussions or to read and pass the time between sessions. Also, with the inner harbor build-up in recent years, there are lots of good restaurants in walking distance. And the hotel has a decent fitness center that is open 24 hours with free bottled water and apples. The room was comfortable and had a nice harbor view. Housekeeping did a good job with cleaning the room. On the other hand, we had a number of small-ish annoying problems: 1) Room service messed up our order, and it took a long time to get it fixed. Eventually, a manager called our room and offered a refund for the mistake. 2) The minibar was never replenished during our stay. 3) We tried to order a movie in the room, but our room had not been activated. After 3 calls, visits from 2 separate employees, and about 45 minutes, we were able to watch a movie. They were in the process of remodeling rooms, including the floor below us. There was some noise, but it wasn't too disruptive. Overall the staff were friendly and helpful (except the person on the "At Your Service" phone duty).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: jpsof
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2-nights for a weekend getaway. Excellent location and staff. Cost for parking was very expensive (~30/night) but valet service was excellent. If in Baltimore again, would certainly stay at the Marriott Waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location & the service”
Reviews.Author: Centreneil
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location. While it can be a little expensive, the location is well worth the money. We had a great stay, the staff was very responsive. Any number of great Batlimore restaurants are well within walking distance - even in cold weather.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kwebsnyc
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for the marathon and got a fantastic deal on Priceline for the Marriott Waterfront. The location was perfect, very close to the inner harbor and all the stadiums, but pretty quiet right outside the hotel. Our room was very nice and clean with extremely comfortable beds. The front desk was very helpful and sent up a roll-a-way bed just a few minutes after I asked for it. All in all, it was a perfect hotel for our weekend. I am amazed I was able to get a good deal on it the weekend of a Ravens game and the marathon. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott is a good consistent chain”
Reviews.Author: vlfrance
Reviews.Content: This is likely one of Marriott's higher end hotels because of the location and I think it should get 3.5 stars but that's not an option--therefore I've given 4. In general, Marriott is like the Sheraton, in my view, in that they are chains that have consistent service and quality and this is a good thing. You know what to expect. Specifically, this was my third stay in as many years at this particular hotel and for a conference each time. The rooms are clean and comfortable and well-maintained, as well as are the common areas. At the same time though the rooms and the meeting area restrooms are a little worn. It's easy to overlook this considering the cleanliness and the staff attentiveness and pleasantness. I prefer smaller, boutique-like hotels, but I was pleased with my stay at this hotel most recently and in the past two years.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Valet Parking!”
Reviews.Author: cascadesjn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good, right in the middle of everything so you do not have to move your car. As Platinum Mariott Members we've been to more than a few Mariotts this year and we chose valet parking because we felt there would be a certain degree of security and care for our new vehicle. Unfortunately, here it was not the case and it wasn't until we got home from our 5 day stay that we found a heavy ding in the rear passenger door - obviously from another vehicle's door having been slammed into ours. We also noticed that a better ink pen that we keep in the console was taken as well. (We never used our car during the stay so this was not a accident on our part.) We continued to store our car in valet and at $32 per day we expected better. Too bad....but we still enjoyed everything else this hotel had to offer and will certainly visit again - we just won't let them touch our car!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: buckeyes15
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great weekend in Baltimore. We had 2 rooms on the 29th Floor, both corners with fantastic views of the inner harbor. We all liked the location of the hotel, across the harbor and a little bit away from the hustle and bustle over there. The hotel is near several new luxury condo buildings and there are great little stores nearby (Haagen Daas, Whole Foods...etc.). Overall, we had a great stay and I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: beakr
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, enjoyed my time at this place, Hotel was first class the only problem was that at check out all four of our rooms had additional charges that we had to have removed. Almost all other at the meeting at the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dac
Reviews.Content: Stay at Marriott Waterfront, Aug. 12 to Aug 14, excellent stay. Booked on Priceline at $79 a night, great rate. The hotel staff was great, upgraded my room for $30 more a night, got a king size bed, bigger room, better view of harbor, without a problem. Breakfast was awful at the hotel, at 15.99 for buffet, you expected better, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It was good but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: kellzz
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel that my boyfriend and i stayed at during our weekend trip. most hotels were booked bc of convention that was going on. I'll be honest, i had very high expectations for this hotel prior to the trip. My bf and I stayed our first night at the Marriot Residence Inn (which was excellent btw). and thought that maybe the waterfront hotel might exceed resience inn...boy was i wrong!!! the first thing we noticed when we got into our room was the chunk of long blonde hair that was stuck to the desk chair!!!! kinda gross if you ask me...also the beds were HORRIBLE!! i literally woke up every hour because it felt like i was SINKING into the bed!!!!! Oh and there is no free continental breakfast despite how much money you're already forking up for the room...instead they oucharge y $20!!!!! (free at residence inn) Oh and the indoor pool is JOKE!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury room - Average three star room”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTraveler07
Reviews.Content: We requested a King room but they were all sold out and were given a room with two doubles. We were offered to upgrade to a technology room for an additional $30 and that would have internet service and a flat screen TV. We just took the regular room which was just your average room.There was nothing four stars about it - it was clean but it was small and stuffy. Definitely not worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Great local for 4th of July and Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: lvshack
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10-year-old boy, 7-year-old girl , and I stayed at this hotel for the 4th of July celebrations at the Inner Harbor, Baltimore. We made the reservations specifically requesting a harbor view room, which they kindly gave us for no additional fee. All in all, I was impressed with the size of the rooms, and how clean the room appeared. At check in, we requested a small fridge, and within 5 minutes one arrived at our door, free of charge. This hotel is great for Inner Harbor attractions. You can either walk to the Science Center, shops, eateries, restaurants, and Aquarium, or you can take the water taxi, located right outside the front area of the hotel. It cost our family $28 for an all day taxi pass. We liked that the hotel was close to the attractions, but not so close that we felt overwhelmed with crowds. There is a indoor pool with a lifeguard on duty, which is rare. The pool is not very big, but adequate for a small distraction with the kids. There are two restaurants on site, but with all the selection in the area, we choose to eat elsewhere. For eating in this area, there are many choices. There is a Cheesecake Factory, and Ruth Chris Steak House, as well as many other well-known restaurants in walking distance. Skip the restaurant next door, McCormick & Schmick's, as it is overpriced, bad food, and even worse service (e-mail me if you need details). If you want good seafood go to the Rusty Scupper or Legal Seafood. There is also an ESPN zone, and Hard Rock within walking distance. We did get room service for breakfast the next day - it was very good, large portions, and very fast. They have a concierge level, which includes access to the concierge lounge. Free snacks, bottled water, sodas and continental breakfast, are included in your room rate. We requested this level, but they were booked. They did, however, give us access to this area for an additional $20, which I thought was a good deal. The lounge overlooks the fireworks as well. They are building something right in front of the hotel, and the noise might wake late sleepers up. We woke up around 9 a.m. and didn't hear anything. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel for families, or couples wanting a get-away weekend. If you go for the 4th, make sure you can see the "Domino Sugar" sign from your room. That is where most of the fireworks are set off. We were on the 20th floor, and could see fireworks for miles and miles in the nearby cities. Also, since they are building right in front of the building, make sure that whatever they are building doesn't obstruct your view of the harbor from your room. Last year we stayed in Washington, D.C. for the 4th of July. We rented a penthouse room that overlooked the mall. I recommend Baltimore to D.C. - less crowds, nicer people, and more selections!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel To Visit The Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: 68braveheart
Reviews.Content: PERFECT inner harbor location, the Marriot Baltimore Waterfront features a location overlooking the harbor,but not in the middle of the crowds. New upscale restaurants are popping up around this hotel, so you can walk to dinner and feel safe. The inner harbor is continuing to build hotels, bars etc and this is a great weekend or midweek getaway. Rooms are decent size with very comfortable beds, good size bath and shower with good water pressure. The hotel offers a breakfast buffet for $16 dollars which is actually a fair deal for the area. You can have anything you wish cooked to order without a hassle. Concierge service, bell staff and valet are all friendly and helpful. Water taxi ($8 per day) is located at the Marriot to travel to main harbor place. Fells Point and other locations can be reached with transfer to another taxi. If you are in any shape to walk, do so. Everything around the harbor is within ten to fifteen minutes. If you stay by the water, you will be safe. At night, do not wander out of the harbor area on foot, for this is still Baltimore. One drawback to the Marriot is some of their wallet pinching features such as $2 dollars per day for the in room safe, $10 dollar internet connection charge......Can't really complain due to my $75 dollar per room rate via priceline. Simply unbeatable! Last minute plans via priceline will get you great hotels at unreal prices! We would not hesitate to return to this hotel or the Baltimore Inner Harbor again.. ps - if you like cool little pubs, visit Slainte in Fells Point for a touch of Irish hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best value for the price for business traveler”
Reviews.Author: ray-may
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business conference here and found that for business travelers, the value and functionality of the hotel didn't seem to match the fairly high price (for that area). The standard room was somewhat small and had two double beds that were only moderately comfortable. The desk/work area was pretty small, not the right height for someone using a laptop and the internet service was rather slow and required an ethernet cable connection rather than Wi-Fi in the room. The minimally-adjustable chair contributed to the problem of trying to work. The water-saving shower head also didn't give a particularly relaxing shower. On the other hand, the wake-up call giving the daily weather report was a nice touch. Our conference was in one of the large conference rooms which was spacious but was a very long rectangular-shaped room with only modest sound capabilities and inadequate projection capacity - a real negative when trying to give a visual presentation at one end to a large audience. The food quality for the breakfast and snacks was good and they served Starbuck's coffee. The temperature control for the conference room, however, was not easy to regulate. The biggest drawback was the cost and pain of trying to access the conference room's Wi-Fi service. Their main restaurant on the lobby level was beautifully decorated with an open kitchen and generally nice staff but the response time to get seated, get our food and then our check was excessive. The bar across from the restaurant served the same food as the main restaurant and seemed a little faster. The business services were not as transparent and complete as one would like and again, not at the level one would expect from this type of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: travelsafe2006
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront and both visits exceeded my expectations. During this stay, I was upgraded to a suite at no additional charge, which was very spacious and had windows that spanned two walls with spectacular views of Inner Harbor. Bathroom ammenities include Bath & Body Works shampoo and conditioner, and nice fluffy towels. I was attending a conference and got a reduced rate, so I probably would not pay regular price to stay here on vacation. The only downside was the $10/day charge for internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: GamecockGirl
Reviews.Content: I recently had a weekend stay at this hotel, and I would definitely stay here again. The hotel gets solid marks for efficient check in. I had a discounted room ($160 a night), and I think the lower rate may have influenced the room I actually got, which was a room that was made to be accessible for handicapped individuals. It appeared that the hotel was very full -- several wedding receptions were happening there, and lots of tourists buzzing around. The room itself was nice -- beautiful view of marinas at the waterfront, decorated well, clean, etc. It's not a luxury hotel, in my opinion, but it's an upscale hotel with some nice touches. The bathrooms feature complimentary Orange and Ginger Bath and Bodyworks products, which I adore. The only complaint I would register on the room is that the walls were very thin, and I felt that the guests next door sounded as if they were actually IN our room. The lobby is beautiful - spacious, welcoming, attractive - with lots of marble and decorative touches. We had drinks at the hotel bar on Saturday night and found the service to be very good. Prices at the hotel bar weren't cheap, but the ambience is nice. The area where the hotel is located is one of the growing parts of the downtown area, with many new restaurants, condos, and office buildings preparing to open. The hotel itself appears to be fairly new. One big perk -- the hotel has a stop for the Inner Harbor water taxi right outside the entrance. It's $8 per person for a ticket that allows for travel the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but nice location”
Reviews.Author: Smoothtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and 10 and 12 yr old stayed Apr 6-7. We got a room with two double beds. The room was very small, and got smaller the longer we were in it! Two nites was enough. The mattresses sagged, and the floor was sloping! If we were there longer, I would have asked for a change. Good thing I read previous reviews so I did ask for a mini fridge, and it was provided at no charge. The good-- indoor pool very nice with a lifeguard (very unusual). The pool is adjacent to a rooftop patio with great views; however, the patio was locked the second day we were there. The public spaces are nice. There was an entire family watching cartoons on the plasma tv in the lobby; probably trying to spread out a bit. Unfortunately, we were wanting a quiet drink in the lobby and didn't want to listen to cartoons! James Joyce Pub, Flemmings and Roys is right around the corner. Little Italy is quite close and easily walkable, as is Power Plant Live and the Aquarium. However, the Science Center was a good 15 minute hike. Not bad for us, but little kids might get tired. I would have to say it is pretty close to the Inner Harbor. The bad- the rooms are just too small for a family. Also, when I asked for a 'view', I was told I could have one for $20 more a night. I declined, and was glad. The room we got was the same size as a 'harbor view'. And, we could still see the water and Little Italy. Also, we didn't want to be in the room long enough to enjoy the view anyway. The bellhops make a killing at this hotel, and the valet parking is $32 - self park for $21! There is a small takeout coffee/pastry shop I discoverd this trip. It would have been nice to have the check-in girl tell me that instead of having me discover it; It's kind of hidden. As you can imagine, the food is pricey! Don't do the breakfast buffet here on Sunday unless it's on an expense report!. The concierge was too busy chatting with her co-worker to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYBuddy33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Excellent location within easy walking distance to Inner Harbor sights and restaurants, yet removed enough from the hustle and bustle of the Inner Harbor area. It is also near enough to Fells Point neighborhood. We walked 3 blocks to an excellent Little Italy restaurant - La Tovola. Our room was clean and spacious with a partial view of Inner Harbor. Staff was friendly and efficient. If you are in town for baseball, it is a hike to Camden Yards. Parking is $21 per night, but in line with area rates.

Reviews.Title: “High ceilings, high prices”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: This is a fine, comfortable hotel, but needs someone to alert the manager that (a) it's 2007, not 1977 and (b) even upper end business travelers are irritated by price gouging for basic business services. It's comfortable, clean, convenient, and features the usual nice Marriott extras, but also has pricey and under-delivering room service, pricey internet access (hello...time for free wireless guys), and a very iffy desk staff. Also, this hotel does not do towel and sheet water conservation, which puts it behind the times. Hope they'll get with the program.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Auserinlexky
Reviews.Content: Pluses: 20th floor room had great view, spacious room, pretty quiet, close to harbor, nice fitness room. Requested a refrigerator and got one at no extra charge. Fell's point nearby with a variety of pubs/restaurants. Great burger and best onion rings at Duclaw; beer way overpriced. minuses: Had to request that housekeeping NOT spray what they must consider to be air freshener, they finally did not on the third day. I recommend if scents are an issue for you that you make this request strongly upon checking in, and perhaps even speak directly to the housekeeper. parking very expensive if you pay BUT there are a limited number of 24 hour free on street spots just a block away on President Street, I got lucky around 9PM each day and found a spot, just pay close attention to the signs. Pool was too chilly. Restaurants on Harbor very expensive, but check out McCormick and Schmick's happy hour specials. Crime is awful in Baltimore (56 murders in first 71 days of 2007) so do not venture too far away on foot or after dark. Expect lots of panhandlers in Inner harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “First rate hotel on the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: tpapi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned after a one-night stay and were quite impressed. After having previously stayed at both the Hyatt and the Renaissance, we would probably rank this one as the best of the Inner Harbor properties. First and foremost was the staff. They were excellent. We hardly had to wait for our bags, car, or the roomservice. Everyone was friendly with the front desk representative handing me a gift bag complete with an apple, potato chips, and a bottle of spring water at check-in. This was a nice touch and helped to set the tone for a great weekend. Our room on the 14th floor was clean and spacious with a wonderful view of the harbor. In fact, most of the hotel rooms are designed so that you can have a nice view regardless of vantage point. The pool and fitness area on the fifth floor, while small, has a patio where you can walk out and get a great view of both the harbor and the downtown skyline. It's worth a few pictures. The Marriott is a about a five to ten minute scenic walk to the National Aquarium and all of the restaurants including Ruth's Chris Steakhouse and McCormick & Schmick's. You can't beat the location. You cross over a pedestrian bridge and you are right there. The area is also really great for runners and bicycle enthusiasts. We paid about $220 for the night on the Marriott site but felt it was fair considering this is a legitimate four-star hotel. We enjoyed ourselves and would definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: jessba15
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel on multiple occasions for business and was very excited when we "won" it through priceline, but it ended up being a disaster! Upon checking in, we noticed an overly strong smell in our room. After a few minutes, when it didn't go away, we called downstairs and requested a new room, then went off to enjoy a romantic dinner. When we returned to the hotel, we tried 3 more rooms. All smelled the same, like overpowering perfume/carpet cleaner . (A porter told us that they have been having problems due to the new non-smoking policy. Many guests are smoking in the rooms and they cover up the smell with cleaning agents.) We ended up having to drive all of the way home at 11pm. Our first- night-away-from-our-newborn/ Valentine's Day was ruined! The hotel would not reimburse us since we bought through priceline, so it was a total waste of our hard-earned money!

Reviews.Title: “Just a little OK”
Reviews.Author: PNMLAW
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family between Christmas and New Years Eve. The staffing was excellent, except for the valet, who were constantly fooling around. We parked across the street instead. The room was OK, with some minor room damage, The rooms were not very private and hall noise was prevalent. The pool was nice. It was not really "waterfront," in that you still had to walk to the inner harbor (10 minutes). Not a big deal, but not as advertised. Nothing awful, but nothing special. I would look for something different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: EK08904
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property on business, and I was happy my office was paying. For the price, and the caliber of the hotel, I would expect a much nicer room. The hotel's lobby and common space is really very nice, as was the meeting space. The sleeping room though, was very ordinary. The room was clean, but very plain and with few amenities. The bathroom was small and nothing special. The one nice piece was the view of the harbor. If I were to return to Baltimore, I would want to try another property. This once just didn't do it for me.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME views of the harbor, nice room”
Reviews.Author: annc123
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Marriott at 10am, just to ask what time we could check-in. To our pleasant surprise, the room was ready and they gave us the keys right away! We took the elevator up to the 27th floor, and were stunned by the view of the harbor. *Definately* request a harbor-view room! The room was very nice but somewhat small (we were traveling with our 2 small children and all of the gear that goes along with that). For dinner, we ordered room service, and it was pretty fast and tasted OK, but was very expensive (as usual). The pool was warm enough for the kids, and they had fun splashing around. The exercise room looked very well-equipped, but we didn't use it. The walk to the Inner Harbor shops and Aquarium was extremely convenient, even with 2 little kids. Value: we got a great rate ($149) plus $21 to park, so I think it was a steal. If we had paid the rack rate of $300+, I might not have been as thrilled! If you can get a good deal on a room, I'd definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lida.15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference from Nov. 28 to Dec. 2. The rooms were nice, the view of the harbour wonderful, and room service was great. From the first moment you step into the lobby, you are greeted by elegance and great service. I must say that the best part of the hotel is that it is located right on the water, by the marina. You can see the boats from your room, and if you feel like walking, just step out of the lobby onto the walking path that goes around the inner harbour. Absolutely fantastic. If I ever to go to Baltimore again, this would definitely be my choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If your company isn't paying, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: ChristianFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Waterfront while in Baltimore on business. Good location relative to waterfront activities. Unremarkable room. Botched room service. Attitude from the front desk. For the $375/night I expected much more. No comparison to the Marriotts I've stayed in in NY, DC and other big cities.

Reviews.Title: “Should be better for the price”
Reviews.Author: RichardZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. For the price, I think it should have been a more rewarding experience. One night, the cleaning crew was working at 10:00PM. When I called to complain, the front desk said it was because a group had just checked out, give me a break! The location it great and the folks running it did smile and seemed to enjoy their jobs. The business room is outstanding. I just expect a little bit more for $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: karenangel
Reviews.Content: We spent four days in Baltimore and were very happy staying at the Marriott Waterfront. The premises are very clean and decorated very tastefully. The front desk staff were very pleasant and helpful throughout our stay as were the concierge, bellhops and valets. The room was wonderful. We had a beautiful view of the harbor and the bed was even more comfortable than home! The upscale linens and down duvet were an unexpected treat for a hotel bed. We had the breakfast buffet one morning; nice selection of items including fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, yogurt, eggs, omelette station, bacon, sausage, pancakes and more. There was also a bakery/coffee shop on the premises that was nice for a quick breakfast or evening snack. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to area attractions and the water taxi stand was right outside the front door. The only negatives I can think of are the added charges such as the $2 a day safe charge and the above average cost for valet parking. Also, on one day of our stay, our room was not cleaned until 5:00 pm, right when we were returning from a day out to get ready for dinner. Although this was a slight inconvenience, it will definitely not keep us from staying here again during our next trip to Baltimore in the spring!

Reviews.Title: “One of the better kept Marriots”
Reviews.Author: v99
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many Marriots and I have to say this is one of the better ones - beds, furniture and bathroom are all in very good condition and not in need of any renovation. Of the two Marriots in Baltimore, Waterfront is more upscale than Camden Yard. Beds are super comfortable. This Marriot uses duvet cover which I prefer. Other Marriots I have visited use a quilted comforter - probably just my own neurosis - but I always wonder how often those get cleaned. In room coffee service is nice, but it is located in the bathroom - which i thought was kind of gross. Things to watch out for - every amenity has an additional charge - room safe - $2/day Internet access - $10/day valet parking - $32/day! - there is a self serve car park just across from the hotel - we didn't use it , but it could save $$ This hotel is walking distance to many tourist attractions - Little Italy, Aquarium and Power Plant. I got a priceline rate of $160 which I thought was a good value, but I think if I would have paid rack rate of $350+ I would not have been as pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Not Terribly Impressed”
Reviews.Author: caf123
Reviews.Content: I'm just thankful that I had a conference rate and didn't pay full price, as there were too many inconsistancies to be impressed. I stayed 4 nights, and only one time did I receive additional conditioner. The rest of the stay I was left with the same soap, shampoo and other amenities that were there the first day. I had to call down and request additional coffee for the in-room coffee maker, as well as the key to the mini-bar on the third day. When I opened the mini-bar I found a missing item and had to call down to make sure I wasn't charged for it. Upon receiving my final bill I found a $2/day charge for the safe/refrigerator and I had to explain that I didn't use the safe at all and only used the mini-bar for two of the four days, so they did credit me two days. My colleague was charged for all four days and never used either. The location was nice, the room was larger, the bedding was very comfortable. The front desk individuals were very pleasant and check-in and check-out was quick, even with the time it took to reverse some of the charges. Overall - an okay stay, but I felt nickel-and-dimed and that was paying less than $200/night. I would look elsewhere for my next stay to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect birthday present”
Reviews.Author: princess3182
Reviews.Content: I booked one night at the Marriott for my boyfriend and I to enjoy the fourth of July and his surprise birthday. (which was on the 3rd) We are native to Balitmore and knew that the Marriott boasted a beautiful view along with a short walking distance to McCormick and Schmick which is where I chose for his surprise birthday dinner. The room was wonderful and better than I could have possibly imagined. I booked us a King bed (which was so nice. i've never slept on such a comfortable and plush hotel mattress) along with the best view in the harbor. Our room was on a corner so our walls were windows!!! The room was quiet, clean, safe and beautiful. I can't even begin to explain how perfect it was. We went and enjoyed our dinner and spent a wonderful evening in the room watching fireworks out of the left window and out of the right window. With a panoramic view of the harbor, we could chose which fireworks to watch! We placed a room service breakfast card out that night and woke up to a wonderfully prepared breakfast that was also wonderful. It was a bummer to have to go back home. I felt like we were a world away from home but really, we were just 20 minutes. The whole 15 hours we spent there was by far the most expensive 15 hours of my life, but well worth it for his enjoyment for his birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at Harbour”
Reviews.Author: DugansView
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott Waterfront in Baltimore for my husbands birthday. The room was clean and the beds nice and soft like I like them, some of the best bedding at any hotel I stayed at. The view was great!!! I guess the only negatives would be we have a son who loves to swim and the pool was really small and got crowed real easy, and the floor in the bathroom had black marks all over it. Overall it was a good experience especially since we got a great deal through Priceline. It was an Average 4star! But I would go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband had to come down to Baltimore for business and instead of being left behind my toddler son and I joined him. After reading many reviews of local area hotels we chose this one and have been completely satisfied. There was some confusion when booking the room as we chose a waterfront view but later when my husband added a few more rooms to the reservation for business associates we somehow were downgraded. I caught the mistake on my email confirmation and though I had to phone twice about the situation each person I spoke to was extremely helpful and we ended up with a large corner room with an excellent view. The lobby is gorgeous, the location ideal and the rooms were nice. The bed was very comfortable and we were able to get a refridgerator and microwave in the room free of charge. The room was slightly dated but nice none the less and the bed felt very clean and crisp. The pool was a hit with my son and was clean and enjoyable to use. Most importantly the staff was excellent, friendly and accommodating. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Waterfront A+”
Reviews.Author: centraljay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Waterfront with my husband the last weekend in May. Have been to Inner Harbor several times and have previously always stayed at the Hyatt. Both hotels are beautiful... but we preferred the Marriott. 1) View from room was spectacular. We were on the 27th floor, overlooking the harbor. 2) Breakfast buffet was phenomenal. Hyatt buffet can't compare to the variety of choices at the Marriott. 3) Bed was very comfortable and linens were upscale. 4) Room decor was tasteful. Room was clean and bright. 5) Service.. from check-in to check-out... was great. 6) Hotel is about a 5 minute walk from aquarium.. a little farther to the activities/shops at Inner Harbor. 7) If you want to avoid lots of walking, take a water taxi. It stops right by the hotel. 8) We enjoyed a great meal (pricey, but worth it) at McCormick and Schmick.. about 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Ate outside. Fun. We had a wonderful, relaxing weekend! When we return, we will be staying at the Marriott Waterfront. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: EddieP1957
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and was very pleased. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My room was roomy, and had a breathtaking view of the harbor. I am a nonsmoker, and I have had a couple of unfortunate incidents at competing hotel chains of being given a nonsmoking room, only to find out that someone had indeed smoked in the room. Thankfully, I did not have any such problem with this hotel. The only complaint that I have is with the hotel restaurant (Grill 700). I had three meals there, and each time the food was excellent. However, for two of the meals, service was very slow. Additionally, at these two meals I was given glasses of water that had foreign matter in them, and had to ask for replacement glasses of water. I will assume that this problem was an aberration for this restaurant. In conclusion, I would definitely return to this hotel, and I plan to do so later in the year. Next time around though, I probably will patronize the two restaurants next to the hotel (Flemings and Roy's).

Reviews.Title: “nice place on the harbor”
Reviews.Author: jesse58
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We stayed on a long weekend in April for business with my husband company. The room was done quickly every day and the staff was nice. The company half the weekend and we paid for the last two days. We ate at the buffets and the food was good. My only problem is I am on Oxygen and had set up through my provider the weekend equipment. I called the provider on arrival and they said the tank had been delivered. When I arrived the hotel staff could not find the liquid O2 tank. They didn't know what an O2 tank was at the front desk. I kept getting transferred on the phone to security, and lost and found who both kept telling me they could not find the file. I tried to explain it was a tank and equipment I finally called the manager number and that staff tracked down the trank. It had been placed in the back concierge and no one knew. I think communication could have been better with the staff. Otherwise and enjoyable long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Katya_NY
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to spend two nights in this hotel this week at a very low price, thanks to a discount fare website. The room was great, and the view was unbeatable. I had never been to Baltimore, and I was pleasantly surprised! Our room was on the 20th floor, and the windows looked out over the harbor. We could actually see the whole Inner Harbor, including Camden Yards. We had no service issues and a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, service could be better”
Reviews.Author: PAWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Baltimore Marriott Waterfront for couple of days in January.On the first day I noticed that my shower head was held by a wash cloth and i didn't think much of it. On the last day the shower head fell of and when I called the front desk and the woman didn't sound surprised or sorry, she just said that someone could come up and fix it couple of minutes. Overall the experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Ciaobellissimo
Reviews.Content: The Baltimore Marriott Waterfront is an excellent place for business or leisure, where I recently combined a bit of both. Staff is efficient and friendly, the rooms are spacious and the view is excellent from both city and harbor view rooms (I had a harbor view, my colleague a city view). The bakery/cafe in the lobby was a convenient spot for a quick, albeit pricey, breakfast or sandwich. The shoe shine service, bar with humidor, and swimming pool with a view put the "icing on the cake" of a great extended weekend in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfiest beds in the world”
Reviews.Author: johntarmar
Reviews.Content: Great position and nice large rooms. The beds are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent deal at this hotel through the Marriott website. We only paid 189 per night and got free tickets to the aquarium, free parking, and free breakfast for 2 days at their INCREDIBLE breakfast buffett. Our room would have cost $300+ a night! We were also given a harbor view, which was spectacular. This hotel is on it's own pier in the harbor, the best location to stay in Baltimore. The water taxies even make a stop right outside the hotel! Beautiful lobby and rooms. Very clean. Wonderful place to stay, staff was very nice and helpful to us!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Facility, don't listen to Nay sayers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know what people are talking about. I am an event planner and just held a 6 day conference at the Marriott Waterfront. The staff was curteous and knowledagble. The rooms were always spotless! There is no need for renovation and I never had to ask for anything more than once. We had over 400 participants at the conference and not one person had a complaint. This is a great hotel with great food and staff. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the east end of the Inner Harbor and so Harbourplace tourist sites, Little Italy and Fell's Point can be reached on foot. Auto and water Taxis line up at the entrance to the hotel, and several restaurants are within 1 block. The hotel is big and sparkling, decor is new and modern. The front desk was friendly and efficient. Restaurants, shops, and meeting facilities are all sleek and of good quality. Concierge service was helpful. My room was spacious and conservatively, tastefully decorated with a good sweeping views of the harbour. The bed had a new soft comfortable mattress which was like sleeping on a cloud. The sheets are the expenisve high thread count variety. Bathroom was standard quality. My only criticism is that I neede to call the front desk 3 times to get my minibar key when I arrived, but otherwise, the service was good. I'd definitely stay again, but rates are quite high.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: LemonCake
Reviews.Content: Drove into Baltimore at midnight and needed a place to stay. First choice is always Renaissance right on the harbor (good value for $$), but they had no vacancy. Went to the Marriott down the harbor. Lobby gorgeous, but the rate a little pricey for just staying a night and leaving the next day (but not their problem): $254, valet car park was $30 and with taxes our total was $310 for one night. Nicely decorated, great linens on the beds, good temperature control. Quiet. Bath products are from Bath & Body works (flavors like orange/ginger shampoo). For Sunday morning they had an extensive brunch buffet in the restaurant off the lobby, but we chose to go to the Starbucks counter they have inside the hotel and get muffins and lattes for the road. Efficient service. I would stay there again, but try to get a better rate. Note that the Renassaince, Sheraton, & Hyatt are all closer to the harbor (right ON the harbor) and the Marriott is a 5-minute walk to the attractions, but in a safe area don't worry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service- Great View - Nice Beds”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Contrary to earlier reviews I had no problems with service. Quick check-in & out. Friendly. Eager to help with getting a cab, get boxes, etc. I stayed away from the "sensitive" service fridge. They did mistakenly charge me for a $5 bottle of water which was quickly removed from the bill at check-out. It's not across from the street from the Harborfront - it's a 5-10 minute walk. Close to Little Italy, Power Plant live, etc. Camden Yards is a pretty safe 1/2 hour walk. Nice workout area with TV's at the treadmills, bottled water and towels. An outside sitting area outside the gym/pool area with a nice city view. Small indoor pool, though. I had a wonderful view of the harbor and city from my room . And I did not ask for it ( I was there for a conference - sometImes you get the "bad view" rooms when you are paying a conference room rate but that was not the case here). Very comfortable beds and clean rooms and bathrooms. It was curious that during a 3-day stay they did not replenish shampoo, conditioner, soap, etc. All in all, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “service is so bad”
Reviews.Author: jmilan
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is terrible. We checked in and the deskclerk took 15 minutes to check us in and never told us what was going on..after 15 minutes she then told us our room would not be ready untill 4:00 pm. I was there for a wedding and the even the room for the groom was not ready--I mean how shameful is that!!WE were finally give a room--which is not what we guranteed-the reservation was made in April for August!!!The room had a view of the deck where people sat outside and could look into our room..room was ok but bathroom was awful!! very small and you got the feeling was not clean. The service is just slow and they are not proffesional. The restaurant staff is a joke, I had three meals there and the only one where the service was good was for breakfast--dinner was so bad I went complain to the restaurant manager--he just did not care so I went to the manager on duty at the desk and told him--he did care and said he would follow up.All and all a very very bad hotel experience

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kesigirl
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront hotel and I can't rave enough about it. I won a Priceline bid of $70 the night before our stay. I called ahead and requested a King non-smoking, which was easily guaranteed. I also was able to apply my rewards number. Upon check-in, I received a harborview room by paying $20 extra. What a steal! The room was breathtaking. There was the king bed, two nightstands, chair, work desk (with unlimited internet usage for $9.95), coffeemaker, iron/board, large closet and pristine bathroom. Marble top sink with Neutragena products. Nice showerhead and everything was extremely clean. We requested a rollaway bed, which was free and brought to our room while we were out. Of course, we didn't touch the snack fridge (thanks to reading previous reviews about the cost of opening it). We were on the 25th floor. I barely saw anyone on our floor, so there was no noise. There did seem to be convention people there, but it didn't impact our stay at all. Parking still $20 in the lot -a five minute walk with elevator and escalator rides. No problem. Great having the water taxi out front. I travel alot and I'm a bit of a clean freak - and this was definitely a 4* room and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: relayer
Reviews.Content: We have never been disappointed when staying at a Marriott, no exception here, beautiful hotel. The room was booked for a recent Saturday night through priceline for $80, and what a deal. Checked in right at 3 pm and the front desk gave us a great harbour view room on the 27th floor with 2 full size beds. No problem with the service, courteous and professional. They looked for the best room possible. We were in the section where the hotel branches toward the water, so our veiw was unobstructed. Nice size, clean room with very comfortable beds and lots of pillows. Bathroom was spotless with good water pressure. The hotel was full on this Saturday evening with weddings and conferences, but one would never know from our floor, it was plenty quiet. I don't understand the complaining about the location of this hotel. It's an easy, short walk to such places as the aquarium, Hard Rock Cafe, Power Plant enrtertainment complex, and Fells Point in the other direction. Yes, Camden Yards is on the other side of the harbour, but I enjoy walking. We did not go to a game this trip, but it wouldn't be much further than the Renaissance Hotel, where we stayed last time and did attend a game. Also, for the person who couldn't find Tylenol, they sell all those items in the cafe until 11pm. Other things we noticed: I agree the parking garage is somewhat confusing. We had to take 3 different elevators before we reached our room. I was prepared for the $20 parking fee, so no surprise there. Plenty of parking on Level 6. Having the bottom levels for valet does not bother me. One is going to have to take the elevator anyway. The lobby area was a happening and noisy place this Saturday with lots of people. One big problem with the jazz bar was the smoke, so we didn't stay. The fitness center appeared complete with plenty of equipment for cardio and lifting, although we did not have time for a workout. The pool looked small for a hotel of this size, but we did not use that either.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The architecture of the hotel, its location, and the rooms are outstanding. However, I don't care how great the hotel is, if the service is bad, the place might as well be a Roach Motel! Our room was 3 hours late in being available (made reservation one month prior). The front desk staff was not as helpful as they could have been; when asked if they knew of a place where we could buy Tylenol at 10 pm, the counter woman said "No, try the bartender." When we asked the 4th time if our room was ready, the reply was no and we don't know why. When people spend a LOT of money on a hotel room, there better be good service. This place did not and we will never come back. The Hyatt across town will bend over backwards for you so go there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: marylandmom
Reviews.Content: Terrible! I've just returned from a two night stay at the Waterfront Marriott. The room was average at best and the service was far below industry standards. I was originally given a room on the 12th floor, however the air conditioning was not working. The unit was actually blowing hot air. After THREE calls about the stifling hot room I was finally given another room (at my insistence). Incredibly, the room I moved into also had a poor working air conditioner. The lack of customer service and poor accomodations ensure that I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “What's hot, the rodents are not!!!”
Reviews.Author: iwaslookin
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at this hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Premises appeared to be clean. Room was fairly clean and operable. The bed was comfortable. View of the harbor and city were great. However, we did have a few issues. When we arrived at 1PM our guaranteed room was not ready. $2 a night for a safe, ridiculous. Even Disney World has a free in room safe. Over priced snacks. A toilet with handle that wouldn't seem to stay on. And the real kicker, a mouse/rat visibly running through the snack bar/gift shop area! After seeing that we were afraid to eat anything there. I know most restaurants deal with rodent issues, but when you see them running in open areas you have to suspect they are running in the back also. We also saw rodents on Pratt street. This must be a big problem, because we noticed poison containers place around the outdoor eating area at the restaurants down the street.

Reviews.Title: “A little good and alotta bad at this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from a night at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront. We had a concierge room. We'd had one in DC last year with a great view and good concierge amenities, so we thought we'd do the same this year in Baltimore. The view was spectacular, just magnificent. Breakfast was good but there was not much else of mention regarding food. There was a menu for "drink" prices at the "honor" bar area, obviously they want to charge for drinks, which was not what they told me when I booked the room. There was a man serving oysters, crabs and shrimp. They were good but his transparent bid for a tip was tacky to say the least. There was a very large group of people in the hotel for a delegation, and some of them were partying late into the night. I called the reception desk at 2:20 AM to complain about the noise (in the room right next to ours) which had been going on all night. They did nothing about it and the racket didn't stop until 3 AM. It was one of the worst night's sleep I have ever had. The next morning while we were at breakfast, housekeeping had been in our room. Evidently the bathroom was being readied for cleaning when someone noticed the "Do not disturb' sign hanging on the door. All in all, not a hotel I will stay at again, especially not at the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo4uClinton_NJ
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, lobby, rooms and of course the views. The rooms are very comfy. The only issue was not being able to get an appointment for a massage. My friend made an appointment as soon as we checked-in and was told that it would be tentative as they were trying to get someone to work on Sunday. We received a message that they were not able to get anyone. It happens. The outdoor lounge is wonderful. We were lucky with the weather as it was 76 degrees and dry. If the weather were warmer or more humid it would not have been as pleasant. Great place, location, food, staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richelleh8
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using priceline and got an EXCELLENT rate of $86/night. The going rate for this hotel is normally $159+ so we really lucked out on such a great rate. We were in room 2807 and when we opened the curtains, we were stunned by the GORGEOUS view. We had a priceless view of the city and Inner Harbor. I could not believe our luck. We arrived at 2:00 and were checked in without delay. The staff was very courteous. The hotel was very clean and the staff always welcomed us into the lobby. The porters wear white gloves!! Our room was a n/s king which we had guaranteed before arrival. It was VERY clean and the beds were comfortable. It was VERY quiet. Yes, you can hear the maids in the hallway in the morning, but that should be expected in a large hotel. There's just no way to make the doors soundproof. We checked out the pool area and it was very small but adequate for kids or a quick dip, but certainly not doing laps :) We got bagels and juice from Rigano's and it was 12.75 for two bagels, two muffins and two juices. Reasonable for a hotel. I bought a roll of tums from the small convenience area and they were only $1.04. What a deal. Walking to Inner Harbor, Fells Point and Little Italy is very easy for anyone that is even remotely mobile. James Joyce Irish Pub is in the bottom of the attached parking garage and is worth a stop. We had no problems with the parking garage. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, especially if you can get a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cowlady
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Waterfront Marriott Hotel. The room we had was a King with a full view of the Inner Harbor. Beautiful!!! Our bed was very soft and comfortable. We only ate at the breakfast buffet on the last morning we were there, it was very good but $20 a person. You are charged $2 a day for the safe if you use it or not and they have refreshments in the room candy, pop, beer,wine, chips....but extremely expensive. A regular vending machine size of M&M's were $3.50!!!!..... We wanted to see Washington DC and tour the inner harbor and Ft McHenry.. It was a fun trip... Once in a while you need those educational trips... ok now I am ready for Cancun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: snapple
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 2 years ago with my family and returned this summer after being so pleased with our previous stay. This time, my boyfriend and I spent the weekend in Baltimore - and what a wonderful vacation it was!! We were very pleased with the size of our room; we stayed in a Deluxe Waterfront view room with a king size bed. The room was more than big enough for the two of us, and the view was incredible! We stayed on the 15th floor, which was high enough to see everything! The bed was extremely soft and had 5 feather-filled pillows and a luxurous comforter. If you can afford it, splurge on the room service for breakfast. It'll run you about $30 for two (after the 20% tax!), but it is delicious! And if you want to check out the indoor pool, try to go early in the morning if you want to swim before the younger ones get there. The hotel was just walking distance away from everything, so in about 5-10 minutes, you're in the midst of the Inner Harbor. You can also pay to take a small boat to the other part of the harbor if you don't want to walk. Be sure to check out Hard Rock Cafe, ESPN Zone, and the malls. Also, weekend nights are great for the live music. I have no complaints about this hotel - the staff was friendly, the location is perfect, and the room was huge (and very clean!). If you want to stay at the Inner Harbor, I definitely recommend the Marriott Waterfront. Don't get tricked into spending over $300 for a room at another hotel when you can have a fabulous room here!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your stuff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, close to the Power Plant bars and ESPN zone; also the customer service was good until my car was broken into and then they claimed there was nothing they could do. Overall, that experience made the end of my trip worst but I thought I would tell you to not park in the parking garage next door to the Waterfront hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for Conferences”
Reviews.Author: Roadtravlr
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying I am not a fan of the city of Baltimore..it is not a favorite city of mine at all. That said, I stayed at the Baltimore Marriott Waterfront for a conference. It is right by the water in the inner harbor, so a good place to hang out and eat lunch on a nice day. This hotel is an impressive size and has at least 34 floors (so the elevator can seem really slow). The rooms were clean (of the "executive style") and the facilities were adequate. I will caution the business center is extremely pricey--80 cents a minute for internet access! I am not a fan of major executive-type hotels, since I prefer smaller hotels with more personable service. However it should be noted that the staff was very friendly and very professional. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone on business travel or attending a conference or with a big group.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was better than I imagined. Awesome views of the inner harbor from all angles, we were in a corner room. The beds were comfortable, the people were helpful and the hotel was beautiful. I was extremely impressed with the price for such a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view of the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: dapergs
Reviews.Content: We returned recently from a two night stay at the Marriot. The view is breathtaking ( we were facing the harbor ) and the room was very clean. The location is great, you can catch the water taxis virtually outside the main entrance, and you are in very short walking distance of the inner harbor attractions and Fells Point. Please note however some aspects of our stay that we did not expect for a 4 star hotel. The hotel parking is $20 per day, there is no refrigerator/microwave in the rooms, and the mattresses are VERY soft. My husband and I enjoy sleeping close....but this was ridiculous!!( LOL ) Hope this helps with your decision. Justine ( in VA )

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View of the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonianGal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just celebrated our two year anniversary in Baltimore and we stayed at the Marriott. Though they initially made a mistake with our room (gave us 2 twins instead of the originally requested king) they were quick to change us to a new room. There isn't anything wrong about this hotel, but also nothing too spectacular about this hotel - clean lobby, okay staff, good size rooms, no great ammenities. The only thing I would watch out for is the fact that their bathrooms are very small. The vaccumming from the cleaning staff was very loud in the morning, so its impossible to sleep in late. The bed & bedding is so-so. Parking is a tad expensive- $30. Taxi fare from Penn station to the hotel is only $6, so I suggest taking the train to the city, if possible. The hotel is walking distance to most of the Harbor attractions, but there are other hotels that are closer. Overall= PRETTY GOOD.

HotelInfo.Name: Baltimore Marriott Waterfront
HotelInfo.Address: 700 Aliceanna St, Baltimore, MD 21202
